choices: Ruby
Jaune
Weiss
Yang
Other
1.content:
No one is sure where it came from. There are rumors aliens forged it and left it behind thousands of years ago. Some believed a mad scientist invented it but it was too powerful and caused his downfall. While others preach the gods themselves once wielded the mighty device. All that is known is that this powerful object fell to earth and was lost in time. Until, by sheer coincidence, it found its way to a Hunter Academy called Beacon. A place where children are turned into warriors to fight the monsters called Grimm. Why it wasn’t destroyed by these monsters, will never be known. A Nevermore, the large bird like Grimm, might even have dropped it. None of that matters. All that matters is…

Who found it?

Ruby? The plucky young 15 year old girl who got into Beacon two years early with dreams of being a hero. A young goofy prodigy who wields a massive scythe.
https://static.comicvine.com/uploads/sca...

Jaune? The seventeen year old boy who faked his transcripts to get in, yet is kind of somewhat goofy. He wields a sword and a collapsible shield.
http://vignette4.wikia.nocookie.net/rwby...

Weiss? A seventeen year old perfectionist girl who was jealous Ruby was made team leader with a complex about her lack of assets and short demeanor. She wields a rapier with dust canisters.
http://img13.deviantart.net/1b49/i/2015/...

Yang? A well-developed seventeen your old brawler who likes to party.
http://conceptartworld.com/wp-content/up...

(People who post should know the characters, but I found some pictures anyways.)
1.title: The Discovery

choices: Rush back to Beacon and test it out on the first person she sees.
Be a little more selective on who to try it out on.
Ruby already has the perfect target in mind.
Show it to someone to try it out together.
Other
11.content:
“Phew.”

Ruby wiped the sweat from her brow after decapitating the last Beowolf, a Grimm that vaguely resembled a wolf that walked on its hind legs. She had been practicing a few new moves in the Emerald Forest right outside of Beacon. With no other Grimm in the vicinity, she transformed Crescent Rose, her signature weapon, a high caliber sniper rifle that could transform into a large scythe, back into its compact mode before clipping it onto her hip. She then started to head back to Beacon to hang out with her team. Whistling, she started skipping, happy that her training was bearing fruit.

Something sparkled in the sunlight near a tree and she stopped.

“Did someone drop something?” Ruby thought, heading over to it. The forest was used by all the students at Beacon, so it wouldn’t be uncommon to see things left behind occasionally. As she drew close, a look of confusion formed on her face. “A remote? What would a remote be used for out here?” She picked it up and noticed a small folded up pamphlet underneath it. Her confusion only grew as she read the title.

Your Guide to the Swapping Remote

Something compelled her to read the pamphlet and her eyes slowly widened as she read on. By the time she reached the end, her mouth was wide open.

“This has to be a prank,” Ruby muttered. “But what if it’s not?” She looked back and forth and all around her for someone to pop out and confirm her suspicion. “If something like this is real, I have to try it.” Her only option was to try it out. The temptation was too great for her to ignore and Ruby had always been weak to temptation. It’s why the cookie jar back home was always empty.

The question was; should she use it now or show it to someone first.
11.title: Ruby

choices: "Should Ruby swap bodies with velvet?"
"Should ruby swap heads with velvet?"
"Or should Ruby swap wardrobe with velvet?"
111.content:
While Ruby has just made it back to beacon from hunting down some Grimm in the Emerald forest after finding the mysterious remote, she wanted to test the effects of the remote on someone. Just as Ruby was trying to think up an idea, she notice at certain Faunus girl she know was walking over to a table to sit and study for class exams. It was non other than velvet scarlatina from team Cfvy. "Maybe I should test the remote in her first." Ruby said giving a big grin on her face. "But what to try on her first?" She added. "Perhaps, a body swap couldn't hurt. I could see what it is like to be another species as well of not having to go through puberty." Ruby said in her head excited. "Another button I can try is head swap". "Which would allow me to swap heads with velvet body and her with mine." "One last button on the remote that looks interesting to try is wardrobe swap." "Which would allow velvet and I to swap clothes with each other."
Ruby finished her sentence in her head.

What should Ruby do, swap bodies with velvet? Should she swap heads with velvet? Or should she swap wardrobe with velvet?
111.title: Rush back to Beacon and test it out on the firs...

choices: Body Swap
Wardrobe Swap
Personality/Personal Info Swap
113.content:
Ruby already knew who her first target would be. It was so obvious and she wouldn’t have to say anything before doing it.

Weiss.

Her partner would be the perfect test subject. As they lived together, any swaps could easily be undone and it allowed Ruby to observe the results of said swaps. This was also the opportunity to learn more about her partner. Giggling to herself, she ran as fast as possible. Her speed Semblance allowed her to arrive back at Beacon in no time at all. She dashed up the stairs and turned down the hallway to her dorm.

Nearly crashing into the person she was looking for.

“Watch where you’re going, dolt.” Weiss had barely been able to step to the side and Ruby tripped in the process of trying to avoid her, ending up on the ground. “I thought you were going to waste time in the Emerald Forest?”

“I did,” Ruby bragged, pushing herself up to her feet. “I came back to… get started on my homework.” That was a lie and Weiss had to obviously know that.

“Really?” She raised an eyebrow in disbelief while crossing her arms.

“Yes,” Ruby lied again. “I’ve been thinking. You were right. My grades aren’t as high as they should be because I don’t study hard enough. I still don’t like studying, but I’m trying to get into the habit.” Weiss stared at her for a moment in silence. Ruby felt sweat form on her forehead and her heart stopped.

“Okay,” Weiss said and her expression changed from skepticism to being slightly impressed. Ruby’s heart started beating again. “I’m glad to see you are taking your responsibilities seriously for a change. No one likes studying, but you have to do it. I need to drop something off at Professor Goodwitch’s office and then I’ll be back. If you have any questions on the assignment, I can help you.”

“Thanks a lot, bestie,” Ruby replied and Weiss rolled her eyes. Weiss normally helped by making sure Ruby was reading the right chapters and occasionally proofread her essays. Ruby had an inkling that Weiss would be more helpful this time because she believed Ruby was taking the initiative instead of being forced.

This caused Ruby to feel a little guilty as she raised the remote at Weiss’s retreating back.

Since Weiss was going to be back soon, Ruby didn’t want to Life Swap yet. She limited it to one of the other swaps. The Body Swap button would allow Ruby to become Weiss physically, but everyone else would still see her as herself. Wardrobe Swap was really temping. Weiss never let Ruby try on her clothes. Of course, she hated heals, but it might be fun to walk a mile in Weiss’s shoes. Ruby immediately hated herself for thinking of a Yang pun. The last option was a Personality/Personal Info swap. This would cause them to swap something less physical.
113.title: The Perfect Target

choices: Find more targets to swap with.
Find someoen to show off too.
Check out Weiss's outfits.
1132.content:
There was a flash of light and Ruby couldn’t believe her eyes.

Weiss, whose clothes were nearly all shades of white and blue, was walking away in Ruby’s black dress with red trims. Her signature red cloak covered most of it from view. Weiss’s shoes had also changed to Ruby’s black combat boots. Weiss didn’t seem to notice anything and turned the corner as Ruby stared in disbelief, her mouth agape.

IT WORKS! Ruby squealed internally and jumped into the air.

This was a mistake.

As she landed, she remembered she had Weiss’s outfit It consisted of wedged heeled boots, which were much higher in the back than the front. She was not used to heels of any kind. Ruby learned the hard way to be careful and struggled to her feet, rubbing her aching bottom. How anyone could stand to wear lady stilts was beyond her. At least these boots had a little more support than normal high heels. Ruby noticed her legs and chest felt colder. Weiss didn’t wear tall stockings and her dress wasn’t closed at the top. There was only a little bit of black cloth covering the valley between her breasts. The fact the clothes fit her was not lost on Ruby. Ruby and Weiss were similar size, but they did have different proportions.

Stumbling into her room, Ruby was glad no one else was there. The shoes were making it difficult to walk. It was like walking on her tiptoes and the center of balance was off. Standing before the full length mirror, Ruby finally had the chance to examine herself. She looked exactly the same physically. The only difference was the clothes on her belonged to Weiss. Ruby pulled off the bolero and spun around to admire the strapless dress. The dress started as white at the top and slowly changed to blue as her eyes lowered. The hem was stitched to resemble snowflakes. Her hand played with the silver necklace around her neck as she stared.

“I can’t believe this,” Ruby gasped. “This is so cool! The remote is magic. It has to be. What should I do with it? Should I swap more? Show it to someone?” She tapped her cheek. “I could try on all of Weiss’s clothes. Maybe I should try to figure out why she likes heels so much? She’ll probably be with Goodwitch for forever.”
1132.title: Playing Dress Up

choices: Body Swap
Life Swap
Intelligence Swap
11323.content:
“Well, they’re my clothes now,” Ruby half sang, kicking off the boots and bounding to the closest. “I’ve always wanted to do this.”

Digging through Weiss’s clothes was much less enjoyable than she thought it would be. So many of her clothes looked the same in varying shades of blue and white. It was mostly dresses, but there were a few long sleeve tops to go with her combat skirts. Ruby was glad her partner understood the importance of those, unlike Yang. She pushed aside a few nightgowns and skimmed through the underwear.

Does Weiss really not get anything in any other color? Ruby thought and then shrugged. She wasn’t that different. Most of Ruby’s clothes were red and black, though she did have some other colors. Her pajama bottoms were white with roses on them. Giving up on trying to find some special hidden outfit Weiss was hiding from her, she turned toward the shoes. Why does she need so many? Nearly all of them have heals. There was a pair of slippers that, to her relief, lacked them.

Ruby glanced over her shoulder anxiously. The remote changed reality to make all the shoes hers, but that didn’t change the fact if she had been caught doing what she was going to do normally, Weiss would not have been happy. Like, less happier than usual.

“Looks at me,” Ruby mocked though not with any ill intent. “I like wearing…woah… lady stilts to feel taller and look down at people.” She stumbled and nearly fell over. The shoes she was wearing was one of Weiss’s fancy high heels. With almost no support except a thin stick in the back, Ruby nearly fell over every third step. “How does she walk in these, let alone fight?” She closed her eyes and then frowned.

If she stopped moving like she normally did, her body seemed to know what to do. Her next step was perfectly aligned to avoid any chance of slipping. So was the next one, and the next one. Ruby opened her eyes and focused on the feeling. Her body was acting like she had been wearing heels her entire life. The remote had done more than just swap clothes. It swapped the ability to wear clothes.

At least, that’s what Ruby believed.

She jumped when she heard someone unlocked the door and bolted toward her desk, kicking the heels far in the corner to hide them. This was pointless on her part, as everyone considered them her shoes, but in her defense, she just swapped. Her panic overshowed logic. Ruby just managed to sit at her desk, grab a book and rip it open, before Weiss walked into the room. She turned around to act like she had been studying to find Weiss staring at her.

“Wow,” Weiss stated, looking surprised. “I didn’t expect you to actually be studying.”

“What did you expect?” Ruby asked innocently, as Weiss walked toward her. Besides Ruby’s clothes, she was exactly the same. The way she moved her hips when she walked, the air of importance, everything. Her clothes just had more color.

“To walk in on you playing a game of some kind,” Weiss answered and leaned over Ruby’s shoulder. “Or maybe have your book open to the wrong chapter? One we haven’t covered yet?” Ruby blinked and looked down.

Her book was four chapters ahead of where they were in class.

“I was just… reading ahead?” Ruby lied lamely.

“You, Ruby Rose, who can barely sit reading a text book longer than Nora or Arc, was reading ahead.” Weiss stared at Ruby with her arms crossed. Seconds ticked by in silence and Ruby diverted her eyes. “That’s what I thought.” Weiss sighed and rubbed the bridge of her nose. When she next spoke, her words were a little softer and understanding. “Listen, Ruby. Even if you weren’t the team leader, education is important. You need to study to get ahead, even as a hunter. Doctor Oobleck explained that to us countless times.”

“I know,” Ruby admitted. “But I really don’t like it and everything else just seems funner.”

“More fun,” Weiss corrected her sternly. “Of course it is. You think there wouldn’t be things I would like to do over studying? But I don’t because as an adult, you have to distinguish between your wants and needs.”

“You want to have fun?” Ruby gasped and Weiss narrowed her eyes.

“Funny, almost as good as Yang’s jokes.” Ruby looked like she had just been slap. Saying she wasn’t even as funny as her unfunny sister was below the belt. “How about this? If you can study until we meet up with Yang and Blake for dinner, afterwards, I’ll spar a bit with you and we can try out those new electric dust rounds you got.”

“Really?” Ruby pointed at her dramatically. “No take backs.”

“I won’t. If you hold up your end of the bargain.” Weiss sat down at her desk and picked up her Scroll.

I’ll show you, Ruby thought triumphantly and turned her book to the correct chapter. It only took five minutes for Ruby to groan at how boring this was. She was ready to give up, but caught Weiss’s watching her with a mix of smugness and superiority. I can do this! I have to show her I can. Another few minutes passed and Ruby’s mind began to wander.

Under it fell on the remote.

Another swap won’t hurt, Ruby thought, her hand clenched tightly on the device. A Body Swap might be fun and technically I returned the clothes to the right bodies. She giggled under her breath. Oooo, what about a Life Swap? I could live as Weiss while she tries to study as me. Maybe figure out all her secrets or why she’s so grumpy. Personal Info might also be cool. If I switch our intelligence, I won’t have to study as much. She can be the ‘dunce.’

What does she do?
11323.title: Explore Her New Wardrobe

choices: Ruby enjoys revenge on Weiss in her life.
See what life is like as Weiss around Beacon.
Someone interrupts her plans by knocking on the door.
113232.content:
Ruby hit the button on the remote and experienced the world warp around her.

The first thing she realized was that she was sitting at Weiss’s desk instead of her own. It took a moment to realign her senses when instantly moving from one spot to another. Her speed Semblance was similar from someone else’s view, but it was fundamentally different from her side. Weiss’s scroll was in her hand and she had been looking up some information on a line of clothes from some specific designer. Ruby’s eyes traveled downwards and saw she was wearing her clothes again.

Huh? I hit Life Swap, why am I wearing my clothes… Oh, right. I switched our clothes beforehand. Life Swap was supposed to put her in the target’s life. She only kept her body and the clothes would switch. However, their clothes were swapped beforehand, so Ruby was now living as Weiss, without having her clothes. Something felt off about her head. One side was heavier than the other. Ruby looked into a mirror curiously and her mouth fell open.

White hair tied in a ponytail on one side adorned her head.

Our hair switched too?! Ruby thought in shock, immediately glancing over at Weiss. The remote never mentioned that. Maybe it was some kind of indicator lives had been swapped.

Weiss was sitting at Ruby’s desk, hand propping up her head, as she gazed at the book in front of her with a glazed look in her eyes. Everything except her hair was physically the same. Short black hair with red tips, Ruby’s hair, sat atop her head. The biggest difference Ruby observed was Weiss’s posture and mannerisms. Normally prim and proper, Weiss didn’t slouch when studying. She sat up straight and read the material methodically while taking notes. Now, she looked exactly like Ruby did when studying, bored, uninterested, and wanting it to be over.

Ruby couldn’t believe it. Clothes were one thing, that could be explained through teleportation and Weiss pretending not to notice. Lives were another. There had to be a way to test out if Weiss really believed she was her. Ruby had to act like Weiss and talk to her. As she thought about what Weiss would consider important enough to interrupt Ruby studying, she felt something, like a faded memory swimming to the surface. Wanting to understand what this was, Ruby relaxed and let the thoughts flow to the forefront of her mind. Her mouth opened and words she didn’t consciously consider came out.

“Ruby,” Ruby said. “How is the studying going? Do you understand the material?”

“It’s… coming,” Weiss replied, looking up and then collapsing in her chair. “This is so boring. At least some of the previous chapters contain awesome battle scenes and history of weapons. Why should I care about economic and political struggles?”

“Because those shape our very government,” Ruby answered, not sure how she knew. Her brain just did and instinct was telling her what to say. It quickly sunk in that the remote was helping her act like Weiss to fool others. “Hunters and Huntresses need to understand the big picture, not just what Grimm needs killed at one location.”

“I never want to meet a politician,” Weiss muttered and slammed her head on the desk. “Sounds like the boringist job in the world.”

“You would be surprised,” Ruby muttered and memories flickered in her mind like from an old television. They were images of a white haired man talking to people in suits while she stood by his side. Ruby had definitely never done that. I have her memories too? Life Swaps are so thorough. I wonder what else I could do. Wanting the full experience while she could, Ruby clicked the Wardrobe Swap button again. One flash of green light later, she was back to wearing Weiss’s white dress. Now when Ruby looked into the mirror, she saw herself with Weiss’s hair and clothes.

What to do next?
113232.title: Rose Princess

choices: Keep up appearances and say no.
Say yes. Weiss should give him a chance.
Swap with someone else and have them answer.
1132323.content:
A knock interrupted Ruby’s thoughts before she could decide on a course of action.

“I got it!” Weiss cried out before Ruby had a chance to do anything. Maybe that was the energy Weiss and Yang always said Ruby had. She zipped over to the door and opened it. “Hi, Jaune and… Blake?” Ruby had a brief glimpse of the way Weiss looked at Jaune. Normally, she put up with him unless he tried to flirt with her. This time her expression was of someone greeting a best friend. Which made sense, as Jaune was Ruby’s best guy friend and Weiss believed she was Ruby. Weiss stepped back and allowed Blake to pass through.

“You might want to stand back,” Blake advised Weiss.

“Huh?” Weiss looked confused and then turned to Jaune. “What’s up?”

“Hey, Ruby,” Jaune greeted her. “Think I could talk to Weiss real fast.”

“Uhhh.” Weiss turned around and looked at Ruby. “She’s free, but…” The hesitancy was not hidden in her voice. Ruby knew why that was the case. She knew what Jaune wanted to do and it hadn’t worked in the past, but she also didn’t want to get between them. This was something between the two of them.

“Fine,” Ruby huffed and stood up. This is where things got confusing.

She was trying to figure out how to act. Weiss’s attitude toward Jaune would be of indifference and slight scorning, due to his lack of academic achievement and combat prowess. However, Ruby was the exact opposite. She liked Jaune, not the way Yang suggested of course, but as a close friend. She really didn’t want to treat him badly. As she made her way toward the door, her mind was fighting against Weiss’s life instincts. Ruby found out she could suppress the desire which she did, though she was a little worried people might think Weiss was acting weird if she diverged too much.

“What do you want, Arc?” Ruby asked. That response was a good compromise. Weiss would have added something along the lines of; ‘It’s never going to happen,’ or ‘If you ask me out again, I’m going to freeze you.’

“I was wondering if you free tomorrow,” Jaune asked hopefully. “There’s a nice little café that just opened up and then maybe we could see a movie tomorrow.” A pure white rose was clutched in his outstretched hand.

Weiss’s life was screaming at her to say no.

Ruby could not deny that was the appropriate response. Every fiber in her being knew that, including the fact she had seen Weiss deny him dates multiple times. Ruby had felt bad for him, but for some reason, she was kind of glad Weiss didn’t agree. The reason why was unknown to her. Her hand fiddled with the remote hidden in her sleeve, as she stared at Jaune’s hopeful puppy dog like expression. Out of the corner of her eye, Ruby noticed Blake sitting down on her bed with a roll of her eyes. Weiss on the other hand kept looking anxiously between her and Jaune.

Ruby had a couple choices. She could tell Jaune no and keep up appearances. This would be the obvious choice. However, thinking of telling Jaune that made her feel queasy. The other option was to say yes. Jaune was a nice guy and Weiss should at least give him a chance. The problem was Ruby didn’t know what would happen after saying yes and then giving Weiss back her life. Would she know what happened or would it get swept under the rug and Jaune would only find more disappointment?

There was a third option available to her. She could swap with one of the three others there and not have to make the tough decision herself. The thing was it would be a little cowardly on her part.
1132323.title: Jaune's Big Entrance

choices: Test out the other swap functions.
Wait to use the remote until they meet up with Yang.
Life Swap back with Weiss.
11323232.content:
Ruby couldn’t bring herself to tell Jaune off, but that didn’t mean she had to act completely un-Weisslike.

“Fine,” Ruby told him. “I’ll give you one chance. Make it count.”

She was painfully aware of everyone staring at her and it took a lot of effort not to let her nervousness show. Weiss’s mouth fell open and Blake actually set her book down. Neither of their expressions could match Jaune’s though. It looked like he had been smacked upside the head from the shock. After Ruby’s words finally sunk in, a huge grin formed on his face. Any guilt Ruby felt dissolved with his smile.

“You won’t regret this,” Jaune promised. “I’ll show you the best day ever. Thanks for giving me this chance, Weiss. I got to go and get everything planned. Pick you up tomorrow at 11:30?”

“Again,” Ruby repeated. “You get once chance.” She closed the door before Jaune could respond. Before she could get back to Weiss’s desk, Weiss bolted over to her with a combination of excitement and shock on her face.

“Wow, Weiss!” Weiss exclaimed. “I can’t believe you finally said yes. Why though? You’ve never saw how awesome Jaune was before.” Ruby had to suppress her laughter at seeing Weiss talk so excitedly about Jaune.

“I want to know too,” Blake added from the bed, sitting up. “You complain about him constantly and rarely say anything nice about him. What made you decide to actually say yes?”

“You aren’t planning to hurt him, right?” Weiss asked.

“I thought about it…,” Ruby started to say and looked between the other two. She couldn’t think of a good reason except saying Jaune’s a good guy. Weiss’s instincts had told her this was a bad idea and seemed to be trying to work out what happened since Ruby went directly against them. I can’t think of a reason. Is Blake going to get suspicious? I should just let Weiss handle this. She’s smarter than I am. Ruby reached into her hidden pocket and clicked the Life Swap button while aiming at Weiss.

One flash of green light later and Ruby found herself standing in front of Weiss, who was looking exasperated. Their clothes and hair styles were also back on the right bodies due to the swap. She hid the remote as Weiss continued where Ruby had left off.

“…and no matter how many times I say no, he keeps asking. It’s getting tedious.” Weiss rubbed the bridge of her nose. “I’ll bite the bullet and give him a single date. After that, I’ll try to explain it again that we don’t have anything in common and it won’t work out. He might be more bearable if he’s not trying to ask me out all the time.”

“Jaune’s a nice guy and a good friend,” Ruby told her. “Maybe you guys can actually find common ground or some similar interests?” I swapped back and Weiss immediately knew what to do to act like herself yet continue what I did in her life. So if I was in her life longer, would I see more changes once I swapped back? Weiss is my best friend, but no one would disagree she could open up more.

“I seriously doubt that,” Weiss replied.

“I see,” Blake mused. “I can understand that.” She paused. “You do realize Yang’s going to have a field day with this?”

“That was a factor in my decision too,” Weiss admitted, as she sat down. “Her attention span is lacking and, after a day or two, she will find someone else to bother about something pointless.”

“If you say so.” Blake went back to her book, paused, and then looked up. “Ruby has a point. Don’t be too hard on him. It’s not like he’s trying to get close to your family. He really likes you… for some reason.” She muttered the last part softly so the others couldn’t here.

“And I put up with him because of that,” Weiss huffed. “But he needs to know his actions are annoying to me.”

“You have to go into a date with an open mind,” Ruby pointed out, trying to help her friends. Even if they weren’t going to go out, they might be able to be friends. She wanted to hang out with both of them together, rather than separate all the time. “Isn’t the point of dating to get to know each other?”

“Yes,” Blake answered.

“Ugh.” Weiss groaned. “Maybe this was a bad idea after all and I should have told him to get lost.” Blake shrugged. Ruby took the opportunity to grab her text book and climb up her bed. She wasn’t planning to study. It was just a cover. She wanted to think about the remote and what she’s learned so far.

I have to be careful, Ruby thought to herself. The Life Swap function could have a lot of serious consequences. She hit the Reset button to undo all the swaps she had done so far, even if it was pointless. She had swapped everything back manually, but she just wanted a blank slate. Then again, everything seemed to work out naturally. Weiss will probably come back tomorrow, gripe about Jaune, and then go back to being… well Weiss. Jaune will need someone to cheer him up after that. Ruby felt slightly warm, though quickly dismissed it as excitement about the remote in her hands.

The Wardrobe Swap had changed nothing except from Ruby’s perspective. With the Reset and Undo buttons, these kinds of swaps weren’t permanent and would cause no long lasting damages. Ruby couldn’t contain her eagerness in testing out the other swap functions to see how they changed the world around her. Of course, she and the others were supposed to meet up with Yang soon for dinner. There was also the option of swapping back with Weiss and seeing if maybe she could tweak her slightly to be a little friendlier.
11323232.title: Everyone Deserves a Chance

choices: Make a swap on the way to the cafeteria.
Hold off on swapping until they meet up with Yang.
Something happens that causes Ruby to go off without the others.
113232321.content:
Ruby had time to spare and the remote’s power was far too tempting to ignore. With Blake’s arrival, she had an entirely new target. Peeking over her book to make sure Blake and Weiss were preoccupied, Ruby aimed the remote. Her finger hovered between the Body Swap and Personal Information button. Both were easy to test without the risk of Personality. While the Life Swap instincts could be suppressed, she didn’t know if a new personality could. Her finger finally fell on the Body Swap button and there was a flash of light.

Ruby blinked and looked down at her body. There were only a few noticeable differences. The first, she was taller. Even laying down, her body took up much more space than she had before. The second, and perhaps the biggest difference, was everything suddenly got louder. Ruby’s hearing improved exponentially. A shaking hand rose to her head and she felt a soft sensation of a cat ear. Her eyes darted over to Blake. Ruby experienced the weird sensation of seeing herself wearing the Beacon uniform, a black suit with a red skirt, reading a book. Blake’s black bow was tied up on her head. Normally, the bow covered her ears. This time, there couldn’t be anything under there.

“Eep!” Ruby squeaked and dove off her bed to flee into the bathroom. Both Weiss and Blake looked at her for a moment and then each other.

“What was that about?” Weiss asked. Blake shrugged and they went back to what they were doing. Ruby could get excited over so many things. It was just part of living with her.

In the bathroom, Ruby was studying her reflection.

Blake’s amber eyes stared back at her. Ruby shivered in excitement and examined her new face closely. Her head felt heavy because Blake had significantly more hair than she did. Not as much as Yang though. Ruby liked short hair. It didn’t get in the way when she was fighting. She brushed a strange of black hair out of her face and then her eyes traveled upwards. Two black cat ears sat proudly on her head. They blended in seamlessly with her hair.

“…so cuuuute!” Ruby squealed. They were so soft and smooth, like velvet. Blake never offered Ruby the opportunity to touch her ears. She rubbed them for another minute and a strange sound escaped her throat. “Did…did I just purr?” She blinked when her brain processed the voice she was speaking with. “This is Blake’s voice. The body swap switched it with mine. I guess that makes sense. Vocal chords are part of the body.”

Ruby twirled around and admired her body. Her clothes were still the same as she only swapped bodies. They had changed to accommodate her new body size though. Her dress was a little longer because of her height and the chest area had increased slightly. Ruby wasn’t small by any means and she was still growing while drinking plenty of milk. Blake was just older. Thus had longer for her body to develop. Her chest wasn’t nearly as impressive as Yang’s, but it was nothing to sneeze at.

“Weiss would be soooo jealous.” Ruby laughed. Her cat ears rose up and Ruby tilted her head. As a test, she thought of something sad, like when they ran out of cookies and saw her new ears drop. “Sooooo cute!” She repeated. “Even though I understand why Blake wants to hide being a Faunus… is she still a Faunus?” Ruby checked her school ID and saw she was still listed as human. “So that didn’t get changed. Body Swap is really just that, a swap of bodies.” Feeling up her ears one last time before leaving, Ruby exited the bathroom.

“You okay?” Blake asked.

“Yep,” Ruby replied happily. She could feel her ears reacting to her excitement. “How’s your day been, Blake?”

“Same old,” Blake replied. “Classes are done and I can relax.” When Blake looked at Ruby, there was no indication she saw anything unusual.

“You don’t have to study?” Ruby asked and the corner of Blake’s lips twitched upwards.

“Blake’s grades are near the top,” Weiss stated firmly. “Her study habits are fine.”

“I’m not worthy of your praise,” Blake muttered sarcastically.

“Sheesh, I’m trying to raise my grades.” Ruby huffed and crossed her arms. If she had been staring in a mirror, she probably would have laughed seeing Blake make that expression. “Is it time to meet up with Yang yet?” Weiss glanced at her scroll.

“Yes,” she confirmed. “We will be a little early, but that’s preferable. Yang would probably eat without us if she finished early.” Weiss paused and scratched behind Zwei’s ear. Zwei was Ruby’s corgi she was hiding in their room. He was currently sleeping halfway under her desk.

“She would,” Ruby agreed and then turned to Blake. “Coming?”

“Sure,” Blake agreed and set down her book. Past experience told her if Yang was still upset losing to Pyrrha, her book would end up covered in food. The door closed behind them with a bang and Ruby fiddled with the remote in her pocket. The urge to continue to use it was strong.
113232321.title: Ruby the Cat

choices: Explore the changes caused by the age swap.
Continue to swap.
Go do something else.
113232322.content:
After what felt like ages, Ruby’s phone alarm told her it was time to meet up with Yang for dinner. Ruby, Blake, and Weiss left together and Ruby managed to control the urge to start swapping things. Seriously, it was difficult and she wanted to try it out. It was only because of hunger and knowing she had team responsibilities that she put off using it. The three of them grabbed their food and sat down. Yang joined them a few moments later.

“What’s up!?” Yang asked, plopping down next to Blake.

“”You will never believe this,” Blake told her and Weiss’s cheeks gained a slight shade of pink.

“Oh?” Her expression wasn’t lost on Yang. “What did the Ice Queen do?”

“Nothing important,” Weiss huffed.

“You might as well tell her,” Ruby suggested. “Yang will keep bothering you until you do. Trust me, she never grows tired of pestering.”

“Aww, I taught my baby sis so well,” Yang teased. “I still remember that one time you accidently wet the bed and tried to hide the evidence by throwing the sheets out the window.”

“YANG!” Ruby cried out mortified.

“Couldn’t resist, sis.” Yang laughed and turned to Blake. “So what’s the big news?”

Let’s see how you like being the younger sister, Ruby thought vindictively. She wasn’t usually a person who sought out revenge. This time was special. The remote gave her a perfect opportunity. Her finger fell on the Personal Info Swap option.

“Jaune came over today,” Blake explained.

“Ah.” Yang paused and looked at Weiss. “You didn’t make him cry, did you?” There was a flash of green light no one noticed except for Ruby. Yang’s hair became noticeably shorter, she lost a couple inches in height, and her chest shrunk slightly.

She had become fifteen years old.

“Of course not,” Weiss replied indignantly. “I was nice.”

“Your version of nice usually involves them not being frozen solid,” Yang shot back.

“Well, he wasn’t frozen,” Blake informed her. “But he might have been crying tears of joy.”

“Huh?” Yang was visible confused.

Meanwhile, Ruby was trying very hard to hold in her laughter. Revenge was served when Ruby swapped their ages. To everyone else, Yang was fifteen and Ruby was seventeen. Yang’s current appearance was exactly like Ruby remembered two years ago. Her clothes stayed the same but shrunk slightly to accommodate her new figure. Ruby, on the other hand, grew taller, her chest expanded, and her hair style changed. It grew slightly longer, but still remained short, like she preferred. Her clothes also adjusted to fit her new frame.

Can’t wait for everyone to treat me like an equal. I’m so tired of people seeing me as a kid. Ruby could barely contain her excitement until her thoughts were interrupted by Yang’s cry.

“You said yes!”

“Keep it down,” Weiss hissed angrily. “I only said it so that he would realize we are incompatible and leave me alone.”

“Don’t kid yourself,” Yang whispered excitedly. “Pyrrha likes him, so there has to be something special about Vomit Boy. Try to find it out.”

“Why are you so interested?” Blake asked.

“Probably because Ruby doesn’t let Yang date,” Weiss mocked and Ruby flinched in her seat.

“I’ve been on dates,” Yang retorted.

“Only because dad was watching you,” Ruby answered and her mind suddenly saw in image in her head of herself and her dad spying on Yang’s first date.

“I knew you were spying!” Yang accused. “I told you I was old enough to make my own decisions. I even got into Beacon two years early.”

That statement confirmed Ruby’s suspicion that this world had changed. Images and information kept flashing through her mind, causing some confusion. A lot of stuff was different. Ruby had taken care of Yang instead of the other way around. She actually managed to have a couple dates without Yang causing the boys to flee. The biggest difference was how they got into Beacon. Ruby had taken the normal route and applied, while Yang was the one to stop Roman Torchwick. Both of their personalities were still pretty much the same. Yang was a party girl and Ruby was more reserved and awkward.

“That’s the right of an older sister,” Ruby retorted, causing Weiss and Blake to snicker.

What should she do next?
113232322.title: Big Sis Ruby

choices: Ruby swaps something with Weiss. She went back on her promise to spar.
Find Jaune and see what he's planning.
Don't forget about Yang. An older sister needs to check up on her baby sis.
1132323223.content:
“As I promised,” Weiss said suddenly and Ruby turned towards her. “Since you managed to study until we came down here, I’ll go with you to test out your new Dust rounds.”

Ruby blinked.

In all honesty, she had forgotten about Weiss’s deal. To be fair, anyone would have with the magical remote being in their possession. The swaps were fun and all, but Ruby still had a dream of being a hero and defeating the Grimm. That meant she still needed to practice. She also loved weapons and no swap could change that. Probably. She still hadn’t tried to personality swap.

“Right,” Ruby agreed immediately. “I got these new electric Dust rounds I want to try and could use your insight into how to make the best use out of them.”

“I’m glad to see you understand my skills,” Weiss replied. “I would be happy to help.” Yang made a gagging motion out of her sight with a finger. Ruby had to try very hard not to laugh. Ruby waved goodbye to her ‘younger’ sister and Blake, as she and Weiss left. They grabbed their weapons and ammo from their lockers before finding an unused training room.

“Check this out,” Ruby bragged and fired a few rounds from Crescent Rose, which was currently in its sniper mode. The training drones she was aiming at were hit with perfect accuracy and stumbled as sparks of electricity coursed through them.

“Electrical Dust does tend to stun machines,” Weiss agreed. “If you were facing a mech suit, like that time with Torchwick, I could see this being useful. Against Grimm, you might be able to slow them down or paralyze n appendage. For raw damage, your normal rounds would be better.”

“That’s what I thought,” Ruby agreed. “Wasn’t sure if I should try some higher caliber bullets, or maybe purer crystals for a bigger impact.”

“Both would increase the stun effect,” Weiss admitted, thinking. “Higher caliber would allow you to break through armor or material with low conductivity.” She watched Ruby fire a few more rounds and then checked the damage to the training droids themselves. “Your current rounds are already overloading the circuits. Huh, I’m actually surprised at how much damage they do. We might need to try these on actual Grimm.”

“Think we can try sometime this weekend?’ Ruby asked hopefully.

“I suppose so,” Weiss relented. “I wanted to test using Gravity Dust with my glyphs in a more offensive manner anyways. The Emerald Forest would be a good place to try it out against Grimm.”

“It’s a date,” Ruby declared and then immediately covered her mouth. “Oops, sorry. I didn’t mean…”

“It’s fine,” Weiss assured her. “That dunce is probably going to mess everything up somehow and I’ll be back before you know it.”

“I’m sure Jaune is going to show you a great time,” Ruby protested. “Please, Weiss. Give him a chance.” Weiss rolled her eyes.

“I doubt it, but I told you before. I’m giving him this one chance.” She turned to leave. “I lost the motivation to do any training tonight. You’re on your own.”

Ruby frowned and fidgeted with the remote in her pocket.
1132323223.title: Promises

choices: Let Jaune and Weiss work it out. Ruby should go and test the remote more.
Confess and tell him how she feels.
Get involved in their date the next day using the remote.
11323232232.content:
Feeling down about what happened, Ruby packed her weapon and ammo back into her locker. She wasn’t sure what she should be doing. Training lost its luster at the thought of what would happen between her two best friends. It was kind of her fault. Okay, entirely her fault. She swapped with Weiss and said yes to Jaune. Admitting that, she knew what she had to do. Disappearing in a flash of rose petals, Ruby bolted toward Jaune’s dorm. Seconds later she found herself knocking at his door.

“Hey, Ruby,” Jaune greeted when he opened the door. “Come on in. What’s up?”

“I…err… wanted to check up on you,” Ruby explained. She looked around. “Huh, I kind of expected balloons and streamers.” Jaune laughed.

“Never thought I would get this far,” Jaune admitted nervously. “I was about ready to give up. Figured I should try one more time.” Guilt welled up in Ruby. It was because of her that Jaune hadn’t given up on Weiss. “When I told Pyrrha, she seemed happy for me, but had to leave right after.” Ruby’s flinch went unnoticed. It was probably a good thing Jaune was so oblivious.

“Do you have a plan?” Ruby asked, sitting on the edge of his bed, noticing Jaune had been playing a video game. She picked up the remote and held it up.

“Kind of?” Jaune said, picking up the second controller and sitting down beside her. “There’s a new café I knew my sisters would love, so I figured Weiss might like it. Then maybe go to a movie afterwards and see where it goes from there.”

“You might want to plan a little more detail,” Ruby suggested, her eyes on the screen. “She’s a real stickler to details.”

“Hmm.” Jaune hummed as he focused on the game. “I might have to ask my sisters for ideas then. Unless you have any.”

“My idea of a fun time is probably the opposite of Weiss’s,” Ruby pointed out and they laughed. “Like playing this game. Yang and I love doing this with our dad and uncle. Weiss? She would rather study or go to some fancy party where they just stand around and talk.”

“While Blake would want to visit a library and Nora would see if there was a way we could find a sloth,” Jaune finished. Ruby laughed loudly and punched him in the shoulder. They focused on the game for a good ten minutes when he spoke up again. “Think I have a chance with Weiss? Be honest.”

“Honestly?” Ruby hesitated. A lot of conflicting emotions ran through her. Part of her knew they were too different. Weiss was someone who preferred order in her life and wanted high class living arrangements. Jaune was much more down to earth and laid back. Funny, charming sometimes, and didn’t judge people from their first meeting. He had talked to Ruby when she first arrived at Beacon, even after causing a scene. They hung out all the time, had similar interests, and he thought Crescent Rose was amazing. She would be a much better partner for Jaune than Weiss would be.

She froze when that thought occurred to her.

“Honestly,” Jaune confirmed. “I want to know. I’m still going to try, but I could really use your opinion. Pyrrha and Nora would try to spare my feelings while Ren would say something philosophical that could mean multiple things to avoid answering.” Ruby bit the corner of her lip.

Ruby had always liked Jaune ever since they met. These feelings she was experiencing weren’t new. They just seemed to be more intense than usual. As she thought about what to answer, memories flashed through her mind about experiences she knew never occurred. There were scenes from a couple dates she had been on. With Yang now being younger than her, Ruby was free to date who she wanted. From what she saw, none of them were successful in the long term, but they weren’t bad. There was just something else she was looking for.

Something Jaune had…

The realization hit her like a truck.

I’m older and looking for a boy to date… I fell for Jaune. Yang wasn’t there to hold me back. Her hormones and emotions were guiding her. She really wanted to grab Jaune’s hand and hold it. To get him to understand what she was feeling.

“That bad?” Jaune asked, taking her silence as the answer.

“No!” Ruby cried out suddenly. “I mean… I think you two are really different, but I can’t say you would work or not. Stranger things have happened. At the very least, if things don’t work out, I think you two could still be friends. Weiss promised me she would give you a chance and try to approach this date with an open mind. You should do the same. Focus on trying your best and accept the outcome, whatever it may be.”

It killed her to say this. Pyrrha’s lack of confessing her feelings suddenly became clear to Ruby. How do you tell a close friend they should ignore the person they like for you?

“Thanks, Ruby,” Jaune said. She could feel and hear the gratefulness and honesty in his voice. His smile nearly caused her to melt on the spot. “I’m really glad I met you.” He threw his arm around her shoulder and gave her a hug. Ruby’s face flushed. The warmth of his body felt perfect against her and she missed jumping over an obstacle in the game, dying.

What happens next?
11323232232.title: Hormones Suck

choices: Nora
Cinder
Someone else.
113232322321.content:
Ruby had already done everything she should for Jaune and Weiss and a little more. Sure, Weiss may have been brainwashed to accept it, but if Jaune actually does a good job, Weiss might see him in a positive light. Something could come from it. Still, it should be their decision. To distract herself, Ruby had the remote. The only swap still in existence was the age swap and she figured she would leave it for a bit. It wasn’t affecting much. Instead, she was more curious about other swaps and how they affected the surroundings. Life Swap as Weiss showed that her choices can affect those around them.

“W-well,” Ruby said, stammering slightly and wiggling out of Jaune’s hug. “I should get going.” She waved goodbye and left, heart beating rapidly. “I really have feelings for him.”

She felt guilty as part of her hoped he Jaune and Weiss’s date would go poorly. Realizing this, she slapped her cheeks as she walked down the hallway.

“Cheer up!” She told herself. “You got this awesome remote. Time to test it out.” Using it to distract her from the new hormones raging within her was another perk.

Who does she run into?
113232322321.title: Let Jaune and Weiss work it out. Ruby should go...

choices: Body Swap
Wardrobe Swap
Life Swap
1132323223212.content:
“Oomph!”

Ruby wasn’t looking where she was going and rounded a corner. Without meaning too, she crashed into someone.

“Sorry!” She apologized immediately and looked up to see who she had hit.

https://images.app.goo.gl/n2Z5CRDhLt3juu...
The girl wore gray pants and boots; a beige leather, sleeveless jacket with light-beige details; brown gloves, a sarashi tied around her chest and another around her hips, and a pauldron on her left shoulder. She also wore a belt around her waist with a lot of pockets. Her eyes were bright amber and she had long ashen black hair. It was pushed to one side and slightly obscured one of her eyes from site. The older girl reached down a hand and helped her up.

“You really should be more careful, Ruby.” Cinder Fall, one of the students from Haven Academy, looked her up and down. “Someone might have believed you were attacking them.” She smiled, though her eyes seemed to stare right through Ruby. “Something on your mind?”

Ruby nodded.

“Was just thinking and wasn’t watching where I was going. Two of my friends are going on a date and I hope it goes well.”

“Oh?” Cinder raised an eyebrow. “How interesting.”

“Please don’t tell anyone I told you.” Ruby begged, blushing. Luckily she was still consider 17 due to the previous age swap. Or she might have just run off in embarrassment. “It’s kind of a secret until they test the waters.”

“My lips are sealed.” Cinder promised. Unknown to Ruby, she was already planning how this could be used to her advantage. “Well, I must be going. We must find time to hang out sometime before the Vytel festival.”

“S-sure!”

Ruby waved to her and she continued on her way. However, Ruby looked at her retreating form. The remote seemed to heat up at her touch. Now was a perfect time to try it out. Cinder seemed older than others and had a well-developed body, maybe Ruby could swap that? Ruby didn’t know much about Cinder, so Personal Info Swap was out of the question, but how about getting her hands on her wardrobe? See what kind of clothes she liked. Then there was the Life Swap option. After seeing what it could do to alter people’s actions, maybe she should try to learn about it?
1132323223212.title: Run into Cinder, Literally

choices: She tells them the plan
Ruby teases her a bit on her obvious crush
She does something else (RC on what)
11323232232123.content:
It would be interesting to see what her life is like, let's do it. Ruby grinned and pressed the remote. After the flash was made Ruby found herself wearing Cinder's clothes while Cinder paused and looked confused before turning to Ruby and smiling again.

"Sorry about running into you again." Cinder bowed and went off to what Ruby assumed to be checking on Jaune who she believes she has a crush on.

"There you are Cinder." A voice turned and found herself staring at a tanned girl with green hair.

"Oh...hi." Ruby greeted.

"Did you hit your head or something, we need to act fast, we found the fall maiden." The girl told her.

"Oh...that's good." Ruby was confused about this. "So..what are you waiting for?"

"Your orders, are you sure you're feeling okay?" The girl asked worryingly.

"Yeah, sorry this place is doing stuff to my head." Ruby mentioned "Thank you for checking up on me."

"O..oh." The girl blushed "No problem Cinder, you know I'll do anything for you."

"That's good to hear, I think I'm a bit hazy on everything right now, if you can refresh my memory on everything that would be great." Ruby told her.

"Sure no problem." The girl blushed again.
11323232232123.title: Life Swap

choices: Ruby continues to bully.
Ruby undos the Life Swap
Someone else shows up before she decides.
113232322321232.content:
Ruby had only met the tanned, green haired girl, Emerald, a couple times before. She had been rather outgoing and easy to talk to. Unlike Ruby, who tended to be more reserved around strangers. It was obvious that Emerald adored Cinder by her actions. Ruby actually found this funny, as Emerald now looked down at her. Cinder was a lot taller than she was. The remote however put Ruby in Cinder’s life, and while others saw her as Cinder, Ruby still saw herself, just wearing her clothes.

The thing was, Ruby knew Yang would tease Emerald if she was in her position. However, Ruby wasn’t into girls and neither apparently was Cinder. Cinder’s life tended to get pleasure in bullying, much like Yang. Ruby realized she probably wouldn’t get a chance like this again normally, so she might as well see what was so fun about being mean. It would also keep Cinder more in character and not alter her life too much.

“The fall maiden can wait,” Ruby said, letting Cinder’s life guide her. All Ruby really knew right now was they were looking for someone. Now that they found her, they would simply wait until the perfect time to reveal themselves. Somehow, Ruby felt something was off, but decided not to pry further into strangers’ affair. “I want to discuss you, Emerald.”

“M-me?” Emerald stuttered, growing red. Ruby reached forward and cupped the girl’s chin.

“Are you happy in your current position?”

“H-happy?” Emerald looked a little confused and then her face seemed to glow as she thought of something. “I-I love being by your side and am happy to do anything for you.”

“I see…” Ruby smiled. “If you could be more? Would you accept?”

“M-more?” Emerald spluttered. Ruby wouldn’t be surprised if steam escaped her ears. It was the same expression Ruby had felt so many times falling for Yang’s tricks. “What do you mean more?”

“I wonder…” Ruby ran a hand across Emerald’s cheek and the girl began to shift as her knees began to shake.

Ruby had a decision to make now. She could continue to bully Emerald, Cinder found pleasure in it, but Ruby was way too nice to do this seriously. She didn’t expect to run into a teammate so soon. Perhaps it would be better for her to leave before she accidentally messed up Cinder’s life. She really needed to practice more with the remote and see what it could really do.
113232322321232.title: Ruby teases her a bit on her obvious crush

choices: She is nice and helps Jaune
She tells him how she feels
She undoes her swap to nullify this entirely
1132323223212322.content:
Ruby thought it'd be best to leave the mean stuff to the actual mean people, Cinder can deal with her however she saw fit. With that in mind she went to undo the swap and found herself in front of Jaune once more who was smiling at her.

"Thank's again for helping out on my date with Weiss Ruby." He mentioned she found herself blushing.

"Um...no problem." She barely got out fighting the urge to grab and kiss him.

"So, what do you think would be a good gift for her." Jaune asked.

"An..anything is fine." Ruby mentioned still "But...flowers is always a nice one."

"Not a bad idea, thanks." He mentioned giving her a hug, Ruby was blushing furiously and slowly hugged him back.

"Say....Jaune." She began.

"Yes?" He asked.

"If...let's say another girl loved you....what would you do?" She asked.

"Where this did question come from?" Jaune asked back.

"It's merely a hypothetical question." Ruby blushed mentioning.

"Well, I guess I'd have a talk with her and ask her why she feels that way." Jaune scratched his head explained.

"Then?" Ruby carried on.

"I don't know, I guess I'd see from there." He admitted. "But I want to focus on Weiss right now."

"S..sure." Ruby stuttered, still blushing. Ruby began helping him get ready, still fighting her hormones to jump him.

Ruby was uncertain of what to do, she wanted to help him but a small selfish part of her wanted him to herself. She pondered on this before deciding.
1132323223212322.title: Ruby undos the Life Swap

choices: Body Swap (RC)
Personality Swap (RC)
Personal Info Swap (RC)
11323232232123221.content:
Ruby wasn’t sure if these feelings were entirely based on the age swap, or if it was just more pronounced because of it. It took a lot of self-restraint not to confess to Jaune immediately. She always liked him, but now he was just…. Something more. Pyrrha liked him too, so if their date goes wrong, there was a chance to swoop in. The thought upset her stomach and she felt horrible thinking about that. To make up for it, Ruby tried to help Jaune.

“White and blue are Weiss’s favorite colors,” Ruby continued. “So those should work. Don’t get a big bouquet. It’s just a first date, but maybe just a couple.”

“Good idea,” Jaune agreed, writing this down. “I was thinking of getting lunch at a nice café then a movie and see where that goes.”

“Weiss likes romance movies,” Ruby recalled. “Though not cheesy comedy ones.” Jaune nodded. “Café’s a good choice too and I bet she expects you to dress up.”

“Not sure I own a suit,” Jaune muttered, looking at the closet.

“Maybe a nice button down shirt then?”

“I have those.” Jaune nodded. “Should I plan for anything else after the movie?”

“I suppose it’s up to Weiss,” Ruby replied. “Ask her if she would like to do something and if she doesn’t suggest anything, have a backup plan.”

“Got it. I assume if she’s willing to go out for dinner, the dates going well.”

“Probably. I would be worried if she throws food in your face.” They both laughed.

“Ruby…” Jaune suddenly grew serious. “Thanks. I mean it. For everything. I know you don’t think we will get together, but you are still willing to help. It means a lot to me and I’m glad I found you in that crater.”

“Hey!” Ruby cried and pushed him lightly. “That was an accident, Vomit Boy.”

“Well, I’m glad it happened since we met.” Jaune hugged her. “You’re my best friend and again, thank you for everything.”

“I-It was n-no problem.” Ruby stammered. “I’m sorry, but I have to go. Need to… turn in al library book. Yeah! Overdue! I’ll see you tomorrow!” Jaune looked a little confused as she rushed out, but simply shrugged and went back to planning.

I can’t believe I almost kissed him there. Ruby thought in shock. During that hug, the temptation surprised her. He needs to finish with Weiss, plus Pyrrha likes him, so you have your work cut out for you. Distract yourself with something. Anything!

Her eyes traveled to the remote in her hand.

It was getting dark, but plenty of people were still active at Beacon. She had only tried out a couple functions of the remote. Wardrobe Swap, Life Swaps, and a Personal Info Age Swap. There was so many options left to keep her mind off of Jaune. Body Swap was one good option. She could be someone else and everyone would think she always looked like that. Personality Swap was a little scary, but tempting. She wouldn’t believe she was her target, but would act like them and people would assume that was normal too. Lastly, the Personal Info swaps were numerous and had some weird affects she could experience.

It was hard to decide.
11323232232123221.title: She is nice and helps Jaune

choices: Velvet
Blake
Penny
113232322321232211.content:
Ruby wanted to try a body swap to see what that was like, the problem was who to choose. The name Weiss entered her mind but shook that off, she would not do anything to sabotage or insert herself into Jaune's date. Knowing Weiss she'll blow him off first chance she gets anyways, another thought she shrugged off Come on Ruby, get it together. She needed her mind off things and fast.

The question was who to swap with, there were so many people. Maybe her friend Penny could be fun, she always wanted to be a robot. Then again that probably wouldn't work. There was also Blake to consider, being a Faunus had it's perks or even Velvet. Ruby sighed in frustration as the choices on what to do baffled her.

I'll just pick someone at random and then swap with that person, should be good. Ruby thought, she thought about it before making her mind up on who she wants to body swap with.
113232322321232211.title: Body Swap (RC)

choices: Everything worked out perfectly.
Ruby finds out she has Penny's metal body now under the fake skin.
Penny spots Ruby and runs over.
1132323223212322113.content:
Ruby wandered around Beacon, looking for a good target. Not sure who to pick, she decided to just hit the first person who rounded the corner. Ruby pretended to be involved on her Scroll, when movement caught her eye. Looking up, she saw a familiar looking girl.

The girl had short, rather curly orange hair with a small ahoge on top, and she wore a pink bow on the back of her head. She also had bright green eyes, light skin and freckles. She wore a whitish-gray old-fashioned blouse with short gray feminine overalls as well as a black and green collar with a matching pair of stockings.
https://vignette.wikia.nocookie.net/rwby...

She was Ruby’s friend, Penny Polendina.

She was a kind and curious girl, though a little strange. It wasn’t her fault though. She wasn’t actually a human. She was an android created by Atlas and implemented with an artificial soul. Though her body wasn’t technically living tissue, Ruby considered her alive. Penny had feelings, loved to learn, and wanted to make friends. If you got past her strange way of talking and a lack of understanding personal space, she was actually pretty cute.

The remote instructions did say the remote didn’t work on nonliving things, so this would be a test on multiple levels.

Perfect, Ruby thought, aiming the remote and pressing the button. There was a flash of green light and Ruby saw herself in the distance wearing Penny’s clothes. Ruby reached up and felt her hair, which seemed to be a little more abundant and saw a strand of orange. Cool! I have to check myself out in a mirror. I knew Penny was alive.
1132323223212322113.title: Penny

choices: She gives Penny's body back
She checks up on Penny in her body
She does something else (RC on what)
11323232232123221131.content:
Ruby immediately went to a mirror to see the fruit of her labours and much to her surprise the transformation was a complete success.

Standing before her was the visage of Penny herself, orange hair and the clothes she wears. She smiles at herself as the image of Penny smiled back.

"Greetings and salutations, my name is Penny." Ruby giggled saying what her friend usually says "Don't worry, I'm combat ready!" She cried out in Penny's usual battle cry. She felt herself and was surprised to feel normal flesh. She had to hand it to Atlas, they knew their stuff.

"Sorry Penny but you're so cool I had to try you out a bit, plus I need the distraction." Ruby mentioned. She did a courtesy and checked to see how lifelike she actually is, and found a part from the obvious lack of organs and the need for food or water she was quite human like, she smiled at that and she knows soon she'll be completely real like she always wants.

Ruby now wondered what she can do with Penny's body, she can give it back, she can see how Penny is faring with her body or come up with another idea.
11323232232123221131.title: Everything worked out perfectly.

choices: Swap more with Penny
Try out the new android body.
Find someone else to swap with.
113232322321232211312.content:
Ruby had been a little surprised she had Penny’s clothes, but figured she accidentally hit the Wardrobe and Body Swap in her excitement. Not wanting to give the body back immediately, she went in the direction Penny was heading. She wanted to at least say hi to her friend and see if Penny acted any differently. Luckily, Penny hadn’t gone far.

“Penny!” Ruby called out. She got to witness herself turning around to see who called out to her and then beaming when she saw who it was.

“Salutations, Friend Ruby!” Penny called back and the two of them ran forward into a hug. “Ooo, you’re as strong as ever.”

“Woops.” Ruby blushed. “Sometimes I forget my own strength. How have you been?”

“I’ve have been doing well. What about you?”

“I’ve… been better.” Ruby admitted. “Mostly looking for a distraction.”

“What kind of trouble?” Penny asked worriedly. “Not White Fang or runaway friends, is it?”

“No.” Ruby shook her head quickly. “Boy trouble.”

“Boys?!” Penny’s silver eyes lit up. “We should totally talk about boys sometime.” Her expression grew solemn and her voice lowered. “I’m sorry I can’t tonight though. I have to go for my regularly schedule testing for my organic components. They have to make sure my DNA is stable.”

So is Penny a clone or something in this reality? Ruby thought to herself. Then what does it make me with a metal body?

“Will you be free this weekend?” Ruby asked.

“Sunday,” Penny said. “I’m supposed to prepare for the Vytal Festival on Saturday, but I promise to meet up with you the following day. I really would like to spend time with you.”

“It’s a date.” Ruby replied, smiling.

“How wonderful!” Penny said, slapping her hands together. “I have never been on a date. I’m supposed to worry about what to wear, right?”

“Hang on!” Ruby had to stop her before this got out of hand. “Date is just a saying here. It’s just us hanging out as friends.”

“That still sounds sensational.” Penny told her. “I will do everything I can to ensure my schedule is free.”

“I look forward to it too.” Ruby waved goodbye as Penny left.

Ruby debated what to do while Penny walked away down the hall. Penny had her body and clothes, while Ruby had hers. Everyone else would still consider this normal, so it wasn’t like anything bad would come from it. One Undo would swap her back, regardless where they were. What Ruby was considering was swapping something else with Penny. Like names or weapons. While Ruby loved her baby, Crescent Rose, she debated if it was worth trying out Penny’s cool multi swords. There were other options, but she had to decide fast.

Of course, she didn’t have to swap anything more. Penny’s interaction already showed Ruby was super strong and it might be fun to go to a training room and see how fighting changed now that she was an android.

“I’m combat ready.” Ruby muttered and then giggled.

Lastly, maybe she should look for a new target to swap something with. The school was a big place.

“I suppose we could do some light sparing,” Ruby said to Blake, who nodded and placed a bookmark where she left off.

Weiss waved goodbye to them, still preoccupied with deciding on an outfit, and Yang looked a little disappointed. Ruby would have to make it up with her later. She and Blake made their way to the training fields again, grabbed their weapons from their locker rooms, and met in the arena. Blake wielded Gambol Shroud, a sword with a sheath, that could also be used as a one handed weapon for duel wielding.

“Don’t hold back,” Ruby said to Blake, giving Crescent Rose a practice swing. It felt so light to her now.

“I don’t think I could even if I wanted.” Blake replied with a small smile.

The preset bell rang and they began.

Ruby started off with a few long range shots from Crescent Rose in gun form. Blake was a melee opponent and liked to get in close. Blake dodged the random bullets and ran swiftly around the ring, forcing Ruby to keep turning. It was throwing off her aim. Finally, Blake must have seen a flaw in Ruby’s defense and charged straight at her.

“Got you!” Ruby fired a bullet directly at Blake, who smirked.

The bullet hit Blake square on and her body flickered before disappearing.

“No, a clone!” Ruby tried to figure out where the real Blake was, only to get hit in the back by Blake’s sheath. There was a loud bang and Ruby fell forward. “Huh,” she realized. “That didn’t hurt at all.”

“You still took Aura damage,” Blake stated, pointing to the screen. Ruby doubled checked and saw she was right. While her body didn’t hurt, Aura was still absorbing the impact and Ruby did not have a lot of it.

“Guess I need to get serious too.”

Crescent Rose mechoshfited into its scythe form and Ruby vanished in a flutter of roses. She didn’t really disappear, it was just her Semblance. Ruby could move at speeds even Faunus eyes couldn’t follow. Blake was only saved by her reaction speed. Ruby appeared behind her and brought her scythe down. Blake responded by crossed her weapons in front of her like a shield. The force of the blow sent her flying.

I forgot about my strength! Ruby realized too late.

Blake landed hard and skidded backwards. Her Aura took a big hit just trying to avoid the shockwaves. Her sheath transformed into a gun and she started fire bullets at the shocked Ruby, who was too slow to react.

“Ow! That hurts!” Ruby cried.

“Noted.” Blake threw the ribbon attached to her weapon around Ruby’s feat and pulled. Her foot slipped and Ruby fell on her back. A second later, Blake landed on top of her with her gun pointed down. “I win?”

“You win. Nice Job.” Blake smiled, hopped off, and helped her up. “I guess even with super strength, I can’t let my guard down.”

“Reason I was trying to avoid a direct confrontation,” Blake admitted. “That one blow you hit me with? Took 20% of my aura, AFTER I blocked.” She looked Ruby up and down. “How do you feel?”

“Besides not needing to eat or drink?” Ruby couldn’t resist and even giggled. “I feel sensational.”

Blake raised an eyebrow but decided not to comment at Ruby’s strange wording. The two of them heading back to the locker room to grab some towels and store their weapons. During this time, Ruby eyed Blake, while fidgeting with the remote in her pocket.

She had always been interested in knowing what having animal parts would be like. What if Ruby swapped ears with Blake? She could have a pair of cute cat ears. The question is using a Body Part Swap, would she still be considered a human or a Faunus? What would Blake be considered? So many questions. Ruby also debated swapping Wardrobes with Blake. There was no doubt Blake had some attractive clothes. She wondered what Penny would look like wearing her black and white outfits compared to the boring grey ones she had now.

The game started and Ruby quickly realized Yang’s skill was about where her skill was before the Age Swap. Ruby always found himself remembering combo moves more easily. The result was she crushed Yang pretty handedly. Maybe the android body gave her faster reflexes too.

“Rematch.” Yang said angrily.

She did like being older.

If she remembered the remote instructions right and her own experiences, a Life Swap would put her android cat eared body into someone else’s life. The only difference she would experience was the clothes, but other people would see her as her target. It was always a pretty crazy sensation.

“Let’s get some food,” Yang said to Blake. “I’m starving.”

“Sure.” Blake nodded. “Weiss, are you joining us?”

“I have some preparations to make first and I’m not that hungry right now,” Weiss admitted and Ruby’s ears twitched as she heard Weiss mutter. “Why I agreed to this, I will never know.”

Maybe you don’t deserve someone as cool as Jaune then, Ruby thought and immediately felt sick. She shouldn’t have done that. To get out of the situation before saying something she didn’t mean, she planned to go across the hall to Jaune’s room. What she didn’t expect was to meet his teammates, Nora, Pyrrha, and Ren.

“Good morning, Ruby.” Pyrrha greeted. She was Jaune’s partner. A tall girl with bright red hair in a ponytail, along with being incredibly attractive. She was wearing a red tank top and white pants currently.

“Good morning,” Ruby said back. “Is Jaune free? I figured he might need a pep talk.”

“Don’t worry,” Ren assured her. “He’s a little nervous, but I talked to him. He’s getting changed and will probably arrive at the meeting spot an hour early in anticipation.”

“Ren’s really good at helping people through troubles.” Nora added. “Jaune will be fine, unless Weiss wants to kidnap him and send him to the Dust mines back home.”

“Which won’t happen.” Ren said firmly.

“Mhmm.” Pyrrha didn’t commit to anything, but looked slightly annoyed. Ruby figured she was like her, upset Jaune was with someone else.

“Want to join us for breakfast?” Nora asked Ruby.

“Umm, sure. We can eat with my team.”

Ruby didn’t expect herself to say that.

“I’m not sure.” This was a lie. It happened after she grew older and realized the feelings already within her.

Ruby knew Pyrrha had an advantage, but there was no way she was going to let that girl get the lead.

“Jaune, listen.” Ruby sat on his other side and made sure to hold his arm against her chest, but in a way that made it seem like an accident. “There’s plenty of other fish in the sea. I know you fancy Weiss now, but I guarantee that will change. You and Weiss don’t have a lot in common.”

“I know,” Jaune sighed. “I was hoping maybe we could find some common ground and start there. Everything started fine and she even complimented the café I chose for lunch.” He gave a dry laugh. “Conversation was awkward, waiter dropped food on me, and the movie afterwards was horrible. Pretty much everything that went wrong did.”

“Those things happen,” Pyrrha assured him, imitating Ruby’s action. “You can’t give up because of something like that. I li-…” Her scroll went off interrupting her. It was probably a good thing, as her face was growing red. To hide her embarrassment, she glanced down at it. “Professor Goodwitch wants to see me, but I can stay and explain something to her later.”

“No, go.” Jaune shook his head. “I don’t want to get you in trouble. I’ll be fine and we can talk later. Promise.”

‘Well… if you’re sure.” Pyrrha looked like she really didn’t want to go, but didn’t have much choice. Before she left, she glared at Ruby.

“Are you really okay?” Ruby asked, as the door shut.

“I cried a bit, but it helped.” Jaune admitted. “Part of me always knew we wouldn’t get together, but I wanted to try. You miss 100% of the shots you never take. Maybe everyone was right and I should try to find someone else.”

“I’m sure there’s someone close to you who wants you to notice them.” Ruby said.

“Heh. Who would want the mess that is me?”

1132323223212322113121232113212123212122.content:
“Ruby.”

Ruby felt like her chest exploded out of happiness from hearing that.

“W-why?” Pyrrha stuttered.

“Pyrrha, I care about you deeply too,” Jaune told her. “You’re kind, strong, smart, anyone in the world would be glad to have you.”

“T-then w-why?”

“You’re like a sister to me,” Jaune continued. “You’re family and while I would never want to sever ties with you, I’m… not romantically interested. You’re still one of my closest friends and partners. I know this hurts. I really know exactly what this feels like, but I need to be honest. Leading people on is wrong and I can’t do that.”

“I see.” Pyrrha looked downtrodden. “Thank you being direct and honest with me.”

“I promise to still treat you like I always have,” Jaune told her. “You’re family.”

“I… would like that.” Pyrrha wiped a tear from her eyes. “Well, I should go and let you two talk.” She stood up and left before Jaune could say a word.

“That… could have gone better.” He muttered.

“It could have been worse too.” Ruby told him. She hugged him tightly. “I’m so happy right now, I feel like I could burst.”

Jaune hugged her back and smiled.

“I’m happy too. I should have seen it sooner.”

Ruby lowered her head and bit the corner of her lip. Jaune’s blue eyes glowed back only a few inches away. Their faces began to slowly move closer. An instant felt like an eternity. At last, their lips met and Ruby was in heaven. This was everything she wanted. His strong arms wrapped around her, his kindness to not only her, but everyone around them, and his warm body pressed against her own. They broke apart and Ruby fell on the bed, grinning stupidly.

“What now?” Jaune asked.

“Hmm.” Ruby slipped her hand into her pocket and hit the Rest button. With a flash, she was back to normal. No longer metal, no longer older, no longer possessing stolen body parts. She was completely herself. It actually felt good. Different but good. Jaune didn’t notice anything different and she was glad she waited. “I think I know.”

Let’s say he swapped body with Adrian and Ruby wanted another round of sex, that would be creepy. No, it was best to just take it to the bedroom and wait until tomorrow. He went upstairs and head Ruby singing a song to Adrian, while rocking him asleep. He smiled. Ruby would be a great mom.

He sat down on the bed and put the remote on the bedside stand and waited for Ruby. About five minutes later she returned.

“He wasn’t wet or hungry, so I think he must have had a bad dream.” Ruby sat down next to him. “I’m going to miss him when we swap back.”

“We can always visit,” Jaune reminded her. “Saph and Terra would love that.”

“I know, but I also know we have our own lives to lead.” Ruby said and fell back on the bed. “Being an adult sucks.”

“Huh, you want to be Adrian again?” Jaune teased and she stuck her tongue out at him.

“Can we just… cuddle the rest of the night?” Ruby asked.

“Of course.” They got under the blankets and Jaune wrapped his arms around Ruby to pull her close. Their naked bodies were pressed tightly against each other. Both of them enjoyed feeling the other and they slowly fell asleep.

Their alarm clock woke them up what felt like two seconds later.

“I’m up!” Ruby gasped, falling out of bed. Jaune laughed at her as he got up. ‘Not funny.”

“It was pretty funny.” He heard Adrian start to make noise. “I think It’s time.”

“Yeah.” She held out the remote and Jaune touched it. Ruby kissed him once more before hitting the button.

Instantly, she found herself back in Beacon, in her dorm room, with her teammates all getting dressed.

“It’s Friday after we got back from the worst fieldtrip ever,” Yang complained. “Why do we still have classes?”

“It’s because the want us to treat missions like real world scenarios.” Blake explained. “We are expect to come back and continue our lives like normal.”

“Besides,” Ruby said, trying to act like a leader. She hid the remote in her pocket. Jaune would be with his team now. “The field trip wasn’t that bad…” Everyone stared at her. “What?”

“Did you… block the last few days from your memory?” Blake asked concerned.

“No?” Ruby was confused.

“It literally down poured the ENITRE trip,” Weiss stated in shock. “Oobleck made us go out and collect artifacts, PLUS we had to keep fighting Grimm who seemed to LIKE when it was raining. I felt like I would never be dry again.”

“Everything of ours was muddy and soaked,” Yang continued. “You complained about being stuck in a tent most of the time because it was too wet. The showers in the gym were packed as everyone couldn’t wait until they got to their dorm to shower.”

“Er… right.” Ruby suddenly saw the memories of how bad the trip was. The highlight was them all sitting in a tent playing cards. Everything else sucked. “I’m just trying to be positive.”

“There is a difference between positivity and denial.” Weiss huffed. “Now, should we go get breakfast? I for one am going to enjoy a hot meal.”

“Speaking my language, Weiss.” Yang hopped down from her bed.

Ruby knew she had to get the courage to tell Yang.
