1132323223212322113121232113212123212122.content:
Ruby knew she had to tell Yang but she also knew she needed help so she turned to her best friend and partner for help.

"Hey Weiss?" Ruby started.

"You better not ask me for cookies." Her eyes narrowed.

"Nothing like that, I need your help telling Yang about Jaune and I." She told her.

"Why me?" She asked.

"You're my best friend and partner, and I don't know who else to turn to." Ruby pleaded, "please I'm scared and I don't know what to do or say." Weiss soften her expression upon hearing that.

"Alright I'll help, but only because I have nothing better to do." She said and she felt herself get hugged by Ruby.

"Thanks Weiss!" She thanked, Weiss had a small smile at that when Ruby wasn't looking but she had an image to keep up.

"Okay, off." She huffed, Ruby got off and nodded to her, they went to Yang to tell her.

"Hey Yang?" Ruby started.

"Oh hey Ruby what's up?" She asked.

"Go on." Weiss encouraged, Ruby took a deep breath and said.

"I'm dating Jaune!" She told her. Yang chuckled at that.

"Okay Ruby no need to." She started before being interrupted.

"No I'm serious, I'm dating Jaune and have been for some time." She informed her. Yang's eyes narrowed.

"And have you been doing that?" She asked.

"Yes I have!" Her eyes narrowed back.

"Yang, she's old enough to make her own decisions, leave her be." Weiss told her.

"You stay out of this!" Yang growled "I can't believe you would do something so stupid!"

"Shut up Yang!" Ruby shouted, causing her to be stunned in silence, "maybe it is stupid of me, but it's my stupid decision to make, so let me make it!"

"Ruby you're to young to." She began before getting cut off again.

"How is it I'm too young for sex and dating but old enough to be a huntress?" She growled "I didn't say anything because I knew you'd be like this, I'm not a child anymore and if you get in my way I'll plow right through you!"

"Ruby, I." Yang stammered.

"Yang, Ruby maybe a dolt but she's proven herself time and time again." Weiss told her "Let her make her own decisions, let her grow up, she won't learn otherwise and she can stop being less of a dolt, maybe."

"Thanks Weiss." Ruby dead panned. "You're not going to stop me from seeing him, and if you try to hurt him I'll never forgive you, I don't care if you don't like it I just want you to respect my decision."

"Are you sure this what you want?" Yang asked.

"Yes." Ruby nodded. Yang sighed.

"I guess it's time to let the Rose grow into a flower." Yang sighed "I just don't want to lose you."

"You won't I promise." Ruby assured.

"Thanks for that, and be careful." Yang told her.

"I'm not that stupid, I know our affection has to be at a minimum, and we take good measures to ensure I don't become an early mother." Ruby mentioned.

"That's good." Yang nodded "seems like you know what you're doing, so who am I to stop you?"

"Yang, you'll always be my sister, and I'll always love you." Ruby told her.

"Yeah, and I'll always love you too." Yang assured as they hugged, "Now go get your boyfriend, I have to do a mandatory treat you right speech."

"He'll have fun with that." Ruby chuckled turning to Weiss "Thanks again Weiss."

"Just be happy with him." Weiss told her. Ruby nodded as she left to find Jaune. Upon finding him she told her what happened with Yang.

"Well it could've been worse, now it's my turn to deal with her." Jaune gulped.

"You'll be fine." Ruby smiled and kissed him, he went to face Yang and her speech.

1132323223212322113121232113212123212122.content:
“So you finally told her?”

“Ahhh!”

Ruby jumped in surprise and turned around wildly. Weiss had left, but Blake had snuck up on her.

“Blake,” Ruby gasped. “You scared me.”

“Sorry.” She apologized. “I heard you tell Yang and I was rather impressed at the way you handled the situation.”

“Yeah, I…. wait.” Ruby stared at her. “You knew Jaune and I were dating?”

“You two are quite similar and I noticed you were hanging out a lot more before we left on the trip,” Blake said. “I assumed you tow were secretly dating to avoid Yang’s wrath.”

“Yeah, that’s what happened.” Ruby admitted. “He treats me well and I really do love him.”

“Then I’m glad you finally told Yang.” Blake patted her on the back. “It would have been worse if she found out from someone else.”

“Blake, can I ask you something?” Ruby asked. “And I need an honest answer.”

Blake titled her head and nodded to let her know she could continue.

“Do you think I’m too young to date?”

“Does it matter what I think?” Blake asked back. “Would it change your mind?”

Ruby shook her head.

“Then no.” Blake smiled. “I think that fact alone proves that you can think for yourself. If you just do what other people tell you, you will never grow up. Take advice from your family and friends, sure, but you need to make your own decisions. If you ever need help or advice, I know Yang will be there for you. Same goes for Weiss and me.”

“Thanks Blake.” She hugged her teammate. “I should have told Yang earlier.”

“You might not have been ready then.” Blake pointed out. “You seemed to have grown over the last week. I assume you two have done it then?”

Ruby nodded slowly, her face reddening.

“Can I ask you something then?” Blake asked.

“Huh, sure?”

“Is he as big as Pyrrha makes him out to be?”

No one would be surprise to see smoke coming from Ruby’s ears.

“BLLLAAAKKKEEE!” She cried and ran off, leaving rose pedals behind her as she fled at full speed.

Blake was a little disappointed she didn’t find out. Though, she was pretty sure Pyrrha exaggerated. It would be tough to hide something that big in jeans.

More than I doubt I can ever payback in a life time. I don’t think I could date you after everything…” Jaune paused. “I consider us family. You’re like a sister to me. The one I can talk to about anything, that’s always there for me.”

Pyrrha didn’t know how to respond to these words. Her heart both broke at the fact they wouldn’t be together, but at the same time was happy to have someone so close to her. Someone who didn’t see her as Pyrrha the Champion, but Pyrrha Nikos, the person. The silence lengthened and she finally spoke again.

“Nora and Yang said I should keep moving forward,” Pyrrha admitted. “That you and Ruby might not stay together. That first relationships don’t always work. Years later, I might have a chance. But I can’t hold onto the past. I may meet someone else I fall for.”

“I can’t say I know the future either,” Jaune admitted. “I never foresaw me with Ruby and Penny. We may not work out, but right now, we plan to try. That’s all I can do right now. I can promise, that no matter what happens, no matter what you and I face in the future, I’ll always be by yourside to help in any way I can.”

Pyrrha’s eyes watered and she hugged him.

“I… will like that.” She admitted. “Things will be weird for a little bit, but I promise to try to move on. To have things like before.”

“That means a lot to me.” Jaune replied. “Knowing we will always be family.” Pyrrha sniffled as he returned the hug. For all he knew, Ruby and Penny might let Pyrrha in. Shoot, if Pyrrha asked, Penny would probably say yes and Ruby would be too shocked to deny it.

They stayed hugging for a while before finally breaking apart. The air wasn’t completely cleared, but it was clearing up as they went to bed.

XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX

The next morning, Jaune met up with Penny and Ruby outside Beacon near the edge of the Emerald Forest. Far away from anyone else.

“So we plan to just destroy it here?” Ruby asked.

“It’s not like we can throw it into a volcano,” Jaune pointed out.

“That would be a very far ride to do that.” Penny calculated. “That’s just taking into account flying. We would then have to hike the rest of the way up the slope…”

“A long time, got it.” Jaune interrupted. “Who wants to do the honors?”

“You do it.” Ruby said. “I don’t know why. But seeing you swing a sword seems more appropriate. Like you’re slaying a dragon.”

“Can you do it shirtless?” Penny added.

Ruby and Jaune stared at her.

“… I remember it from last night and liked it.” Penny said quietly.

“She’s learned too much.” Jaune whispered. “The remote must be destroyed.”

“Do it shirtless.” Ruby pushed.

“Fine…”

Jaune raised the sword above his head, like he was at a chopping block. Shirtless for his girlfriends to drool over. The remote laid on the ground, looking completely normal. The sword came down and in one clear cut, the remote was sliced in half.
1132323223212322113121232113212123212122.title: Jaune said they'd still only be friends

1132323223212322113121232113212123212122.content:
The remote cut it pieces, destroyed never to be used again. Jaune sighed of relief as the object that caused a lot of fun and agony ended.

"It's over." Jaune sighed of relief.

"Part of me is going to miss it, we all got together because of it after all, I'd never would've realized my feelings for Jaune and Penny wouldn't have been with us either." Ruby mentioned.

"Agreed, but it did some terrible things too." Penny mentioned, "was it a good device or evil?"

"Neither, it was a device, only the person wielding it decides what type of device it is." Jaune said.

"It's why it needed to be destroyed, can you imagine Cardin or Cinder having it?" Ruby shuddered.

"They abuse the hell out of it, ruin lives, violate bodies, the list goes on." Jaune agreed.

"Perhaps it's for the best it is gone." Penny mentioned.

"So now that that's taken care of can I put my shirt back on?" Jaune asked, they shook their heads no, "didn't think so."

"You can put it back on when we go back inside." Ruby told him.

"Fine!" Jaune smiled at that and the three of them kissed.

"So is the team awkward with me still?" Jaune asked.

"They're getting better, a day or two more and they'll be back to normal." Ruby replied.

"What about you Penny, any....complications?" Jaune asked.

"Plenty but I told the general I'm not his tool, my father was thankfully with me in this, the good news is he allowed it eventually, I'm no longer Mantle's protector nor am I his project, he gave me full pardon from my duties." Penny told him.

"That's good." Jaune mentioned. "Now for everyone else to hear the news."

"We'll live." Ruby chuckled. "Alright time to put your shirt back on."

"Aw!" Penny groaned, Jaune smiled at them and did so before heading back.

"So Pyrrha told me she's interested in being yours as well." Ruby commented.

"I should've known she wouldn't give up so easily, we had a chat yesterday and she said she wasn't over me, she promised me she'll try to move on but she opted for one last ditch effort to be with me I guess." Jaune sighed.

"I can't blame her, you are irresistible." Ruby giggled.

"That you are." Penny giggled as well. "would you want to include her?"

"Would you?" Jaune countered.

"Well...." Ruby started as they all went inside Beacon to share their life together and face the future, whatever it may bring.
1132323223212322113121232113212123212122.title: Nothing happened and the remote is destroyed. (...

choices: Life Swap with Zwei.
Life Swap with someone else the next day to spy on her friends' date.
Use the Personal Info Swap to spy on her friends' date.
113232322323.content:
Ruby hung out with Jaune for another thirty minutes, though she could barely concentrate on the game. Her eyes kept darting to her friend and, now, crush. The Personal Info Swap had a lot of unforeseeable results. The world adjusted to fit the new information, even herself. Fumbling with an excuse about having to meet her team, she left and slipped back into her own room, grateful it was empty. Ruby sat down on Weiss’s bed and fell backwards, looking at the bottom of her own.

“This had gotten complicated. Maybe I should never have messed with Weiss’s life.”

“Bark?” Ruby sat up and saw Zwei, her pet corgi, rubbing her leg. He may not have known what was wrong, but he knew something was. His master was upset and he was trying to cheer her up.

“Zwei, you are the sweetest thing ever!” Ruby declared and picked him up. She fell back on the bed clutching him against her chest. “What do I do? I might have made things really complicated.”

Zwei’s response was to tilt his head.

“I know, I know,” Ruby continued. “I made my bed and I have to lie in it. Maybe I could use the remote to help out or at least observe?” Zwei covered his face with his paws. “If I did observe, I would have to swap with someone else. Probably Life Swap because a Body Swap would still have others see me as me. I could swap some Personal Info with someone I guess to make me a stranger to them. Weird stuff happens when I do that though.” She scratched Zwei’s ear and he slumped down on her, content. “Sometimes, I’m jealous how easy you have it, Zwei.”

Her hand scratching his ear froze.

Would that work?

The pamphlet on the remote never forbade swaps with animals. It never even mentioned humans. The term it used was target. An animal would be a great target to test the remote on. Ruby could swap with a bird or something and just watch Weiss’s and Jaune’s date. If the opportunity presented itself, she might be able to help or hinder them. She was still conflicted and hoped she would make the right decision for her friends when the time came. This would be risky, but luckily she had a perfect test subject in front of her.

What swap does she decide on?
113232322323.title: Ruby started this. Time to see it through.

choices: She finds the remote.
She can't find the remote.
Someone enters the room before she finds the remote.
1132323223231.content:
“Okay, boy,” Ruby said slowly, putting down her pet dog on the floor. “Don’t freak out if this doesn’t work. Stay.” She held out a hand and Zwei sat, staring at her attentively. A flash of green light went off when Ruby hit the Life Swap button. When the light faded, Ruby found herself on the floor. That wouldn’t have been a big deal, since she had Life Swapped with Weiss already. What freaked her out the most was the draft she suddenly felt over her entire body. She looked down and cried out in shock.

She was completely naked except for a collar.

“Eeep!” Ruby squealed, dropping the remote, squatting down, and covering herself. All of her clothes had disappeared.

“Bark!?”

Ruby looked up and saw Zwei, sitting up on Weiss’s bed, where Ruby had just been. The sight before her was so odd, she actually forgot she was nude. Zwei was wearing her clothes, which shrunk down to fit his frame. Ruby’s red dress covered his body and her combat boots were covering his back legs. What’s more, like with Weiss, his hair had been switched. Zwei now had slightly longer black hair with red tips, Ruby’s hair. Zwei was also sitting on his butt, with his back legs over the side of the bed, like how a person would sit. Ruby’s mouth fell open as he jumped off the bed. Zwei walked over to her and reached up to pet her head with his paw, before making his way to the door. Before Ruby could try to stop him, he jumped up, turned the handle and disappeared into the hallway.

“Wait!” Ruby called out, but it was too late. The door shut behind him. “Ah!” She remained crouch there, covering herself, as what happened sunk in. “Calm down and think, Ruby.” Her hand moved up to her head and felt the short soft hair she normally associated with Zwei. “This is what you wanted to test out, right?” She slowly stood up, her face reddening from the embarrassment, arms still covering her precious areas, and looked into the mirror.

Zwei stared back.

“Okay,” Ruby stated out loud in an attempt to steady her nerves. “You Life Swapped with Zwei and, as you, he must have thought of something to get out of the situation. He shouldn’t know about the remote though, so it might be him trying to figure out your feelings for Jaune.” She shivered. “I want to be the one to do that. I can’t stay as him for too long. Hopefully, he’s just trying to take his mind off the situation and do some weapon design or something. Yeah, I would do that.” She looked into the mirror again and then down at her body.

She couldn’t bear to stand there naked and pulled one of the sheets off her bed to cover herself. Out of curiosity, she checked her own dresser and saw all of her clothes still there. The only difference was they were much, much smaller. Everything had shrunk to fit Zwei. She shut the door and looked around. Besides the fact Ruby and Zwei had swapped lives and clothes, everything else seemed exactly the same.

I guess that makes sense, she thought. It was the same with me and Weiss. Everyone sees us as each other. Since the remote works on animals, it would be really easy to spy on Jaune and Weiss. She looked down at herself. Being naked is going to be tough to put up with and I don’t want to force someone else to be in town. That would just be weird. She laughed at the thought. Her day was already weird enough. Ruby then glanced around for the remote.
1132323223231.title: A Dog's Life

choices: Someone comes to take “Zwei” on a walk
Ruby escapes into the hallway
Something else
11323232232312.content:
Ruby searched through the room for the remote, trying to find the missing device before anyone could stop her. She ripped things out from underneath the bed, tossed pillows across the room as the stinging cold of the room washed over her skin. She sat on the bed and whined, fearful that she’d be stuck as her pet’s pet forever. She hopped off the bed and walked to Zwei,s bed in the corner,which had grown to accommodate her size.

As she lay on the bed, a thought clicked in her mind.Zwei had her life,meaning he must have the remote. She got up onto all fours and walked to the door, trying to think of a way to open it and search for the remote . For some reason she was having a hard time picturing the correct movements to use the knob. She wasn’t even sure if she could get her mouth around it....
11323232232312.title: She can't find the remote.

choices: Get some rest. She has a plan to spy on her friends tommorrow.
Test out more unusual swaps tonight to prepare for the date.
Something else comes up.
11323232232313.content:
Where is it? Ruby thought searching around the floor. Did it get knocked under something? The remote had vanished from view. Before she had the opportunity to look under the beds and desks, the room door opened and she jumped in panic.

“Wonder where she’s off in a hurry,” Yang muttered, rubbing the back of her head. “That girl can’t stay still for the life of her.” Her eyes fell onto Ruby. “What are you doing?!” she snapped suddenly.

“It’s not what it looks like, Yang!” Ruby tried to explain her situation. “I…er, was just…” She couldn’t come up with an excuse and Yang didn’t give her a chance to think of one. She walked up to Ruby and yanked the sheet off of her.

“Bad dog!” Yang admonished, sounding as if she didn't understand anything Ruby said. “You know these don’t belong to you. I know Ruby lets you bunk with her, but don’t damage the sheets!” She rubbed her face as she threw the sheet back up onto Ruby’s bed. “That girl baby’s you too much.”

Right, Ruby realized. I’m Zwei right now. She sees me as a dog.

“Come here!” Yang cried out suddenly and pulled Ruby into a hug. This was something she did to Zwei all the time and he liked it. Ruby, on the other hand, did not. Her face was being smashed right into her sister’s breasts.

“Stop it! Get off, Yang!” Ruby protests went unheard as Yang scratched her behind the ears. Suddenly, Ruby’s body lost strength and she didn’t want to move as Yang continued. Her leg twitched automatically. For some reason this felt so nice.

“Sorry about yelling, Zwei” Yang apologized, still unknowingly scratching her sister behind the ear. “But you know you can’t play around with our stuff. We brought you chew toys for a reason.” She rubbed her face against Ruby’s. “Come on Zwei, kisses!”

Ruby froze for a moment.

‘Kisses’ was a trick she and Yang had taught Zwei .He would immediately begin licking the face of the person holding him. Ruby really didn’t want to lick Yang, though Zwei’s life was telling her too. She settled with a quick peck on Yang’s cheek, hoping she would let her go. It satisfied her current life’s desire too.

“You’re the sweetest dog ever,” Yang cooed, finally letting Ruby go, who sighed in relief and covered herself again. “Sorry I can’t stick around. Need to pick up my scroll.” She grabbed it from her desk and then stopped. “I suppose it wouldn’t hurt.” She headed toward the closet and pulled out a can of dog food. Grabbing the can opener, she smoothly opened it and unloaded the brown mush into Zwei’s bowl. “As an apology for yelling.” She headed toward the door. “Bye, Zwei. Behave yourself.”

That was so embarrassing, Ruby thought mortified, her face crimson. I need to switch back before someone else comes in. At least I know no one notices me being naked. She flushed even more. “I can’t get use to not wearing clothes,” she muttered. “Now, where’s that remote.” She got down on her hands and knees and looked under the bed. “There you are! I was worried I might be stuck like this.” Before she could hit the undo button, her eyes traveled to the dog food Yang left out.

Without wanting too, she could feel herself beginning to drool.

“Get a hold of yourself!” Ruby slapped her checks with her hands and the desire stopped. “Have to watch out for animal instincts.” She hit the undo button and it was followed by a flash of light. The next second, Ruby found herself in a hallway, unsure of what she was going to do. Whatever Zwei had been planning was lost on her.

What should she do now?
11323232232313.title: Dog's Perspective

choices: Ruby hit a student from Beacon.
Ruby hit a student from another school.
Oops, Ruby accidently hit Jaune or Weiss.
113232322323131.content:
A yawn escaped her lips.

It’s still early, Ruby thought to herself. But I should get some sleep. Depending on what happens, it might be a long day tomorrow. She glanced down at the remote once more before slipping it into her pocket. I’m not going to interfere, I’m just going to watch. Yep, nothing else. Just watch and observe. Once Weiss turns him down, I’ll know what to do to cheer him up.

She felt a weird combination of excitement and guilt.

-------------------------------------------------

“Weiss~.” Yang sang the next day. “Your date is here!”

“Shut it, Yang,” Weiss snapped, sitting up from her bed. She didn’t put any specific effort into her outfit. It was her normal white dress which doubled as a combat outfit. “This is a one-time thing so he realizes we aren’t compatible.”

“I’ll just have to prove you wrong,” Jaune countered. He was still glowing from finally achieving his dream.

“Someone seems confident,” Blake commented. “I take it he has a plan.”

“An itinerary is the least he should do,” Weiss agreed.

“I did plan today out,” Jaune confirmed. “I’ll tell you about it on the way to Vale, unless you rather I keep it a surprise.”

“Tell me,” Weiss ordered. “I’m not a big fan of surprises, but wait until we are out of earshot. Some people can’t mind their own business.” The door closed behind them and Yang immediately stood up.

“We are going to spy on them? Right?” She looked at Blake and Ruby expectantly. “Come on, Ruby. It will be fun.”

“I don’t know,” Ruby said slowly. “Jaune worked hard to get her to say yes, we shouldn’t bother them.” Besides, I’m going to spy on them myself in a much better way.

“We aren’t going to bother them,” Yang protested. “We are just going to observe.”

“Nope,” Blake replied and set down her book. “Weiss asked me to make sure you didn’t follow her today.”

“Traitor!” Yang accused. “What happened to being partners!?”

“She was very persuasive,” Blake replied, swinging her legs off the side of the bed. Yang’s eyes narrowed.

“She bribed you, didn’t she?”

“Full set of signed limited edition Ninjas of Love. She received it as a gift last year but doesn’t appreciate the series. It’s mine if I keep you here.”

“What about me?” Ruby asked.

“I told Weiss I probably wouldn’t be able to stop you,” Blake replied honestly. “Unless I tied you down to the bed before you woke up. You’re too fast for me.” She smiled. “Weiss trusts you though to leave them alone.”

Guilt stabbed Ruby in the heart.

Of course, Weiss didn’t say this. She told Blake to guilt trip Ruby into staying behind. There was a small part of her that thought Ruby would stay back, but she wanted to take precautions. This strategy would have worked if Ruby hadn’t possessed that remote.

“You can’t stop me!” Yang declared and rushed for the door. Blake slipped in front of her and stuck out a foot, causing Yang to trip. She smashed into the wall with a loud thud and fell backwards. Blake stood over her and looked down.

“Don’t make me tie you up,” she sighed. “You may be strong, but I have two years on you in experience.” The age swap was still in effect.

Ruby glanced out the window to see Weiss and Jaune heading toward the Bullhead. The problem was they were surrounded by other students, some Beacon and the rest from the other schools. She had never aimed the remote from this far away and there was a good possibility someone else would be hit. She had to do a Life Swap option fast though, or she would lose them. The reason she decided on this swap was a Body Swap wouldn’t change who others saw her as. She would still be Ruby. Personal Info Swaps were risky, as reality changed to fit the new swap. Once she finished spying on them, she would just hit the Undo or Reset button, depending on how many times she had to swap.

She aimed to the best of her ability and clicked the button.
113232322323131.title: Double 0 Ruby

choices: Try to get in as she is.
Swap with a customer.
Swap with an employee
1132323223231312.content:
It took a moment for Ruby to readjust to the suddenly relocation as she found herself in the crowd getting onto the Bullheads. Eyes darting around, she quickly located Weiss and Jaune. It took a little bit of work to push against the crowd, but she managed to slip into the same Bullhead. She wasn’t able to sit next to them though. Instead, the seat across from them was open. It was close enough to listen without seeming suspicious. While everyone was buckling up, Ruby glanced at the girl next to her, who was holding up a hand mirror. It was the first glimpse Ruby received of what she looked like to others.

http://vignette2.wikia.nocookie.net/tops...

Her hair was bright green and swept to her right, matching her eyes. Two black facial markings were on her cheeks. Glancing down, Ruby saw the dark purple hooded sweater over a mauve sweater. To finish off her ensemble were black shorts and black shoelaced high top sneakers. The mirror showed what she looked like to others, but she was sure her body looked weird with the green hair. The girl gave off a punk skater girl vibe.

Doesn’t matter, Ruby thought. It’s not going to affect anything how I look. Whoever this girl is, she likes to dress this way. She could have dug through her new belongings to find an ID, but it wasn’t worth the hassle. There were more important things to do.

Like listen to the people talking in front of her.

“…afterwards I thought we could check out the festival stalls for an hour or two until the movie started,” Jaune explained. “Then, depending on how you feel, we could get dinner or head back.”

“It seems you put some thought into this,” Weiss huffed, though she sounded slightly less irritated then before. “I do appreciate it, but you understand we have nothing in common.”

“You don’t know that,” Jaune protested. “My mother always told me dates were to get to know someone before any serious commitment. We might find something.”

“I seriously doubt it,” Weiss replied and then raised an eyebrow. “I hope you aren’t depleting your bank account for this long shot. I would feel bad if you had to live on scraps for the next month.”

“See,” Jaune said proudly. “There’s something we have in common. Neither of us want to be a burden to others.”

He’s actually doing pretty well, Ruby thought impressed. Her stomach turned slightly as the thought, but not as bad as it did before. The girl whose life she occupied wasn’t into Jaune and dulled the feelings slightly. Jaune also didn't seem to be having his normal motion sickness issues this time, so he probably took some medicine before hand. That was smart on his part. He was really trying.

“It was more along the lines that if Ruby found out, I would never hear the end of it,” Weiss refuted.

Good job at ruining the mood, Weiss.

“Don’t worry,” Jaune reassured her. “I have some money saved up for this sort of thing. I asked you out, so let me make an impression. Show you I’m serious.”

“If you must,” Weiss sighed, seeming to accept this date was happening.

Weiss didn’t hate Jaune, she even admitted that. It was more of his persistence in asking her out, along with the weird ways he tried that irritated her. The serenade still caused her to burn with embarrassment. As Ruby listened, she noticed Jaune was mainly trying to get Weiss involved in conversation, rather than trying to push into something more romantic. He was honestly trying to get to know her and let her see a different side of him. It was working because as the time passed, Weiss’s replies became a little longer.

When the Bullhead landed and everyone departed, Ruby had to hurry to keep up with her targets. She didn’t have super speed anymore and, with the Vytal Festival in town, things were getting crowded on the weekends. The most she could do was keep Jaune and Weiss in sight, unable to get close enough to hear them. An issue came up when they arrived at the café Jaune had a reservation at. It wasn’t the classiest place in Vale, as there was no doubt on Ruby’s mind he couldn’t afford those places, but it was rather nice. Weiss might have come here for a quiet casual dining experience. Well, casual for her. The place was upper middle close for most people.

Ruby looked down at her clothes. The life she currently inhabited would normally never be found here. Her instincts were sending out warning bells. She could go ahead and try to get in if she wanted to, though it would stand out and probably fail. Another option was to switch with someone already inside, like an employee or a customer.
1132323223231312.title: Luck of the Draw

choices: The guy on his own.
One of the four girls.
Someone interrupts her before she can aim.
11323232232313122.content:
If I’m part of the wait staff, Ruby realized, I’m going to have to work. I’ll only be able to catch snippets of their conversation. A customer would be better. She watched from across the street, trying to pretend she was waiting for someone to avoid drawing attention to herself. Jaune and Weiss eventually were seated and now Ruby knew where to target. There were two possible options.

The first was a single guy in the corner of the room reading a book. He had red hair that came down over his right eye, with a complete undercut. His outfit consisted of a white sleeveless shirt and light gray pants. A red coat was draped over his chair. It looked like he was taking advantage of the peaceful atmosphere to catch up on his reading. Something Ruby knew Blake did whenever she could.
https://vignette2.wikia.nocookie.net/rwb...

On the other side of Jaune and Weiss, there was a group of four girls. They were obviously close, which implied they were either friends or a team from another school. All of them wore brightly colored outfits. They were a little closer to Jaune and Weiss, so Ruby would be able to hear her friends better. The issue was she would also have to contend with whatever they were talking about and acting like the person.
http://vignette1.wikia.nocookie.net/rwby...

Ruby looked between her targets as she decided which one to Life Swap with.
11323232232313122.title: Free Meal Ticket

choices: Abandon spying. Testing out a new weapon comes first.
Get out of the mess by swapping with Arslan.
Get out of the mess by swapping with someone else.
113232322323131223.content:
“There you are, Reese!”

Ruby jumped and immediately stashed the remote into her pocket. Normally, she wouldn’t have reacted to that name, but the life she was living did. Before Ruby had a chance to even think, instinct took over and she turned around. A fierce girl with a dark complexion, platinum blonde hair and olive green eyes stood before her. She was wearing a yellow robe with only one wide, loose fitting sleeve over a black tube top. She also has black pants and shoes and a red sash embroidered with a white "endless knot" on it. Bandages wrapped parts of both her arms.
https://vignette4.wikia.nocookie.net/rwb...

“I was just…” Ruby trailed off trying to think of an excuse. The life she was living was also in the same boat. It must be a normal occurrence for her to wander off.

“Looking around and got distracted.” The girl rolled her eyes and grabbed Ruby’s sleeve. “Come on, your weapon is ready. How you jammed it that badly is beyond me.”

Ruby’s eyes started sparkling at her words, wondering what kind of amazing weapon the girl, Reese, who she was currently occupying the life of, had. Memories Ruby was sure wasn’t hers suddenly flash through her mind like she was watching a TV show. She saw herself riding the coolest thing ever, a green hoverboard. It could be thrown, used to smash enemies, and even split apart into two pistols for range attacks. It wasn’t as impressive as her scythe, but she would still love to examine it up close and personal. The reason it broke was Reese had been trying to see how high she could go off a ramp and caused some damage on the landing. The only reason Reese hadn’t repaired it herself was timing issues with them arriving in Vale.

She had lied to her team leader, the girl in front of her, how it happened.

Ruby instinctively knew Arslan was her name thanks to the remote’s power.

“You need to make sure it’s fully functional,” Arslan continued. “We can’t have your weapon malfunction during the tournament.”

“I totally get it,” Ruby agreed surprised at her language. “Don’t worry, Arslan. I heard that guy was top notch. He’ll fix it up, no problem.”

“Good,” Arslan agreed, beginning to drag Ruby. She was way stronger than her. “Last thing we need is it jamming in the middle of a match. You are still going to test it out and make sure it is working perfectly. Understand?”

“Yep!”

Ruby suddenly remembered why she was here. Her initial excitement at being able to test out a new weapon pushed Jaune's and Weiss’s date from her mind. Of course, that was the reason she was even out here in the first place. She knew she really shouldn’t have been spying on them in the first place. Checking out Reese’s weapon was a good excuse to abandon her mission. If she wanted to keep spying, she would either have to get Arslan off her back or swap to someone else.

Her finger reached into her pocket for the remote.
113232322323131223.title: People Have Friends

choices: Go with Arslan to play with the hoverboard more.
Get away from Arslan to start finding new weapons to borrow.
Explore Vale using the power of the remote.
1132323223231312231.content:
It might have been because Ruby wasn’t in her life anymore. Reese’s life didn’t know anything about Jaune or Weiss and wouldn’t be attached to them. Another factor was probably that Ruby didn’t get a chance to try out other people’s weapons as much as she liked. Either way, Ruby decided to forgo spying on her friends. Checking out a new weapon was her new priority. She still planned to learn what the end result of the date was though. It could just wait a little longer.

Ruby and Arslan made their way through Vale. Arslan was leading the way, but Ruby found her feet moving with her in step. Reese had been here before so Ruby just let her life lead. It didn’t take long for Ruby to figure out where they were heading. An old man owned a small weapon’s shop off the main street. She had been there plenty of times to pick up parts. While she liked to make her own weapons and never had to wait for repairs, rumors had it he did good work.

“Ah, you’re here,” the man welcomed them after they walked in. “I remember you. That skateboard of yours took quite a beating, but it’s as good as new.”

“Beating?” Arslan eyed Ruby. “You told me it was just a jam, Reese.”

“Hehehe…” Ruby didn’t need any help acting as she rubbed the back of her neck sheepishly. Arslan sighed as Ruby handed over the credits for the repairs and took it out back to test it out.

“Don’t overdo it,” Arslan ordered. “Just run through the basic motions and make sure there’s nothing unusual.”

“I know!” Ruby called over her shoulder, as she turned the hoverboard on and set it down. It floated about a foot off the ground and excitement overtook her. She hoped on the board and it barely wavered under her weight.

The controls were pretty simple. Well, in theory. Her feet’s positioning determined how the board moved. Normally, it would take a long time to master a sensitive piece of equipment like this, but Ruby had Reese’s life guiding her. Moving on instinct alone, Ruby took off. Shifting her positon slightly, the board veered to the right, nearly throwing her off. It was only thanks to her body’s center of gravity adjusting automatically. She kicked her back leg and the board blasted upwards. Ruby grinned and reached down. The board broke into two halves as she started to fall. After checking the shifting into the guns, she slipped the pieces back together below her. The second her feat landed on the sensors, the hoverboard roared back to life and she swerved away before hitting the ground.

“This… is… awesome!” Ruby cried out. Having a weapon was one thing. A weapon that doubled as transport? That was another thing entirely.

“Everything working then?” Arslan called back, as Ruby zipped over to her.

“It’s like brand new.”

“Good. Then let’s head back to Beacon. We need to hammer out some team strategies.”

“Aww…”

Reese’s life and Ruby both didn’t want that. Of course, Ruby could go along with her and play around with the hoverboard. It’s not like one of those come along every day. This experience also gave her an idea on examining other people’s weapons. Most hunters and huntresses didn’t like other people using their specially designed equipment. With the remote, she could spend days just trying them out. Then there was the fact she was out in Vale and could find something else to do. She would just have to use the remote to get away from Arslan.

11323233.title: Swap with someone else and have them answer.

choices: Stay as Blake
Bring Yang into the mix.
Try out some different swaps.
113232333.content:
Ruby sighed.

It wasn’t so much in annoyance, though Weiss’s life would have dictated it so. No, this was a normal appearance to the others around her that gave Ruby time to think. She really didn’t want to mess with Weiss’s life. At most, she had just been planning to see what it was like and learn a few things about her best friend and partner. Now, she was getting involved in something that should have been private. Stealthily reaching her hand into her hidden pocket for the remote, Ruby aimed the remote at the one other person in the room she could see without turning around.

There was a flash of green light and Ruby found herself laying on a bed, a book in her hand. Her eyes flickered upwards to where she had been to see Blake standing in front of Jaune. Her hand was on her hip, expression one of annoyance, and was dressed in Weiss’s white dress along with her signature white hair tied into a ponytail. Ruby’s heart then stopped for a moment as she saw Blake’s black cat ears on full display.

Oh no! Ruby thought, raising her hand up to feel the black bow on her head. She didn’t get a chance to react as Blake started speaking to Jaune.

“And what makes you think I will change my mind after all your other pitiful attempts?” Blake demanded at Jaune.

“Well… I thought you might finally give me a chance if I planned everything out?” Jaune admitted hopefully.

“You thought wrong.” Blake slammed the door in his face.

Right, she’s living as Weiss so everyone doesn’t notice her ears, Ruby sighed in relief. That means I need to remember to keep the bow on since I’m Blake now.

“You could have been nicer,” Weiss said, noticeably upset. Her arms were crossed and she was looking direct at Blake.

“I tired being nice and just saying no,” Blake huffed. “He didn’t get the message. Maybe now he will stop badgering me for a date.”

“You could at least give him a chance,” Weiss huffed and Ruby had to try very hard to hold back her laughter while staring straight ahead at the book. This was hilarious watching Weiss, who was in Ruby’s life, try to get Blake, who was in Weiss’s life, to give Jaune a shot. “Or at least explain to him nicely why you won’t go out with him. There’s no reason to insult my friend.”

“Fine,” Blake relented. “If he doesn’t get the message and tries again, I’ll sit him down and lay out in detail why we will never happen. Happy?”

“I… guess?” Weiss answered. “Just… don’t be mean.”

“I’m never mean,” Blake scoffed and Ruby couldn’t hold back her own laughter completely. “Is something amusing you, Blake?”

“Nothing,” Ruby replied, focusing all her attention on her book. Blake usually tried to ignore the rest of the team’s shenanigans and usually just commented once in a while. This lifestyle was perfect for Ruby right now, who just wanted to stay out of the way and watch the swaps in action.

“I should go see if Jaune’s okay,” Weiss stated and started for the door, only to have Blake rab her by her cloak.

“Oh, no you don’t,” Blake said quickly. “You have to finish your work first.”

“I’ve been studying forever,” Weiss whined.

“Not even an hour,” Blake corrected her. “We are going to meet with Yang soon, right? Study until then.”

“Fine, slave driver.” Weiss muttered, under her breath.

“I am not,” Blake huffed indignantly. “You need to pass your classes. How would you like it if you get held back? Yang’s even doing better than you.”

Ruby’s stomach sunk at that. This was technically true. Besides classes relating to weapons or engineering, she was slowly falling behind the others. It would take some dedication to raise her grades. Even though she always complained, she really did appreciate Weiss taking time out to help her. Anytime she had a problem, Weiss would coach her through it.

Things were settling down as Weiss started studying in Ruby’s place while Blake was writing something down at Weiss’s desk. Ruby didn’t move from Blake’s bed and began to examine herself. Blake was in her school uniform, not having changed out of it yet. It was exactly the same as Ruby’s except Ruby wore black stockings and her red cape. Blake only wore a bow to cover her ears. As the silence lengthened Ruby’s thoughts turned back to the remote.

She could stay in Blake’s life and see how things differed from her perspective. Blake was relatively secretive and Ruby could use this time to learn more about her teammate. Of course, since three-fourths of her team had been swapped, it would be rude to not include Yang. Having Yang, one of the more outgoing members of their team acting like Blake would be fun to watch. Of course, there were other swaps available to her and she didn’t have to limit herself.
113232333.title: Let Blake Answer

Swap something else.
113233.content:
Ruby decided she wanted to swap intelligence to see what it would be like to have Weiss's smartness while Weiss had to focus on studying.

"That would be amazing," Ruby muttered excitedly to herself. "Not only will I be super smart and intelligent but my grades will improve and Weiss will be the one that will get told what to do with her free time and studying habits.”

"Did you say some Ruby?" Weiss ask her.

"Uhh no. Not at all." Ruby responded back. She looked over her shoulder and noticed Weiss was sitting at her desk studying for the next exam in a couple of weeks. "Okay, time to see what it is like to be a smarty pants." Ruby said in a quiet voice so that Weiss couldn't hear her this time.

Ruby held up the remote and aimed at Weiss, who was currently occupied at the moment. There was no way she was going to turn around for no reason and see what was about to happen to her and her knowledge. Ruby pushes the Personal Info: Intelligent Swap button on the remote and a light green beam shot out, colliding into Weiss’ back on the first try. There wasn’t anything really noticeable at first and Ruby blinked a couple of times.

Suddenly, she could easily remember all the information discussed in class over the last few weeks.

"Woah, I am like SUPER SMART NOW!" She burst out loudly, getting Weiss's attention.

"Ruby can you calm down, I really am trying to study here but everything here is so tough, where is the action, where is the fun. All there are is just political and historical issues that just gives boring points on what we have in our society today and what builds on it." Weiss said sounding more like Ruby when she was studying then herself. “It’s hard to understand.”

"Weiss, I know you may not like studying, but you will hopefully need it someday in the near future when you are running your family business." Ruby said sounding more like Weiss instead of herself. She loved having the knowledge to say these things. Revenge was sweet like cookies.

"Yeah, I guess your right Ruby but it is just so hard, do you think we can take a breather and do something else like, train for the upcoming Vytal festival in a few months or just do something else that just gets our mind off of work and studying."

It seems the instructions were right. Some Personal Information Swaps change more than just the specific attribute. Because Weiss was no longer smart, she wanted to do other stuff over studying.

"I'm sorry Weiss, but studying and knowledge comes first, then we can relax and do something fun later.” Ruby replied still sounding more like Weiss every minute.

"Ohh." Weiss said. "But it is so booooring, Ruby. Can you at least help me on what we need to do for the upcoming test?"

"I'd be glad to Weiss." Ruby told her, pulling up a chair.

Just then, Yang and Blake returned to their team's dorm after finishing up a round of sparing in the training facility.

"Hey guys what's up?" Yang said to both her younger sister and Weiss.

"Hey, Yang." Ruby replied. "How have you and Blake been doing with your training?"

"It’s been going great, Blake came up with a sweet new combo for us.”

As Yang answered Ruby’s questions, Blake walks over to her bed and hoped up on her bunk bed to read her fantasy book, Ninja's of Love, when suddenly, Ruby got an idea.

Maybe she should swap intelligence around with everyone? Might be funny to see Yang acting smart like Weiss. Though, keeping Weiss’ intelligence doesn’t sound like a bad idea either.

114.content:
Ruby was far from a selfish person, unless it dealt with her weapon, Crescent Rose, and cookies.

If this remote was really as powerful as the pamphlet indicated, there were virtually unlimited adventures and fun she could have. If someone else was in on it too, Ruby would have an additional person to not only come up with ideas, but also keep her company. There were a lot of people she could show the remote too. All came with their own positive and negative aspects. She had to choose the right one.

Jaune would be the obvious person to ask. He was her first, best, guy friend and they had a lot of similar interests. He also wouldn’t immediately dismiss her as being crazy if she showed him the remote. The downside was Jaune was kind of reserved and might not encourage her to try out the full potential of the remote. On the other hand, if might help him come out of his shell around others.

Her sister, Yang, was another good option. Yang was an outgoing party girl that was sure to have ideas on how to use the remote. The downside was her ideas might involve dirty and filthy things. It was a risk Ruby would have to take. She was confident her sister wouldn’t go too far and Ruby was bound to have fun. All she had to do was ignore the teasing and terrible puns.

The third choice was Weiss, her partner. This was actually risky. First, Ruby would have to convince Weiss the remote was real. If it was real, Weiss would have to be convinced to try it out with Ruby. That might be easy though, as she would want to figure out how it worked. She was also smart and could think of more unusual ways to use the remote. It was also be a great team building activity for them. The biggest drawback was she might not approve of anything extremely exciting.

Ruby rushed to Beacon to find…

"I don't think so since there's an undo and reset button that reverse the last swap or all swaps."
So Yang and Ruby spent a little longer talking about the remote, whether or not it would actually work and some ideas about what they might do if it did.

“Thanks, Rubes.” Weiss said, using the affectionate nickname Yang and Jaune used on her over dolt. “So, what’s new?”

“Not much, just hanging out, training, skipping homework.” Ruby added the last bit to test out Weiss.

The bold confidence of Yang was there.

She had done body and part swap, clothes swap, age swap, and say personality swaps. That left trying out Life Swaps and other Personal Information Swaps. She would keep her body, but not her clothes or personal information.

1142132312112213.content:
“Hey, Rubes.”

“Ah!”

Ruby jerked the remote up and when she hit the button, she missed. Luckily, the beam didn’t hit anyone.

“Jaune!” Ruby reprimanded, spinning around. “Don’t scare me like that!”

“Hehe, sorry.” Jaune apologized and Ruby relaxed. She couldn’t be mad at him. “So, what were you doing? What’s with that remote?”

“Oh, it’s just something I found,” Ruby replied, putting it away. “Thought I could get it to work for our TV when Yang accidently breaks it.” Ruby noticed Blake getting up and she didn’t want to be caught coming back. Blake would get suspicious, so Ruby led Jaune away from the library as they talked about some of their interests, including the new comics that just came out.

“Yeah, it was a good one alright,” Jaune agreed. “Did not see that cliffhanger coming.”

“So, Jaune.” Ruby told him. “I have a question for you. Hypothetical one.”

“Shoot.”

“If you could swap lives with someone for a day, anyone you wanted, who would you chose?” Ruby asked.

“Hmm,” Jaune thought about it. “Probably someone completely different than me.”

“Why?” Ruby asked.

“Sounds like a great chance to learn how other people live,” Jaune said. “Sure, living the life of someone I know would be easier, but getting to know someone I’m not super familiar with would be a chance to learn about them.”

“Huh, never thought of that.” Ruby admitted. “Gives me something to think about.”

“No problem, but why ask that?”

“Oh, no reason.” Ruby laughed as she took off.

She could go back for Blake, but as Jaune said, maybe it’s a chance to learn more about the life of other people. Maybe she could learn new things to improve herself. There were plenty of Beacon students she didn’t know that well and then there were students form other schools. So many choices for a Life Swap.

1143.content:
"Weiss!" Ruby's scream carried through the hallways as she sped toward their dorm. While Weiss Schnee was the most likely to be disapproving of Ruby's ideas, she was also the one who most needed to loosen up.

Weiss jolted up from her seat as Ruby crashed through the door. "Gah! Ruby! Would it kill you to slow down once in awhile?" Ruby ignored the heiress' words, knowing it would only end in yet another boring lecture.

"Forget about that, you need to look at what I just found." Ruby pushed the mysterious remote and its matching pamphlet onto her partner's hands. It only took Weiss a few seconds to scan through the pages and understand just what her partner thought the remote was. Of course, Weiss wasn't having any part of it.

"Ruby, aren't you a little too old to be playing with toys like this?" Weiss scoffed.

"Come on Weiss, I'll admit it does seem a bit impossible, but wouldn't it be so cool if it did work? Besides, how often do you find remotes in the Emerald Forest? It has to do something interesting. Think of the possibilities!" Ruby exclaimed, her imagination running wild with all the things they could do with the remote.

"Why do you think I would need such a thing? I may not be perfect, but I'm further along that path than anyone else here." Weiss claimed with a flip of her hair. Ruby rolled her eyes at her prideful best friend. The redhead already knew what little things Weiss was self conscious about, even if the ice queen herself loathed to admit it.

"Even if it can give you Yang's boobs?" Weiss' shocked, blushing face told her she hit her mark dead on.

Weiss quietly, though angrily, contemplated her choices. While she was... lacking in certain assets, there were a few other things that did honestly catch her attention. While she wore her pride on her sleeve, she wouldn't mind leaving the life of a Schnee, if only to truly get away from her father's influence for a bit. There was also the matter of Weiss and Blake's falling out due to their views on Faunus much earlier in the year. While they had made up, there was lingering guilt that makes her believe she could stand to learn a little more and what better way than seeing life from their perspective... Of course, there were also the breasts, but the fact that Ruby had pointed that out so easily made it a sore subject.

"Alright, fine. We'll test the remote. But let's make this clear, we're doing this to see whether or not this device is dangerous and-" Weiss' lecture to justify their actions was cut short by Ruby grabbing one end of the remote and placing Weiss' hand on the other.

"Come on Weiss. There's no one around to hear you monologue, let's just get it over with already." Ruby said impatiently

"Wait! Don't just go around pressing any of the buttons! I'd rather not be stuck as some Weiss-Ruby hybrid if something breaks. At least pick something trivial to switch." Weiss stated, though she was already aware that no matter what her leader picked would lead to awkward shenanigans.
1143.title: Red and White

11431.content:
As Ruby pressed the button a bright flash obscured the girls' visions. When the light resigned, the duo were met with their own faces staring back at them.

"Whoa, it actually worked!" Weiss's voice rang out with uncharacteristic excitement. The now white haired girl sprung to her feet, looking for a mirror to see her new look.

"Ruby, why'd you pick that one!?" Ruby's own body raged against its old owner. While some small part of Weiss wanted to see the remote work, the actual feeling and shock of being in another body as well as seeing someone control her own body sent threw her into a panic.

"I don't see the problem. It's not like we're not ourselves, we just look different." Ruby reasoned.

"We're literally in each other's bodies, you dolt! There's no way to violate someone's privacy any more than what we're doing now. We should've eased into it with a clothes swap or something." Weiss complained. However, Ruby had already taken to checking out her new body in the mirror.

"*squee* This is so cool! Come on Weiss, we've got a magic remote! What could be better?"

Ruby moved back and forth in front of the mirror, making odd expressions, messing with her longer hair, and watching her reflection copy her. Despite her initial demeanor, Weiss couldn't help but smile at the sight. Weiss had often seen herself in the mirror, wearing the refined and composed look that was expected of her status and upbringing, but now that same face wore a goofy smile that was could've only belonged to Ruby Rose. Weiss had to hold herself back from laughing at the contrast.

"What're you laughing at?" Ruby asked.

"I thought you would've inherited some of my elegance along with my body, but you're the same goofball as always." Weiss said. "I don't think I've ever seen myself smile so widely."

"I'll take that as a compliment. Now get up here. I wanna see what we look like together... I mean we look like each other obviously, but you know what I meant." Ruby said, pulling Weiss up from where she sat. Now with both of them together, they could fully appreciate the changes brought on. Weiss had put so much emphasis on swapping bodies that the two nearly forgot the clothes did not follow. While the image in the mirror seemed like the two simply swapped clothes, that image was quickly shattered. Ruby's wild movements and prancing around made it clear who was in control of the ice queen's body while Weiss moved carefully, slowly acclimating to her new body.

"I'm surprised. You look much better than I thought." Weiss said. Her words came out slowly, as she finally took in how different it was hearing someone else's voice come out of her mouth.

"Thanks. Wait, were you talking about 'you' as in me or 'you' as in you, because either way it seems kinda narcissistic." Ruby reasoned.

"I was talking about your body in my clothes. It's definitely a different look, but it's not bad. I suppose 'you' you also looks good, but I like to think I know how to dress my body best." Weiss claimed, a smug look on her younger face. Ruby looked on in amusement at the pride of a Schnee held within her adorable frame before coming to a troubling realization.

"You're still taller than me! You're stupid heels still give you the advantage" Ruby bemoaned.

"That's what you're concerned about?" Weiss asked incredulously. The two broke out into smiles at how quickly their magical antics had taken a mundane turn.

12.content:
“What’s that?”

Jaune Arc, the loveable goof and self-proclaimed ladies’ man of Team JNPR, stopped and looked down at the device laying in the grass. He had been walking along the grounds of Beacon for some fresh air and to avoid the bully Cardin. Just because Jaune wasn’t very skilled, faking his transcripts of attending combat school and all, Cardin and his friends picked on him a lot. He was even still wearing his uniform; black suit lined with gold, accompanied by a blue vest and a white shirt with a red tie. The walk had been his way of cooling off and not having his teammate try to console him. He knew they meant well, but it made him feel inadequate. As not many people came out this far, Jaune was surprised to see something laying out in the open.

“A remote?” He picked it up and saw a small pamphlet underneath. At this point, he might have just left the remote in the grass, but the title on the pamphlet caught his eye.

Your Guide to the Swapping Remote

“This can’t be real,” Jaune muttered and skimmed the guide. “This really can’t be real,” he repeated when he finished. His eyes fell onto the remote and saw all the different buttons, exactly like the instructions said. “This has to be a prank.” There was only one thing to do to make sure, as the temptation was too great to ignore.

He needed to find a guinea pig.

To his surprise, there was one girl within range. The quiet girl with long black hair from Team RWBY, Blake Belladonna sitting under a tree in the distance. She was wearing the Beacon uniform consisting of brown shoes, red tartan skirt, white blouse, brown vest with gold buttons, and maroon blazer with gold trim alongside knee-high black socks. The only difference from other girls was the black bow in her hair that Jaune knew covered her Faunus ears. She didn’t want others finding out, but he and the rest of her team knew.

I shouldn’t be surprised, Jaune thought, noticing Blake was reading a book. From his experience, Yang was a very loud roommate for Blake and she took the opportunity to find some peace and quiet whenever she could. This was the perfect opportunity for Jaune to try out the remote.
12.title: Jaune

choices: Go to Ruby's Dorm

Find Someone Else
121.content:
A little test wouldn’t hurt.

In all honesty, Jaune was in the clear. If the remote was a prank and nothing happened, no one would be upset. If it worked as intended, Blake should have no idea anything happened. The only problem would arise if the remote worked yet everyone noticed. In that case, Jaune could find himself at the end of a very angry girl whose combat prowess far exceeded his own. His life would be forfeit in that situation.

I could always deny I knew anything about it, Jaune thought. He wasn’t a bad person, but temptation is a very powerful tool. Plus, with a reset button, there would be no lasting damage. The entertainment value, however, was endless. He aimed the remote and hit the button for body part swap then made his selection.

The remote flashed green for a moment and then he felt additional weight on his hair.

“It worked…” Jaune couldn’t believe it as he ran a hand through his hair. The test had been simply switching his hair with hers. Now Jaune, who normally had short scraggly blonde hair, now had thick luscious black hair that reached down to his lower black. When he glanced over at Blake, he had to suppress a snort. Completely unfazed by the swap, Blake was still reading a book.

The difference was she now had Jaune’s hair and the black bow hiding her ears looked ridiculous.

Holy shit! Jaune couldn’t believe the power this remote had. Reality changed based on the press of a button. He smiled. “Think of all the fun I could have with this.” He snickered. “First, let’s mess with Blake a little bit.” A harmless prank couldn’t hurt. He clicked the Personal Info button and selected names. There was another green flash of light and Jaune took a deep breath as he marched over to her.

This was the risky part.

“Hi, Jaune,” he greeted. Blake looked up and Jaune’s breath caught in his chest. This was the moment of truth. Their names had been switched and he had to see if Blake noticed it or not. Jaune’s brain was already panicking about what to do if she thought he was crazy.

“Hi, Blake,” she replied after a moment and Jaune had to catch himself from sighing in relief. She turned a page in her book as he struggled to think of a reason to talk to her.

“I’m heading back to the dorm,” Jaune explained. “Do you know if Ruby is there?”

“I believe so,” Blake answered. “Weiss wanted her to get her grades up. Part of being a team leader or something.” Her expression said she didn’t believe that was the real reason.

“Ah, okay. Thanks, Jaune.” He made sure to repeat the name for fun. Blake hummed in response. “Oh, one other thing.” He flipped his hair back. “Have you notice anything unusual today?” Blake raised an eyebrow.

“Unusual?”

“Yeah. Not sure what it is, but something seems off.” He brushed his black hair off his shoulder.

“Seems like a normal day for me,” Blake replied, her bow twitched slightly and she tilted her head. “Don’t worry about losing to Cardin. Keep training and you can teach him a lesson one day.”

“Thanks.” Jaune was surprised she actually encouraged him. Blake nodded and glued her eyes back to her book, indicating the conversation was over. As Jaune left, he clicked the reset button of the remote and everything went back to normal. His head felt considerably lighter.

Now he needed to decide what to do.

Instead, his sense of justice managed to hold out until he reached the landing with his and Ruby’s dorm. The urge to rush toward Ruby’s room was great, but he wanted to drop off his bag.

“She wanted to practice a new combo in the training facility,” Ren explained. “And we are about to go into the Emerald Forest to fight a few Grimm this evening. Neither of us were called for combat class and you know Nora.”

Once Jaune was sure they were gone, he walked over to the mirror. Coco’s deep brown eyes stared back. Jaune reached up and touched his cheek, while the mirror imitated his every move. His hand brushed the wavy locks on one side of her face, dyed with a gradient that started in dark brown and transitioned to caramel. Everything was exactly the same as if Jaune was staring at Coco. “Time to go see Ruby,” Jaune declared. Before leaving, he glanced back at the mirror and puckered up his lips. “Coco is so hot.” The door shut behind him and he found himself in front of Ruby’s dorm. According to Blake, Weiss was also there. Taking a deep breath, Jaune knocked.

12131121.content:
“What?” Weiss stared at him with her arms crossed. Unfortunately, she answered the door instead of Ruby. She stood there in the Beacon uniform, not having changed out of it yet.

“I need to speak to Ruby about…” Jaune hesitated a moment. “About a few things for our leadership class.” As he and Ruby were both team leaders, they had additional classes. Weiss didn’t know about their homework or what they were covering.

“Really?” She raised an eyebrow skeptically.

“Yeah.” Jaune nodded. “It shouldn’t take long, but better get it out of the way early so we have the weekend free.”

“Tsk.” Weiss clicked her tongue. As much as she didn’t like Jaune, she wasn’t childish enough to ignore a good point. “Fine. Hey, Ruby!” She called over her shoulder. “The dork is here to ask something about your leadership class homework.”

“Jaune?” Jaune was actually hurt Ruby knew it was him by Weiss’s insult. “Homework? Wha-…”

“Yeah,” Jaune interrupted. When Weiss looked away from him, he shook his head frantically as a sign to Ruby. “Part of it is tripping me up and I could use some help.”

“Ah!” Ruby exclaimed, catching on. “That’s right. The professor assigned it at the last minute, I almost forgot.”

“This is why you write things down,” Weiss scolded.

“Sorry,” Ruby apologized. “I’ll remember. Let me grab my stuff and I’ll meet you in your room.”

“Got it. Thanks, Ruby.” Jaune replied. Little did Weiss know, there was going to be something else happening instead of studying. Nothing sexual of course.

“If that’s it,” Weiss stated. “You can go.” She closed the door in his face.” Jaune sighed and went back to his room, to be joined a minute later by Ruby.

“Thank you so much, Jaune!” Ruby cried and hugged him. “You have no idea how mean Weiss was just because I got a C in history.” Her tone grew higher and colder. “You have to set an example. You’re a leader. You have to get A’s!” Ruby sighed. “You would think I’m not a person or something.”

“She’s just trying to help you reach your full potential,” Jaune reassured her and then grimaced. “She still doesn’t like me.”

“That could be the fact you embarrassed her by asking her out all those times,” Ruby pointed out. “Or you’re not that high up on the combat ladder or grades….”

“Thanks,” Jaune muttered dryly.

“And then your breasts are also larger than hers,” Ruby finished, pointing at Jaune’s chest. “Don’t tell her I said this, but she’s really self-conscious about it.”

Jaune blinked in surprise.

For the first time, someone actually pointed out a difference in his new girl body. However, they didn’t consider it strange. It was nothing unusual to them. Jaune appreciated the information.

“So what you want to do for an hour?” Ruby asked. “I doubt we could sneak down to Vale tonight, even being Friday. Weiss would have my head if I tried to leave. I have an hour at best.”

“Who’s the leader of your team again?” Jaune teased.

“Shut it, Vomit Boy,” Ruby replied affectionately, using his nickname.

“Right back at you Crater Face,” Jaune replied and the two of them laughed. “Well, I actually have something I want to show you…”

It took a while to explain, even with the guide.

"I will don't worry, I think the swap gave me the ability to act like you when I need to, but I think I should go, Weiss will give you a hard time if I stay too long."
