As luck would have it, as he strolled through the school grounds, he happened across such a person. Amongst the crowd of students, Jaune spotted the green hair and tan skin of Emerald Sustrai, or "Em" as Yang called her, a student from Haven Academy who was here for the Vytal Festival. Oddly enough, though Jaune knew he was familiar with her, he realised that he hadn't met her in his original life, and had only done so as the leader of team JYBS, as well as through Yang's life. Regardless, Jaune wasn't as close with her as he was with some of the teams from Beacon, but he decided she was a good enough subject for this test. After quickly glancing around to check whether anyone was looking at him, Jaune pulled at the remote and carefully aimed it through the crowd, and pressed down the button.

As usual, the changes happened almost instantly, and Jaune was quick to notice. While there wasn't a dramatic difference, Yang's unruly blonde hair on the edge of his vision was replaced with much straighter, greener locks, and he'd lost a couple inches in height, alongside a handful of smaller differences that were only really noticeable if he payed attention to them. A quick glance down was enough to see his new skin tone, and confirm that he did in fact have Emerald's body now.

Of course, that wasn't the true test. Looking back over at the crowd, it didn't take him long to spot the mess of blonde hair amongst the other students. Though it was a little difficult to tell from so far away, judging by the height and bust, it seemed as if Emerald had received Coco's body rather than Yang's. Jaune found that to be somewhat intriguing. Though it should have been expected that Emerald would receive Coco's body, as that was the body that was doing the swapping, the rest of the world didn't see him as having Coco's body, they saw him as Yang. Possible theories about how exactly the swap had functioned were already starting to appear in his head, but he'd need to check the second half of his test before he was ready to call it certain.

Heading back over to a nearby window, Jaune was looking for his reflection. In theory, since it was Coco's body that Emerald had received, Yang's body should be unchanged, save for the hair, and his reflection should reflect that. Half groaning, half chuckling at his unintentional pun, Jaune peered into the shiny surface of the glass, only for a suprised expression to appear on his reflection. What he saw was not Yang's body with Emerald's hair, it was just Emerald's body, the body he had now.

Now Jaune was confused. The swap had not only affected his body, but also the perception of Yang's body, as people now saw Yang with Emerald's body. What did that mean for Emerald? She had Coco's body at the moment, but did people see it as Coco's, or as Yang's? She was unfortunately too far away to far away to check her reflection, though she was still in sight, Yang's hair really making her stand out. Perhaps tailing her for the time being would give him the opportunity to check her reflection and see for sure how the world saw her.

There was another option, however; keeping Emerald's body and going off on his merry way. He would hope that a remote this advanced would have safeguards in place to make sure parts, or perceptions thereof, wouldn't be able to be simply erased, and thus, he could figure out how Emerald was perceived when his team met back up at their room, by simply checking Yang's reflection, the reflection of his own life. That did mean he might have to hold back on the swaps a bit for now, though, seeing as he didn't want to mess things up too bad before confirming his hypothesis. Still, he had Yang's life and Emerald's body, there was plenty of fun that could be had with that.

Of course, with this current test having somewhat stumped Jaune on the exact properties of the remote when a life swap was involved, perhaps it would be best to simply swap back for now, and test this again in a more controlled environment, where both his test subject and his original life weren't about to run off. Emerald's body felt nice, but keeping it would just muddle things further if he wanted to make further swaps, and he wasn't sure he wanted to go through the stream of undoing everything if he found that this had affected perception in a way he wasn't happy with. Besides, this swap had stripped Yang of her golden locks, and while she wouldn't know the difference, Jaune found it hard to imagine her without them.
1213112233111.title: Testing the Body Swap

choices: Jaune decided to check in on Weiss and Yang
Jaune head to his room for some alone time
Jaune decides to use the remote some more
12131122331112.content:
After glancing over at Emerald as she slowly walked away, Jaune shook his head. He doubted he'd be able to follow her closely enough to be able to spot her reflection once she walked close enough to a window. She'd spot him eventually, and then he'd be left having to explain exactly what he was doing, and why he was following her. That said, he also didn't really want to swap back just yet. Looking over his reflection, he found he actually rather liked Emerald's body, and being less familiar with her than he was with Coco, he wouldn't feel as bad about anything he might decide to do with her body. It also probably helped that Emerald's hair was much less unwieldy than Yang's, and didn't feel like such a dead weight hanging from his head.

His decision made, Jaune began to wander off in the opposite direction Emerald had headed as he pondered his next move. He knew he'd need to complete his test eventually by checking the reflection of his old life, but his training session with Weiss should still be going for some time now, so that could be handled later. For now, he still had time to kill. The training session could be worth checking out, though. Not as himself, of course, but in Yang's life he could go and watch, passing it off as wanting to see how much his leader had improved. He could even use the remote to make things more interesting he wanted. The remote didn't seem to be able to swap things between other people, only between himself and a target, but if he used himself as an intermediate step, he could swap things between Weiss and Yang as they fought.

Of course, there was something else Jaune had been itching to do since he had first acquired Coco's body, and that desire had only increased after taking Emerald's for a spin. He simply hadn't had a good opportunity, lacking the time alone to fully get a handle on his new form. Now, however, he had the perfect opportunity. Weiss and Yang in his old life were busy training, and Blake was probably still reading outside. He could have the whole room to himself, with no one to interrupt whatever he wanted to do. That said, while he did have a perfect opportunity right now, it wasn't as if this was the only time he'd ever be able to have some alone time, and getting to see himself, or rather Yang in his life, train wasn't exactly an everyday occurrence either.

As he pondered which option to take, however, Jaune seem to stop his hand from drifting back to the pocket that held the remote. He knew he should try to limit his swaps so as not to change the world's perception of Yang too much before he had a chance to see how it had affected himself and Emerald, but there was something about the remote's power that was just incredibly alluring. Surely another swap or two wouldn't hurt, right? After all, the undo button was right there, he could have everything back to normal, or whatever he decided would be the new normal, in a heartbeat. Why not let himself have a bit more fun messing with reality?
12131122331112.title: Jaune leaves Emerald alone for now

choices: Sun
Neptune
121312.content: Who will he choose from team SSSN
121312.title: Team SSSN

choices: Jaune goes to meet with Ruby
Jaune stashes the remote first
Jaune bumps into someone on the way
1213122.content:
The choice was somewhat obvious. As cool as it would be to see what it was like to be a faunus or a girl, Jaune's heart won out in the end. Despite how many times she rejected him, Jaune still pined for Weiss. She never seemed to accept any of his attempts to woo her, but Neptune was a different story. Maybe it was his looks, maybe it was his approach, but for whatever reason, Weiss seemed to like him. Maybe if he took Neptune's body, he'd stand a chance. Of course, it was just as likely that Weiss would treat him the same as always and not notice the change in his body.

Regardless of the outcome, Jaune had made up his mind, and pointed the remote at Neptune, before pressing the body swap button. In an instant, Neptune was replaced with a copy of Jaune, wearing Neptune's clothes. As for Jaune himself, he didn't feel very different. He'd clearly changed, as he seemed to have gotten a little taller, and his skin tone seemed a little darker, but for the most part, he felt pretty much the same. Perhaps a bit more in shape, but otherwise, switching with Neptune hadn't changed much. Obviously his face and hair had changed as well, as he could see a bit of blue hair falling into his line of sight, but that didn't make him feel any different.

"Well, I guess I look different, at least," Jaune muttered to himself, hearing Neptune's voice escape from his mouth. It was odd, but that was about it. Regardless, he was wearing a different face now, which was what he'd wanted before he showed up in front of Ruby, so now it was time for him to go. As he headed over towards the dormitories, Jaune glanced down at the remote, wondering what he should do with it. He still hadn't quite decided whether or not he should tell Ruby about the remote or not, especially now that he'd tried it out a couple of times, and possibilities were forming in his head regarding what he could do with it if he didn't have anyone questioning his decisions. Perhaps it would be a good idea to put it away somewhere safe before meeting with Ruby.
1213122.title: Neptune

choices: A student by themselves
A student with their team
A teacher
12133.content:
Of the remaining functions left to test, Jaune decided that the life swap option interested him the most. He'd already seen physical changes after swapping hair with Blake, and while a body or wardrobe swap was certainly a more extreme change than that, he felt it wouldn't exactly be as surprising. The life swap was a completely different story. While he had seen small mental changes after swapping names with Blake, having the entire world see him as a different person would be an interesting without a doubt. Sure, it would make meeting up with Ruby and telling her about the remote a little difficult, since he'd have to convince her he was really Jaune if he didn't swap back first, but he wanted to try it out regardless.

Now it was a matter of deciding who he should swap with. He didn't really have anyone in mind, he just knew he wanted to try out the life swap, and he had already left Blake behind. Perhaps he should just have a walk around and see who he could find. Perhaps one of them would catch his fancy.

As Jaune mulled about the courtyard, he saw a variety of people, both students and faculty, both known to him and unknown. Thanks to the upcoming Vytal Festival many students from other kingdoms were staying here at Beacon for the time being, allowing him plenty of choices. Many of the students walked together with who he assumed to be their teams. That made things a little awkward for Jaune. If he swapped lives with someone amongst their team, he'd immediately be forced to try and act like whoever he swapped with to avoid suspicion, even if he knew nothing about the person he was swapping with. It made swapping with someone who was by themselves a fairly appealing option, as it would give him some time to get used to who he was first, but swapping with someone in a team would let him immediately see whether or not they saw him as the person he swapped with.

While all of this was related to swapping with students, there were also a few teachers around the courtyard, perhaps heading to another class, or perhaps heading back to their office to do whatever it was teachers did when they weren't teaching. While it would be odd swapping with someone a decent amount older than him, and the teachers at Beacon had more responsibilities to take care of than the students, Jaune was already starting to get a few mischievous thoughts. He could just imagine how good of a prank it would be to go see Ruby while he was in a teacher's life, and act like she was in trouble for something. The look on her face would be priceless.

Either way, Jaune was spoiled for choice when it came to who he could swap with. After scanning the crowds, he decided he'd try swapping with...
12133.title: Life Swap

choices: Sun
Cinder
Other
121331.content:
Considering his options carefully, Jaune first ruled out swapping lives with a teacher. While the authority and how he could use it to prank his friends was a really nice benefit, they were usually pretty busy and he might be forced to teach some class as Professor Port or Goodwitch.

Looking over the student options again, he saw that the only group he really knew was team CRDL. Quickly ruling them out, he was able to recognize a few people moving through the courtyard.

The first one Jaune picked as a potential target was the monkey faunus, Sun Wukong. The guy was pretty cool from their interactions so far and he had that cool monkey tail. Pyrrha always encouraged him to be more confident as team leader. Maybe spending a bit of time in the life of someone who was already confident in themselves could help him grow in that department. Plus, Sun was on an all-male team. As much as he enjoyed spending time with Nora and Pyrrha, it was a bit awkward at times living with two ladies.
https://vignette.wikia.nocookie.net/rwby...

Another candidate he saw was the leader of Emerald and Mercury’s team, Cinder, was her name if he recalled correctly. Jaune knew much less about her than he did with Sun for sure but from what others, mainly Ruby, told him, Cinder kept to herself usually. It might be easier for him to impersonate her while swapped since she interacted with people much less. And, like Sun, she was also the leader of her team. He could pick up a few things from living her life to help his team out in the long run.
https://images.app.goo.gl/TwUbT4Y7Nmt2Cz...

Regardless of which one he picked though, Jaune could also do a bit of scouting and learn a lot about his target and their teammates to prepare for them in the Vytal Festival.

Making a decision, he selected....
121331.title: Discovering Another's Self

choices: Swapping clothes
Swapping bodies
Deal with the pain
1213312.content:
Making up his mind, Jaune pointed the device at Cinder and hit the button. In an instant, he found himself partway across the courtyard mid-stride and almost fell over. Managing to maintain his balance, Jaune began to examine the differences caused by the swap.

For starters, he was mildly shocked by the long, wavy, black hair obscuring part of his face and tickling the back of his neck. While he wasn’t completely unfamiliar with hair like this, having swapped with Blake earlier, this time though, he wasn’t expecting it. Was this a part of the life swap? Looking down, apart from the hair, the rest of his body was still his normal male self. Though, now it was dressed in the same attire that Cinder was just wearing earlier. He had on her sleeveless brown jacket and gloves, the bandage wrapped tightly around his chest and tight gray pants. Everything was adjusted for his larger body compared to it’s original owner.

Speaking of Cinder, Jaune turned his attention to the spot that he was at earlier and saw a rather unusual sight. Cinder was now dressed in the armor, hoodie and jeans combination that he typically wore as well as his short, blond hairstyle. While she still had that same mysterious charm to her, the hair and clothes definitely dampened that a fair bit.

While doing his observation of her, he began to notice a sharp pain building from his groin. Realizing that it was because he was very much a male but his clothes, while resized to fit his larger frame, was still meant to be worn by a female and so the crotch did not have the room that he was used to.

Resisting the urge to tug at his pants in public, he recognized that he had two easy solutions.

Glancing back at Cinder, the simplest answer was that he could swap clothes with her to give him back his usual stuff while still in her life. It would provide the most comfort for him. However, that would mean he was basically just himself but responding to the name Cinder. It sort of defeated the purpose of his swapping lives in the first place.

The other way to deal with the growing pain was to swap bodies with Cinder. It would provide the full experience of being her for sure plus the clothes would fit since it would be back on the body of it’s intended wearer. But was he really going through with having a girl’s body? Jaune was taught to respect a girl and their privacy while growing up with all his sisters and swapping bodies would be a definite violation of that privacy.

Of course, he could just keep everything as is and learn to deal with the discomfort. It’s been said that enduring pain would help increase tolerance for pain and anything that could improve his combat performance was a good thing.

Eventually, he settled on....
1213312.title: Cinder

choices: Head back to the dorms
Let her life guide him
Do something else
12133122.content:
Deciding to go for the full experience, he aimed the remote one more time in the direction of Cinder in his life, pressing a different button. Just like before, there was a change in perspective though not as drastic as before. His eye-line had dropped a bit thanks to his reduced height.

What he saw before him was what appeared to be himself from head to toe except for the long hair which was the only thing that remained of Cinder.

“Better fix that.” Jaune muttered in his new voice.

Quickly aiming the remote and using the body part swap to fix that, he once again had that same black hair partially over the side of his face. He was now for all intents and purposes, Cinder Fall, and she was now completely Jaune Arc.

Looking at himself again, he was now greeted by a sight that he never thought that he would see from this perspective. On his chest, were a pair of breasts. Subconsciously, reaching up slowly, he cupped them tentatively. It had some weight to them and looked rather large in his now smaller hands. Turning his attention lower, he felt, or to be more precise, no longer felt, the sensation of having something between his legs. Dropping one of his hands down in front, he lightly patted the front of his pants as if to confirm what he already knew. It was very different to say the least.

Suddenly remembering where he was, he quickly pulled his hands away. Putting off the close inspection for later, Jaune had to figure out what to do now.

He could figure out where Cinder and her teammates were staying in the dormitories. He somehow knew that her teammates were out in Vale. That easily gave him a private place where he can explore his new situation better.

As he was about to head to where the dorms were, for some strange reason, he had the sudden urge to go to the arenas. He didn’t really see a reason to go there himself so he guessed that it was Cinder’s life instructing him to do so though he didn’t have the slightest clue why she wanted to go there.
12133122.title: Swapping bodies

choices: He was just outside Cinder’s dorm
Someone was calling out for him
Something else
121331221.content:
Brushing off the desire to go to the arenas since he had no clue what he was going to do when he got there, Jaune stuck to his original plan of going to what would be his dorms while staying in Cinder’s life.

Taking a few careful steps to not sprain an ankle in his new high-heeled boots, he turned and headed in the direction of where visiting students from Haven Academy were staying.

Along the way, Jaune had noticed people stare at him or turn their heads as he passed by. As soon as he looked their way though, they quickly looked away. He started to get really self-conscious from all the looks he was drawing. Even though he knew that everyone saw him as Cinder and that was normal, he felt like people were seeing right through his appearance and saw him for the impersonator that he was. This made him notice all the differences between Cinder and himself even more.

For starters, his current body had a natural way of walking that was quite different from when he was his male self. Clicking down the hall in his heeled boots, with every step he took, his feet placed themselves one in front of the other. This caused his now wider hips to sway and the insides of his legs to rub together each time. It also served as a constant reminder to Jaune of what was now no longer between his legs.

Aside from that, having long hair was an unusual thing for Jaune. He had tried having long hair earlier when he first used the device on Blake but swapped it back a few moments later so this was a relatively new experience for him. The slight extra weight on his head, the feel of it brushing against his neck and left shoulder where it currently hung and ended right at chest level.

Speaking of his chest, even though it was tightly bound, there was a slight bounce to them. It was barely noticeable just by looking at it but feeling them move was a different story. They were almost like having two fleshy balloons strapped to his chest. It wasn’t an unpleasant feeling by any means. Just strange.

Even the little things like how tight and more revealing his current attire was, the way the wind felt across his smoother bare skin just served or how taut and limber he now felt. There was even a warmth that radiated from his body which he never felt before.

All of these differences just served to emphasize to Jaune that he was very much not himself at the moment and that this was a conscious decision that he made. It was just a little bit overwhelming and distracted him as he was walking through the halls of Beacon.

Matter of fact, he was so distracted that he didn’t notice that....
121331221.title: Head back to the dorms

choices: Check the closet
Check the bathroom (and maybe more)
Other
1213312211.content:
Without even realizing it, he had already stopped walking. Jaune was now in a hallway lined with doors, just like the one leading to his team’s actual dorms. Unlike that hallway though, he somehow knew that the dorms in this area were where students from Haven stayed for the festival. One door in particular, the one he was standing in front of, Jaune instinctively knew as belonging to Cinder and her team.

‘This is it, Jaune. You can do this.’ he thought, giving himself a pep talk. ‘Your team deserves better and you need to be better. Doing this will make you better. Once you step through that door, you’ll have to live as Cinder. No freaking out and going back just because you’re uncomfortable with what’s happening.’

Luckily, no one else was in the halls at that time so his standing around awkwardly wouldn’t be questioned by anyone. Taking a deep breath, he pulled her scroll out of his pants, he used it to open and enter the room. Once inside and after shutting the door, he was slightly disappointed by what he saw. He wasn’t quite sure what to expect to find but it definitely wasn’t this. He was hoping for something that would tell him a bit about the people he’d be staying with or about Cinder herself. Unlike the posters in team JNPR’s or the death trap called bunk beds of team RWBY’s rooms, there wasn’t really much of a personal touch here. Placing the Scroll and the remote, which he’d been holding the entire time, into the same pocket, he moved into the center of the room.

On an initial look around the room, it just had the standard four beds with identical sheets, some bookshelves, a desk for studies, two doors leading to a bathroom and closet. The only real unique item he could see was a single painting hanging over one of the beds. Stepping closer to get a better look, he could see that it was a depiction of a forest done in a few different shades of red and black. It gave him an uneasy feeling. Almost like there were Grimm hiding behind the trees, ready to pounce on him. Turning his head away from it, he sat down on a bed.

‘What do I do now?’ he mused. ‘Really wish there was more to look through in here.’

Looking around, that was when his eyes wandered over to one of the two doors at opposite ends of the room. The closet.

‘Maybe her team’s stuff is in there. Worst case scenario, I find a bunch of their clothes and that tells me where they like to hang out.’

And at that point, his gaze landed on the other door. The bathroom.

‘That’s another place I could check.’ Eyes glancing down at his chest briefly, he blushed hard. ‘If I’m gonna be her for a while, I’ll see it eventually so may as well get it over with now and see what she looks like.’ The same heat that radiated throughout his body now spread to his cheeks and between his thighs.
1213312211.title: He was just outside Cinder’s dorm

choices: Someone knocked on the front door.
His scroll started beeping.
Something else
12133122112.content:
Due to having seven sisters, Jaune was always taught to respect women but he was a teenage boy, present appearance notwithstanding, and sometimes he couldn’t help but let his mind wander. Considering how beautiful the different ladies he called friends were, someone else might think he had the strongest of wills to not step over the line with any of them. Looking down once more at his taped chest, he let his male hormones lead the way, figuratively speaking. He tried to stand up to go to the bathroom but lost his balance and fell back on the bed, feeling the extra padding of his rear cushion him.

‘Ugh, heels!’ He said, taking the shoes off, giving him instant relief. ‘She must have been wearing them all day.’

Rubbing a foot to ease some of the pain, he noticed that both of his new smaller feet had their nails painted a deep red. Taking off his gloves, he saw that his fingernails had a light brown finish to them instead.

‘Strange. Don’t girls usually match the colors?’

Putting the thought aside for a moment, he stood up once again, this time successful and stepped into the bathroom. Turning up the light, he saw that the bathroom was entirely identical to the one in his usual room. A single shower with a sliding door, a lone toilet, a sink with a mirror hung above it and four small separated cabinets underneath the sink. The only different thing there from his room were the different towels folded up on a rack.

Looking into the mirror, for a split second he expected to see his usual male self until it confirmed the fact that he was definitely Cinder right now. Despite everything he had felt up to that point, something about seeing her reflection really hammered it home to Jaune that he was now someone else. Now that he’d finally seen himself properly though, Jaune couldn’t help but think that something was off about the face in the mirror. He wasn’t quite able to place what it was exactly but it felt like that just wasn’t quite right. However, after a few moments of twisting and squirming around, he still couldn’t figure out what was wrong so he decided to put it off for a later time.

Changing trains of thought, he started turning around slowly to get a good look at himself, he took in the different details that he missed earlier. The way his long hair came over one of his eyes, giving him a mysterious, almost forbidden, allure. How the wrappings went around his chest and waist then disappeared behind the hem of his clothes, as if inviting you to discover what was hidden underneath.

Shifting his gaze down to his body, he began working on said clothes. First, taking off the pauldron on his shoulder and unbuckling the belt and pouches around his waist. Once they were off, he placed them on top of the sink. shrugging the vest off his shoulders, he then slid one arm out followed by the other. Dropping it to the floor, he shifted his hands downwards and unbuttoned his pants. Keeping his eyes on the reflection in the mirror the entire time, he placed a hand each side and slowly slipped it off his hips and shapely legs then stepped out of them.

Jaune couldn’t help but suck in a breath at what he was doing. He’d never even gone on a proper date before going to Beacon and here he was about to see a woman’s body in all her glory.

As this was happening...
12133122112.title: Check the bathroom

choices: Stick with Cinder’s weapons
Use the remote to mix and match
Something else
121331222.content:
Jaune figured that if he was going to be Cinder for the time being, he needed to continue what she had planned before the swap. Besides, the practice arenas were pretty close by and if he couldn’t figure out what exactly he was supposed to do, he could always try out using her weapons.

Before anything else, he placed the remote in the same pocket that he found Cinder’s scroll in. Taking a large step in the same direction that she was originally heading, Jaune stumbled and tripped, falling to the ground in a rather undignified manner, landing on his more cushioned rear.

“Gahhh!” He yelped in his borrowed voice. Embarrassed about his fumble, a blush crept up his cheeks. Feeling a few stares on him, Jaune looked about and noticed a few people eyeing him after what just happened. Why were they just staring at him? Why’d there have to be so many of them? Why won’t they just leave already?

With a heat building up in him, “What are you all looking at?!” he burst out.

Without any answers, the crowd dispersed, leaving him alone on the ground. Looking towards his feet to see what he may have tripped on, it was then Jaune realized that his new footwear had some particularly high heels on them.

Carefully standing up, he brushed back some strands of hair that had fallen in front of his face with a gloved hand. Checking over himself for any dirt or mess and finding everything to be good, he then took smaller, more even steps as he continued to the arenas.

Along the way, he noticed that as long as he didn’t think about it too hard, this body knew how to walk in heels pretty effortlessly. It was almost like the skills were ingrained into the body. This gave him the opportunity to reflect back on what happened earlier. Not him falling down and embarrassing himself. That was pretty typical for Jaune. Rather, how he reacted after that caught his attention.

‘Where did that come from?’ He mused. ‘Was that Cinder’s life acting up? She must really hate looking bad. I would have been terrified if I was still me and saw what happened. I guess it makes sense. I mean her team did come over from Haven for the Vytal Tournament so they’re pretty strong for sure and she’s their captain so she’s probably the strongest one of them all. Still though, probably should have handled that better. I need to be more careful while I’m her. Wouldn’t want to harm her reputation because of me being clumsy and messing up so much.’

With these thoughts going through his mind, Jaune manages to get to the locker rooms leading up to the practice arenas without further incident. Pulling Cinder’s Scroll out from a pocket, he used it to access her locker to make it easier to find. Hearing a door crack open from one of the back rows, he moved towards it and spotted the now open door. Inside, he saw a beautiful identical pair of jet black curved swords. They both had sharp edges along the end of the inner curve and near the guard.

At this point, Jaune had a few options available to him. The obvious one presented to him was to try out Cinder’s weapons. They looked really simple but maybe if he could figure out what her semblance was, it could open a ton of possibilities for him.

Speaking of possibility, he still had the remote with him. That was literally a doorway to unlimited options. Why limit himself to just trying out Cinder’s things when he could mix it up. He could combine different weapons and semblances to see how well they worked together. He could even borrow some of the best ones for the actual tournament when it starts.
121331222.title: Let her life guide him

choices: Professor Port
Professor Oobleck
Professor Goodwitch
121333.content:
While swapping with another student would certainly have allowed Jaune to test the life swap function of the remote, the idea of freaking out Ruby by pretending she was in trouble for something was too good to pass up. He had to try it out. With that in mind, he turned his attention away from the other students, and instead focused on the few teachers amongst the crowd. There were a few he didn't recognise, as they came from the other academies with their students, and if he didn't recognise them, then Ruby probably wouldn't either, making his prank pointless.

That unfortunately didn't leave him with many options. On the far side of the courtyard, he saw Professor Port, their teacher in Grimm Studies. Port was certainly amongst the less serious of their teachers, what with him frequently filling entire lessons with exaggerated tales of Grimm hunts he'd been on in the past. He and Ruby seemed to have been on somewhat good terms, what with Ruby's avid interest in weapons and combat. Perhaps she wouldn't exactly take a scolding from Professor Port seriously, or perhaps it would catch her off guard more than any of the other teachers would.
https://vignette.wikia.nocookie.net/rwby...

Port seemed to have been having a conversation with Professor, or rather "Doctor" Bartholomew Oobleck, though the two were currently parting ways. Oobleck was their teacher for History, a subject Jaune tended to struggle in. Likewise, Ruby wasn't particularly good at studying, resulting in her grades dropping a bit. As such, he might have some actual material to get her in trouble for. Swapping with Doctor Oobleck may even help him discover how he managed to move around so fast. It couldn't just be coffee, could it?
https://vignette.wikia.nocookie.net/rwby...

Apart from the other two teachers was Professor Glynda Goodwitch, their Combat Instructor. Goodwitch was by far their strictest instructor, and was probably the teacher Ruby would be most intimidated by if confronted with. There were only two real problems. One was that, unlike him, Ruby was actually rather skilled with her scythe, and hadn't really had any issues with Goodwitch in the past that he knew of, meaning he'd have to make something up if he wanted to pretend she was in trouble. The other issue was that Goodwitch was a woman. While he'd already swapped with Blake, it was a much smaller swap, and everyone still saw him as a man. Swapping with Goodwitch would mean everyone would see him as a woman and treat him accordingly. It was a daunting prospect, but an exciting one nevertheless.
https://vignette.wikia.nocookie.net/rwby...

Having already mentally committed to this prank, Jeane observed the three Beacon teachers that walked through the courtyard, doing his best to decide on who he should swap with before they left.
121333.title: The Student Becomes The Teacher

choices: Jaune heads up to Ruby's room
Goodwitch had duties that Jaune needs to fill
Jaune makes another swap on the way
1213333.content:
Throwing caution to the wind, Jaune decided to swap with Prof. Goodwitch. She was certainly the most interesting of his options, and would probably elicit the best reaction from Ruby, provided he could come up with something to pretend she was in trouble for. Besides, it wasn't like this was permanent, the remote did have an undo button, after all.

Aiming the remote at Goodwitch, Jaune pressed the life swap button, and after a brief green flash, he suddenly found himself standing over the other side of the courtyard. He still felt the same, but his clothes definitely felt different. Unfortunately, there were still a great many people milling about the courtyard, and he'd no doubt draw attention if his simply stopped and examined himself. So instead, he continued to head towards the main build, as Prof. Goodwitch had been doing before there swap, somehow managing to not trip in the high heeled boots that had appeared on his feet. A side effect of the life swap, he supposed.

Glancing down at himself as he walked, Jaune couldn't help but feel he looked a bit ridiculous right now. He was wearing a white blouse with a fairly large opening at the front that would certain have exposed some cleavage had he any to expose, a black skirt that only seemed to come down to around the middle of his thighs, a pair of brown stockings, a pair of black high heels boots that came all the way up to just below his knees, and a black and purple cape that almost seemed shredded into ribbons towards its end. A refined lady would have pulled off the outfit well, as Prof. Goodwitch certainly did, but on Jaune's male body, it just looked silly, even with everything adjusted to fit him.

Speaking of adjustments, Jaune was more concerned with the physical alterations made to his body to fit Prof. Goodwitch's life. Normally, his ears were not pierced, but Prof. Goodwitch wore earrings, and right now, he could feel them dangling beside his head, clearly piercing through his earlobes. His vision was perfectly fine, but Prof. Goodwitch wore glasses, and looking over the frames that now rested on his nose, he could tell his vision without them was a bit blurrier than it used to be. The strangest change, however, was probably his hair. For some reason, though he had kept his own body otherwise, he had gained Prof. Goodwitch's hair, turning it a brighter blonde, and being tied up in a tight bun at the back of his head. Jaune couldn't quite fathom why that had happened. Perhaps hairstyle was counted as clothing, or he needed to Goodwitch's longer hair to have the same bun she did. Perhaps it was just part of the life swap, showing whose life you were really in regardless of what clothes you were wearing. Neither option really made sense to Jaune, but he supposed he didn't really understand how the remote worked in the first place, anyway.

As he walked away, just about to enter the main building, he briefly glanced back at the courtyard, hoping get a look at Goodwitch in his life. Unfortunately, all he got was a brief glance at an adult woman with short, messy hair wearing a male school uniform. He didn't get to see any more before she walked off, vanishing from sight. Jaune supposed he'd have to hunt her down if he wanted to swap more with her, outside of reversing the life swap. That didn't really matter right now, though. He had the life he was looking for, now he just needed to think of what he could say that would send Ruby into a panic. With that on his mind Jaune entered the main building of Beacon Academy, remote still tightly gripped in his hand, having thankfully traveled with him during his jump across the courtyard.
1213333.title: Jaune Goodwitch

choices: Jaune heads to class as Goodwitch
Jaune goes to see Ruby as Goodwitch
Jaune uses the remote again
12133332.content:
As Jaune walked through the halls of Beacon Academy, he couldn't help but feel like there was something he was forgetting, something important. The closer he got to the school's dormitories, and thus the further from the classrooms he got, the stronger the feeling got, and the clearer it became. It wasn't him that was forgetting something, it was Goodwitch.

Though Jaune was still himself, it seemed he was not entirely free of any mental changes. He hadn't noticed it before, but it seemed he was able to pick up on Prof. Goodwitch's personality and memories, presumably to aid him in living her life. Right now, it seemed as if Goodwitch's instincts were screaming at him, telling him he had a class to attend to, and this detour towards the dormitories was going to make him late if he didn't hurry.

Jaune should have expected something like this. He didn't know why he didn't. He may have been done with classes for the day, but his class wasn't the only one in Beacon, and of course, classes needed someone to teach them. By swapping with Goodwitch, he'd just busied his schedule with a bunch of combat classes, only with him being the one instructing the fights instead of receiving a beating. That wasn't part of his plan.

The way Jaune saw it, he had a few options available to him. Though Goodwitch's instincts were urging him to hurry up and get to the next class, he didn't actually have to obey them. He could always just ignore them and go through with his plan anyway. He would feel a bit guilty though, seeing as that would likely get Goodwitch in trouble, through no fault of her own. The other option was to find someone else's life to try this with. The remote had an undo button, so he could immediately jump back into his own life if he wanted to, and then he could find a new candidate. However, he didn't actually know what Goodwitch was doing in his life, seeing as she'd walked off by herself. It could be a bit disorientating to suddenly wind up somewhere unknown doing something he didn't know about, but Jaune had a good feeling Goodwitch wouldn't be doing anything too dangerous while she was him. He didn't have to use the undo function, though. There weren't as many people here as in the courtyard, but there were still enough that Jaune could probably find someone else to swap with. That would leave things a little muddled, leaving them in Goodwitch's life while Goodwitch was in his, but it was easily fixed, and he was the only one who'd notice anything different in the meantime.

Of course, just because he wanted to surprise Ruby by showing up in someone else's life, that didn't mean he had to do it right this moment. It could be interesting seeing how a combat class played out from the perspective of the teacher, especially if he could rely on Goodwitch's life to do the teaching for him. He could just teach the rest of her classes, and then he could go see Ruby once Goodwitch had some free time. Whatever he decided on, though, he should probably decide quickly. The clock was ticking, and the longer he waited, the higher the chance of Goodwitch being late to her own class.
12133332.title: Goodwitch had duties that Jaune needs to fill

choices: Jaune finds a good target
Jaune presses Reset
Someone bumps into Jaune while he's deciding
121333323.content:
Jaune shook his head. He couldn't stay in Goodwitch's life right now. He wanted to surprise Ruby by showing up in someone else's life, and thanks to Blake, he knew where Ruby should be right now. If he wanted to go through with this, he should probably do it now. By the time Goodwitch was done teaching classes, he'd have no idea where Ruby would be anymore. He could go see Ruby regardless of the classes he had to teach, but as much as he didn't have a problem with borrowing Goodwitch's life for a while, he didn't want to get her in trouble. Missing or being late to a single class probably wouldn't be enough to lose her her job, but it would probably still attract the attention of Professor Ozpin, and she'd be forced to come up with an excuse for his actions. Jaune didn't want to be responsible for that.

Pulling the remote out again, Jaune looked around at the people around him, his thumb hovering over the remote's buttons. He had two options now; to undo his swap, or to swap again. There was a good handful of people milling around the halls, though none that would likely get as good of a reaction out of Ruby as he would if he showed up as Goodwitch. In fact, there was not a single teacher to be seen, likely because they were already at their classes, and not dawdling around like he was. Regardless, he could probably still find a good target if he looked hard enough, and he could just leave them to handle Goodwitch's life until he decided to reset everything, if he ever did. Of course, if he couldn't find anyone that piqued his interest, the undo button was still there. he'd just jump back into his own life, and then he could start anew. He'd just need to hope that Goodwitch wasn't in the middle of something dangerous or embarrassing in his life. There was also the chance that if his life was currently with someone, they'd notice the remote suddenly appearing in his hand, he'd have to be careful about that.

The other functions of the remote were somewhat tempting now that he had the remote out. Aside from the life swap that he was currently using, he'd only done a few small tests with the Body Part and Personal Info options. There was still a world of fun he could have with this, but right now, he needed to resist that temptation. He needed to get out of Goodwitch's life so she could get to her class. Doing his best to ignore the other options on the remote, Jaune looked around at the people walking around him, hoping a good candidate would show themselves.
121333323.title: A Good Witch No More

choices: Return to the dorms with the rest of Team JNPR.
Look for Ruby, your best friend.
Search Weiss, maybe you can chsrm her this time.
122.content:
Jaune looked at the remote, unsure.

To be completely honest, the idea of a reality altering device sounded too farfetched. It was most likely a joke from someone (possibly Cardin) and they were waiting for him to try using the remote and laugh at him by believe for even a second that it was real.

The most logical part of his brain wanted to throw away the object, before his reputation plummeted more.

Another part of him though wondered 'What if it is true?'

There was a non-zero chance the remote truly worked. Yeah, the possibility was still close to none, but there was no harm in trying it, was it? The worst it could happen was be a laughing stock for the rest of the day. Nothing new there.

Looking at Blake, whose attention was only in her book, Jaune considered what to swap.

It could be something minor as a clothing swap, but Jaune felt it would be a lackluster waste of potential, no he decided that the swap should be bigger.

After several seconds of deliberation, Jaune finally settled his finger in the body swap button. It was the choice less likely to backfire to him if he messed up somehow.

Aiming at the unsuspected Blake, Jaune pressed the button.

There wasn't any obvious sign of something had happened. No flash of light or mysterious beam. Everything remained the same, no one looked at the nonexistent commotion and even Blake remained in her place reading her book, unconcerned. It was just, that 'Blake' was now a blonde scrawny teenager dressed in a girl's uniform. Once again, no one batted an eye.

Jaune was the exception, his gaze was transfixed in what was his body, or used to. Looking at the hand holding the remote, he was greeted by the sight of a dainty and feminine hand. Nails done cutely and painted black. Then the the hair blocked his vision.

Making the hair go out of his way it finally hit Jaune the realization that the remote was real. Oh, and he now possessed a girl body.

Several strange sensations made themselves known. The wind hitting his long black hair. A new pair of auditory organs. The unfamiliar weight of breasts unsupported. The lack of bulge in his pants and the loose his briefs felt. And lastly, the difference in size. Jaune was smaller, but he felt powerful, fast, agile, ready to pounce over his enemy.

Everything was so new and weird, but Jaune couldn't say he hated it.

Turning his now yellow and feline eyes, toward his body under the tree, Jaune felt trepidation as he started making way in Blake direction.

It didn't took more than a few seconds to reach her position and draw Blake's attention. She looked from her book toward him, showing no signal of noticing anything wrong with seeing herself from the outside.

'So it seems no one else, even those affected by it notice the changes to reality.' Thought Jaune, greatly relieved to know the remote worked as intended and he wouldn't have to worry about other getting mad at him for any swap. Still, Blake was looking at him with her blue, so familiar eyes, waiting for him to say something.

"Err, Heeeey Bla~ke, do yo-you know where Ruby is." Stuttering at first due the unfamiliarity of his new voice, Jaune amended himself quick.

"Yeah, she said she was going to spend all the day in the workshop tinkering with her weapon." The act of listening his own voice from a different perspective was pretty surreal.

"Thanks, Blake you were of great help."

"You are welcome, Jaune."

Retreating after completing his objective, Jaune considered his options.

One one hand he could go meet with his team and swap with them.

He could look for Ruby and talk with her about the remote, he just needed to tell someone of such an awesomeity.

Lastly he could search for Schnee Angel and use the remote to arrange a date with her.

Ultimately, the remote has unlimited potential.
122.title: Body Swap with Blake

choices: Ruby had an idea she wants to try.
Jaune suggests an idea.
They try to come up with something they can do together with it.
1222.content:
This much power had to be shared.

Plus, Jaune wasn’t sure if he could trust himself with that much power.

He raced across Beacon toward the dorms. Blake’s body was smaller than his, but much more lithe and athletic. It was quite astonishing how fast he felt he was going. The extra set of cat ears on his head were picking up conversation and noises he would never have heard normally. The only people who glanced at him did so because he was running. The cat ears on his head went unnoticed. The lack of a bra and his lose pants were a little uncomfortable, but time was of the essence.

He needed to find his best friend, Ruby.

Stopping at Team RWBY’s dorm, Jaune knocked quickly.

“I swear, Arc. If this is another lame flirt attempt, I will end you.” Weiss did not look amused at him being there. However, she instantly recognized him as Jaune, even with Blake’s body.

“Not today, Weiss.” He assured her. “I need to talk to Ruby… but if you were interested-…”

“No.” Weiss turned around. “Ruby. Get that dunderhead to go away.”

“Hey, Jaune.” Ruby said, showing up at the door. “What’s up?”

“I need to show you something, privately. Now!” Jaune grabbed her hand and pulled her after him into his room across the hall.

“Wait up!” Ruby cried, not used to being the one being pulled. She was used to pulling others.

“So,” Jaune asked Ruby. He was glad the rest of his team were out. “Notice anything different?”

“What?” Ruby looked completely confused. “That doesn’t make any sense. Why did we have to rush to your room?”

“Come on, Ruby.” Jaune pressed. “You don’t notice anything different? At all?” He gestured to his head and body.

“Did you, like get a haircut?” She asked and he face palmed.

“I suppose I can’t really blame you,” Jaune admitted. “The instructions did say people wouldn’t notice.”

“Notice what?” Ruby actually looked interested now. “What are you hiding? Tell me!”

“Hold this.” Jaune told her and she looked at the device in his hand.

“Is that a remote?”

“Trust me. Hold it with me. I’ll exlain everything in a minute.”

“Oookay?” She did so and Jaune hit the Undo Button.

Ruby’s jaw fell open.

“You… you… you were Blake!” She cried out when finally finding the words.

“Actually, I just had her body.” Jaune corrected her. “There’s a Life Swap option for that.”

“Where... but… how!” Words were failing Ruby again.

It took Jaune a bit to explain. He told her how he came across it, what the instructions said, and he only tested it on Blake because she was nearby. He also didn’t expect it to work. Ruby asked dozens of questions, most of which he couldn’t answer. He had only been part of one swap. There had been no time to do anything else, let alone explore Blake’s body.

“So, why show it to me?” Ruby asked.

“I… kind of wanted to show it to someone,” Jaune admitted. “This remote was too awesome to keep to myself and since you are my best friend, I figured we could have some fun.”

Ruby looked at him for a moment, before a huge smile appeared on her face.

“Of course! This is going to be great!”
1222.title: Look for Ruby, your best friend.

choices: Curiosity won, check the commotion.
Desire is strong, find Weiss.
Caution is advised, return to his team.
1223.content:
Jaune looked once more at the remote in his (Blake) hand.

His many attempts at wooing Weiss had been less than helpful, she didn't seemed to be interested on him. If only she were to give him an opportunity he knew he could show her how serious he truly was.

But, now he could do something about it didn't he? He could swap lives with Weiss, thus reversing their roles. Then ask Weiss in his life to a date. He could think later about the next steps. He just needed to have confidence on himself as his dad often used to say.

With a clear goal in mind, Jaune started walking, intent on finding Weiss. A few steps later he stopped, his clothes a bit uncomfortable in his current frame.

'I still have Blake body.' Jaune realized. To be honest, he had forgotten, he didn't felt that different after swapping. Looking at the remote, he quickly found the Reset button. In an instant he was himself again.

All the while, Blake remained unperturbed, still reading her book (likely smut).

Jaune ran to the dorms. He didn't had a clue of Weiss current whereabouts, but he had to start somewhere. RWBY room seemed like the safest bet.

A few minutes later, he was almost there when he heard several whispers from the hallway to the left. Something was happening and he couldn't help but feel curious.

Although he wanted to met Weiss immediately, there was no guarantee she was in her room. He could always met her the next day. On the other hand, whatever was happening in the hallway wasn't likely to last long.

Or maybe he could practice with the remote a bit more before enacting his plan. He knew very little about how life swap worked after all. He could try it on his team first. For safety.

Jaune stood there a few seconds, mulling over his options.

In the end...
1223.title: Look for Weiss

choices: Return to his room, his team may be there
Look around camous for other opportunities to use the remote
Reaser choice
12231.content:
It would be a lie to say Jaune wasn't interested on what was happening nearby. He was a teenager prone to mischief and meddling on others business. The fact that he applied to Beacon with false transcripts should say it all.

'I can always swap with Weiss tomorrow. She isn't going anywhere so I can wait.' Thought Jaune trying to justify his actions. His mental gymnastics finally over, he turned left, straight to the commotion.

A few seconds later, Jaune reached the small crowd and saw for himself what had garnered so much attention.

"Leave me alone, please!" Cried a young girl with bunny ears.

"I don't think so, animals shouldn't roam these hall without their owners, you must be punished." Mocked a burly built boy, pulling said girl ears.

Apparently Cardin was bullying Velvet again, just like that time on the cafeteria. The rest of Cardin team were close standing in a way to impede others from interfering. Not that anyone tried of course, a bystander atmosphere had enveloped the zone and everyone just stood there watching.

Jaune by his part felt angry. After the altercation in Forever Falls, Cardin stopped trying to blackmail him. In fact other than in combat class they stopped interacting. It seemed that Cardin went for another target, the bully!

Cardin needed to learn a lesson. But not through violence. Jaune had gotten better than when he started but still was not match for Cardin. He could last longer on their spars, but he had yet to win a single time. Backed with the rest of his team Jaune was outmatched. Or he would, if he hadn't a reality altering device on his hands.

Smirking a bit, Jaune took a few seconds to think what to swapp. Then it hit him like an epiphany. Maybe Cardin should experience being a faunus. It would serve as payback for all the things he forced Jaune to do back then.

Finding the Personal Information option and selecting species Jaune aimed at Velvet. The next instant Velvet stood there, now an ordinary human girl, while Jaune was a rabbit faunus. But reality hadn't time to reassert itself before Jaune aimed at Cardin this time and pushed the same button. Jaune returned back to normal and beheld a bizarre sight.

Cardin with two rabbit ears. Jaune had to hold his laughter, not wanting to attract attention to himself, least that of Cardin. It wouldn't end good for him after all.

Jaune was of course unaware of all changes his swap truly caused.

Velvet was now the adopted human child of the Scarlatina clan of rabbit faunus. Not much going on there.

Cardin however received the most significant changes of all. The Winchesters were die hard human supremacist. Having lost many members during the faunus wars created a grudge that has yet to vanish.

Things got complicated when Sandra Winchester gave birth to a faunus child. It would have been an scandal if they hadn't hid the information and kept the boy a secret. They wanted to kill the child, but Sandra felt a bit remorseful and they just kept him isolated in a safehouse from the world.

Growing up was hard for the rabbit faunus. The Winchester didn't even grant him a name. The constant abuse by the servants in charge of him and his curiosity about the outside led him to his escape, a search for freedom. But the outside wasn't as nice as he thought. Faunus discrimination wasn't as widespread in Vale as it was in Atlas, yet the kid experienced the harsh truth of the world.

He would have died outside in the cold streets, in the winter when he was not even ten years old yet. But he was saved by a passing faunus who took him to the local branch of the White Fang, where he was inducted on his early years.

Cardin proved himself to be above the average recruit and quickly climbed the social leaders till his current position as lieutenant. His latest mission is to transmit intel on Beacon to the Fang for future operations under the alias of Cardin Belmont.

There are more things going on there, but they are unrelated to Jaune.

Once the daze of reality rewriting itself finished, Cardin turned around and walked out of the zone. The rest of his team followed behind, but now looked cowed, somehow resigned.

The small crowd dispersed too, and Velvet passed next to Jaune who still was rooted on the spot. He heard her murmur something but couldn't grasp it.

The situation now diffused what should Jaune do next.
12231.title: Curiosity won, check the commotion.

choices: Mountain Village
Farming Town
Costal City
125.content:
Jaune raised the remote, still debating which button to press, when his Scroll suddenly went off.

Shit!

He almost dropped the remote. Fumbling with it quickly, he shoved it into his pocket and pulled out his Scroll. Blake didn’t even glance up as he answered.

“Ah, Mr. Arc.” A middle-aged man with tousled silver hair and thin brown eyes stared at him through black spectacles. It was Ozpin, headmaster of Beacon.

“Hello, sir,” Jaune replied respectfully.

“I wish to speak to you in my office,” Ozpin said. “Please make your way here immediately. It is about a possible mission opportunity for your team.”

“Er... I’ll be there right away.” Ozpin nodded and disconnected. Jaune turned away from Blake, figuring another opportunity to test out the remote would appear as he made his way to Ozpin’s office. It didn’t take him very long and, after knocking, was let in. “You wanted to talk to me about a mission?”

“Yes, have a seat.” Ozpin sipped the coffee from his mug. “While you are a first year team, Team JNPR has shown to be resilient and reliable. A couple Grimm near a small town need to be exterminated before the day to day activities are interrupted. Normally, the militia would be able to handle this, but I volunteered your team to help out. Think of this as not only an opportunity to gain real world experience, but to make up for the damage your enthusiastic team member caused to our statute.”

Jaune flinched as he remembered Nora and Yang drawing pictures on it last week.

“I’m sure it would help get Glynda off your back,” Ozpin added. “You are free to not accept-…”

“No, we will.” Jaune interjected. He could only imagine what Nora would say if he declined the chance for them to go on an adventure. Ren would go along with her and Pyrrha would go with whatever Jaune decided. Besides, having Glynda Goodwitch, deputy headmistress, think better of them was a huge boon. “Is there anything else we should know?”

“The mission will last 3 days,” Ozpin told him and passed over a folder. “All the information about the city and surrounding area is there. You need to take care of the Grimm problem within that time. If you don’t, I will have no choice but to count it as a failure and it will be a black mark on your record. If you finish early, take the opportunity to relax in the area. The Bullhead leaves in two hours so that you will arrive in the morning. Please prepare yourself accordingly.”

“Understood, sir.” Jaune took the file and left the office. Once he was in the elevator, he opened the folder to see where they were going.
125.title: Surprised Call

choices: Test it on one of his teammates
Show Pyrrha the remote
Try it on someone else
1252.content:
“Chickens, cows, and fluffy sheep!” Nora sang, as she packed her bags. “How long has it been since we saw a real farm, Renny?”

“Only two months before we arrived at Beacon.” Ren answered. His bag was neatly packed and he was mentally going over everything once more to make sure he didn’t forget anything.

“How many Grimm are we looking at?” Pyrrha asked. “I need to make sure I bring enough ammo.”

“It says only a pair of Beowolves was spotted,” Jaune replied, handing her the folder. “But we should expect a few more.”

“Hardest part would be finding them and making sure we eliminate the pack,” Ren pointed out, looking over. “As we have a map, we shouldn’t have trouble locating their lair.”

“And then we can go and play with all the animals.” Nora added and the rest of the team laughed.

“Sure we can,” Jaune assured her. “Just make sure we have the farmers’ permission first.” Jaune packed his last shirt in and closed his bag. It took a little effort to close and zip it up, due to the fact it wasn’t very neat. As he moved his bag to the door, he felt the remote shift in his pocket. His eyes darted around the room. The rest of his team was busy and wouldn’t notice him use the remote. Of course, they were his friends, not only his teammates. He could show them the remote. At the very least, Pyrrha.

The possibility the remote was a hoax still existed, since he hadn’t tried it out yet. There was a little time before they had to leave. It wouldn’t be difficult to find a test subject.
1252.title: Farming Town

choices: Start off with a small test.
Might as well test it with a large swap.
The remotes probably fake, go nuts.
12523.content:
“I’m finished,” Jaune announced to the others. “Going to step outside for a few minutes.” Pyrrha smiled at him, before pulling open a dresser drawer. Nora waved and Ren gave a short nod. Jaune had just stepped outside when the door across the hall opened and a familiar girl with short black hair and red tips exited. Her gothic red and black dress was recognizable anywhere.

“Hey, Jaune!” Ruby Rose greeted brightly.

“Sup, Rubes.” Jaune replied.

“What’s happening with you?”

“Oh, Ozpin gave us a mission to clear some Grimm around a farming town,” Jaune answered. “We are finishing packing and leaving tonight. Will be gone a couple days.”

“Luuuuckkkkkyyyy,” Ruby told him and pouted a little. “I’m stuck here listening to Weiss and Yang argue.”

“About what?” Jaune asked.

“Yang used some of Weiss’s super expensive shampoo or something,” Ruby answered and waved her hair dismissively. “Seriously, she should buy normal priced shampoo. It’s so expensive I think she has to be putting actually silver in her hair.” The two of them shared a laugh. “So why are you out here?”

“I was…” Jaune paused. He couldn’t say he wanted to test some magical remote that swapped things between people. That sounded bad in his head and his phrasing ability would only make it worse. Ruby would be a perfect test subject for him after all. He just needed her to look away and decide what to swap. “…getting some last minute exercise before we get on the Bullhead. Going to be stuck in one for most of the night with Nora.”

“Isn’t being with Nora an exercise on its own?” Ruby asked innocently, causing Jaune to snort.

“Yeah, but being in a cramped compartment with motion sickness is going to prevent me from moving around any.”

“Ah, yeah.” From the look on her face, she didn’t envy anyone sitting next to him. The memory of him puking on Yang’s shoes was still vivid in their minds. The two of them turned down the hallway and walked together. “Soooo, there was a new Dust bullet released this week that’s supposed to have twice the piercing power. Grimm with thick hides won’t stand a chance.”

“Oh?”

One thing Ruby loved about Jaune was he didn’t think she was weird for loving weapons and weapon accessories. That was mostly due to the fact he admired that she was so passionate about something. As she went on and on about the new ammunition, Jaune secretly pulled out the remote and aimed it at her. It probably was going to work, but curiosity forced him to try it.

What did he decide to swap?
12523.title: Test Subject

choices: Find something to swap on the way to their mission.
Be responsible, swap back and resist the urge.
Keep Ruby's hair for now and see what happens.
125231.content:
He only needed a small swap to test it out. There were some more pressing matters on his mind, but if he didn’t try something, he would be constantly thinking about the remote. Besides, if by some miracle it did work, once they eliminated the Grimm, he might have a chance to mess around with it. Kind of like a reward for a job well done. Thinking the first test should be something cosmetic so he wouldn’t be worried about adapting to a new body, he aimed at Ruby’s hair and hit the Body Part Swap option.

Majestic sloths? Pyrrha and Jaune mouthed to Ren, who only smiled and shook his head letting them know it was better not to ask.

It was exactly as he imagined. He looked exactly like himself except his hair was slightly longer and black. He fingered a few strands and silently admitted it didn’t look that bad. It actually looked natural. He also noted none of his teammates noticed the difference. Seems the user manual was right about reality changing.

His eyes fell to the remote in his hand and he just stared at it for a moment. The potential of this remote was endless. If he played his cards right, there was nothing he couldn’t do or try out. Everything could be reset back to normal with a single press of a button. Still, there was still work to do before he could mess around. His team had an important mission. As the leader, he needed to be focused. The remote felt warm in his hand and kept pulling his attention back to it.

A small swap or two on the way there won’t hurt, probably.

Most of the area was flat fields, so if the Grimm weren’t there, that only left the woods on the east side.

“From the details on this map,” Ren informed the others. “I suspect they would be around this area. The natural formation would be an ideal spot for caves to form. The Grimm would rest there during the day and come out at night.”

“Do Grimm even sleep?” Jaune asked.

“When we find them we have to wake them up first,” Nora said. “It’s cowardly to attack them when they are sleeping.”

“If they are in a cave,” Ren pointed out. “Most likely they will hear us coming early on. We just want to be careful about being surrounded.”

“So what’s the plan, Fearless Leader?” Nora asked Jaune.

“Er… we can cover more ground in groups,” Jaune decided. “But Ren is right about being careful. So let’s travel in groups of two. If you find them, let the others know. Don’t engage them by yourself.”

“Understood!” Nora gave a snappy salute. “You don’t want us to have all the fun.”

“That’s not what I said,” Jaune muttered exasperatedly under his breath and Pyrrha giggled. “Yes, Nora. That’s exactly right.”

“Remind you of initiation?” Pyrrha asked, as the two of them starting moving.

“A little,” Jaune admitted, steeping over a large tree root. “At least this time I’m prepared.” They both laughed and went to work trying to locate the Grimm.
