The cow in Nora’s life was already moving faster than any cow Jaune had ever seen move. Ren followed immediately while he and Pyrrha trailed after them, leaving Nora in the cow’s life at the barn. The cow immediately began walking among the chickens while Ren stood nearby. Figuring he was as good of target as any, Jaune aimed at the rooster. It wasn’t likely to be eaten during their short stay. The reason he had to aim at the chicken first was he couldn’t swap Ren and it at once. He had to do a triangle swap.

After the flash of light, Jaune found himself naked where the chicken had been and a chicken was standing next to Pyrrha wearing his clothes. Jaune then made a quick swap with Ren, causing them to swap places and Jaune was now wearing Ren’s green robes. One more quick swap and he was back in his own body. The chicken was wearing Ren’s clothes watching the cow and Ren was naked standing on the fence.

Jaune diverted his eyes.

“I think Nora’s going to be there for a while,” Pyrrha commented with a giggle.

“What do you want to check out while she and Ren are playing with the chickens?” Jaune asked, planning to let Pyrrha unknowingly chose which animal she would swap with.

Pyrrha answered. “The…”
12523122313213232.title: Animal Team

choices: Continue as plan and do the triangular swap.
Ask the farm kids if they could try riding horses.
Jaune decides to tell Pyrrha about the remote.
125231223132132321.content:
“…Horses,” Pyrrha answered. “I remember seeing a few of them when I was younger, but never got to go anywhere near them. One I started seriously training to be a Huntress… there wasn’t any time to visit.”

“Then let’s go check them out,” Jaune suggested, pointing to a fenced in field. The two of them left Cow Nora and Chicken Ren alone. When they reached the field, Pyrrha leaned on the fence and looked at the horses passing by. There were around three dark brown ones nearby and in the distance. They saw two kids in their teens, probably a few years younger than them, riding other horses.

“They are pretty majestic.” Pyrrha commented, watching the horses prance around. One stopped to look at her back.

“If you asked, they might let you try riding one.” Jaune suggested.

“Oh… I don’t want to be any trouble. They villagers here are already so accommodating to Nora.”

“Then we just enjoy the fresh air for a bit?” Jaune suggested.

“That sounds lovely.” Pyrrha smiled at him before turning her attention back to the horses.

Jaune felt a little guilty about what he was planning to do because of that. It’s not like she would know and she did like horses. Of course, he could take the initiative instead and see if the farmer kids would let them try riding horses. There might be a problem with his Grimm body though. Funny enough, when he talked he stilled growled, but he didn’t even notice it anymore. Maybe the world already adjusted to the Body Swap. He could also tell Pyrrha about the remote, after switching everyone back. It might be worth having someone to explore it with. Pyrrha was trustworthy and wouldn’t go telling everyone about it.
125231223132132321.title: Horses.

choices: He had his fun, swap everyone back.
Find an animal to fit in with the rest of his team.
One of the kids was heading toward Pyrrha with a saddle.
1252312231321323211.content:
Jaune quickly swapped lives with one of the nearest horses. A second later, he found himself out in the field on all fours, He felt like he could stand up, but didn’t want to. Beowolves could run on all fours or on two legs, so he was okay with either way. His eyes darted back to Pyrrha. He suddenly realized she would be out in the field completely naked like Nora was. That alone almost prevented him from making the next swap. It was only the realization no one would notice and think it was natural that he continued. He was also a teenager and seeing naked girls was something he secretly desired.

He aimed the remote on the ground and clicked the button again. Now he found himself back on the outside of the pen wearing all of Pyrrha’s clothes. All the clothes adjusted because of the remote, but a Beowolf wearing a corset was not something Jaune would normally imagine. Next to him in his hoody and jeans was the horse. Seriously, his clothes seemed to fit it perfectly. Jaune sighed and swapped again. Rapid Life Swap were a little disorienting because he jumped from place to place like he was teleporting. Now the horse was wearing the corset and it looked extremely odd. He had to resist laughing, though a few chuckles escaped his lips.

Now he was back in his life and the rest of his team were animals. Nora a cow, Ren a chicken, and Pyrrha a horse. The world should see them all as normal except for him. His eyes traveled to Pyrrha now on all fours in the field, naked as the day she was born. She was prancing around in a circle without a care in the world. Even from this distance, Jaune could tell how hot his partner was. Her toned body from years of training was something most guys could only fantasize about. Jaune’s eyes focused on Pyrrha’s body for a bit before he got ahold of himself.

What did he do now?
1252312231321323211.title: Pyrrha the Mare

choices: Undo the swaps
Swap with the girl
Swap with Pyrrha
12523122313213232113.content:
Before Jaune could make up his mind, he saw a younger girl, maybe around 12, approaching Pyrrha. The Pyrrha living the life of a horse, not the horse currently next to Jaune. In her hand she had a large saddle. As the girl approached Pyrrha, Pyrrha turned and started walking toward her. It became obvious the girl was the horse’s owner. Pyrrha didn’t move much as the girl strapped the saddle on her back. Once it was securely in place, she put a foot on it and heft herself up on Pyrrha’s back. If Pyrrha was a full size horse, it probably would have been a lot more difficult.

Watching this, Jaune had to decide what he wanted to do quickly.

His first instinct was to undo swaps until Pyrrha was back to normal and let the girl take her horse to the other kids. However, some other ideas came to him. The first was he could swap with the girl. If he took her life, he could be the one riding Pyrrha… well the horse… and experience the reality a little more in depth. He would probably have to swap bodies too, as a Beowolf sitting on a human was probably not going to work. The remote might allow it, but it would be awkward.

The third option that came to him was swapping himself with Pyrrha. It would put her in his life and his in the horse’s. This was only an idea at first, but the more he considered it, the more it appealed to him. He could see what it was like to be an animal again and observe how reality altered to make everything seem normal. There had only been a few glimpses when he accidentally swapped with the cow.

The girl was riding Pyrrha away so he had to decide now.
12523122313213232113.title: A girl was heading towards Pyrrha

choices: Okay, he had his fun, time to swap back.
Swap back partially and decide to keep having fun with the remote.
Keep going as is.
125231223132132321132.content:
He couldn’t resist and aimed the remote.

There was a flash of light and Jaune felt himself bumping up and down in a much smaller body than his Grimm one. He glanced over his shoulder and saw a Beowolf with medium length blonde hair wearing his clothes next to a horse wearing Pyrrha’s clothes. He looked down at his outfit and saw a simple pair of jeans and a checkered long sleeve shirt. The girl whose life and body he now inhabited was only beginning to develop and Jaune wasn’t a pervert to check it out. No, he did this purely to see if a human swapped with a horse could support a person.

Pyrrha was still underneath him walking forward without a care in the world. Jaune held the reins and tugged, letting his life guide him. Pyrrha veered to the right and he quickly figured out how to turn. It was weird. Jaune could feel his feet barely off the ground. Swapping bodies had been a good idea. There was no way Pyrrha was used to walking on all fours, yet there was no issues with actually riding. Looking around, he saw the other kids near a small obstacle course or track. He wasn’t sure what they were officially called, but one of the obstacles required them to jump over a bar a couple feet above the ground. Thinking quickly and trying to figure out if this girl was skilled enough, he directed Pyrrha toward it.

“Hey, Sally!” One of the boys called out. “You want a turn?”

“Yes!” Jaune called back. “Just one jump for me, then I think I’m going to take it easy.”

“Okay!”

Jaune waited for one of them to finish and he took his place. Letting the girl’s life guide him, he tapped the side of Pyrrha and she began to run. At the last second, Jaune jerked the reigns and Pyrrha leaped into the air, far higher than Jaune expected. He almost fell off and stumbled when Pyrrha landed.

“Woah.” Jaune muttered. “That was… pretty intense.” He guided Pyrrha toward the fence and dismounted before tying her to a post. A couple brushes were hanging by nails and he picked up one to brush her hair. Mud was already caked on Pyrrha’s hands and feet and part of her arms and legs. On a normal horse, it wouldn’t be so noticeable. Pale human skin revealed mud much easier. Now that he had his fun and experimented with the remote, it was time to decide what to do.
125231223132132321132.title: Take Pyrrha for a Ride

choices: Go see what trouble Nora can get into.
Ask Pyrrha for some training. He needs to get used to his Grimm body.
Find someplace private and tell her about the remote.
1252312231321323211321.content:
As much fun as it was turning his teammates into animals, Jaune did feel a little guilty. Even if nothing was going to come from it, he knew what he did. Deciding now was as good as time as ever, he hit the Reset Button. There was a flash of light and a slight disorientation before Jaune found himself leaning up against the fence where he and Pyrrha had been before. Pyrrha was no longer a horse nor was a horse in her clothes. In the distance he could see Ren following Nora. Everything was back to normal. Well, except his Grimm body.

He was stuck in it.

“This is nice,” Pyrrha commented. “Maybe we could find some time to visit the rural cities more often. Like on break?”

“Don’t a lot of missions send us out to places like this?” Jaune asked.

“Well, yes.” She nodded. “But we may not always get downtime like this. Hunters and Huntresses can spend days or even weeks out in the field without seeing civilization.”

“Ouch.” Jaune flinched. “I’ve been camping before, but weeks? That’s pushing it. I wouldn’t be able to catch up on the new game releases.”

Pyrrha giggled.

“What should we do while I have you away from those games then?” She asked, smirking at him.

“Better take the opportunity while you can,” Jaune replied. He wasn’t worried. Pyrrha was the nicest girl he knew. “With our luck, I expect a Grimm invasion to happen soon or Nora to knock down a farmhouse.”

“Ren should be able to keep that from happening,” Pyrrha assured him. “She can behave when visiting places. With all the exercise she’s getting, she won’t go overboard.”

“True, but I bet she gets into some kind of trouble.”

“No one at Beacon would take that bet.”

They both burst out laughing.
1252312231321323211321.title: Back to Normal (For Now)

choices: Pyrrha believes him.
Pyrrha's unsure about this. (Use it with her.)
Someone interrupts them.
12523122313213232113213.content:
“I… actually have something I want to show you,” Jaune finally said to Pyrrha. “It’s kind of a secret, so how about we head over there?” He pointed toward the tree line.

“Okay?” Pyrrha sounded confused but followed him. Once they were out of sight of the others, she spoke again. “What did you find?”

“This.” He held out the remote.

“A… TV remote?” Pyrrha asked. “That’s strange to find one out here, but it’s not really a secret.”

“Look at the buttons closely,” Jaune told her. “Does it look like any remote you’ve seen before?”

Pyrrha leaned forward and shook her head.

“No.” She admitted. “There are symbols instead of numbers.”

“This remote is… special to say the least,” Jaune said. “I know this is going to sound strange, but please listen until I finish. Please?” Pyrrha looked concerned, but eventually nodded.

He took a deep breath and explained about the remote. While he didn’t mention all the swaps he did, he did explain a few of the little ones, like tests he did on the flight here. It was hard to tell Pyrrha everything. It wasn’t like he knew how it worked, only that it did work. There were also the swaps he did he wasn’t to make sure they never knew about. From the look on her face, Jaune could tell Pyrrha really didn’t believe him, yet she seemed conflicted. She couldn’t think of a reason why he would make something like this up.

“Jaune-…” Pyrrha started to say.
12523122313213232113213.title: Tell Pyrrha About the Remote

choices: Body Swap
Life Swap
Personal Info Swap
125231223132132321132132.content:
“Jaune…” Pyrrha said slowly. “Listen to yourself. A remote that can alter reality? Is this some sort of prank?” She was really trying to be nice, but hearing about a Swapping Remote was so ridiculous.

“I know it’s hard to believe,” Jaune admitted. “But it’s true!” He held the remote up. “I’ve tested it out multiple times and it does.”

“Let’s say it does work,” Pyrrha continued, humoring him. “Why show it to me?”

“Well…” Jaune hesitated and just decided to be honest. “Only the people touching the remote will realize what has been swapped. While I can see and laugh at the craziness, it would be nice to share it with someone. You’re my partner and I figured we could have some fun.”

“Jaune, that’s sweet and I do appreciate the thought, but there’s no way this is real.”

“Then let’s try it,” Jaune suggested. “What do you have to lose? I’ll even let you chose the swap.”

He held out the remote and Pyrrha lost out to temptation.

Together they looked around the farm at possible targets. Ren and Nora were there, a couple farmers, some kids, and animals. If they wanted, they could keep looking around for other swaps. However, Pyrrha still had to decide what she wanted to swap.
125231223132132321132132.title: Pyrrha's unsure about this. (Use it with her.)

choices: Swap with each other
Swap with somebody they don't know
With Ren and Nora
1252312231321323211321321.content:
"I think, if the thing works like you say it does, that swapping bodies is the best idea for a first try," Pyrrha said with some hesitation.

"That's a reasonable thought," Jaune replied.

"I just can't decide if we should try it on Ren and Nora or a stranger..."

"Well, if we do it with Ren and Nora, then we can stay longer than this trip, and there's also a reset button in case you decide to do the same with a stranger."

Pyrrha thought it over for a bit, and decided to...
1252312231321323211321321.title: Body Swap

choices: Jaune sits there surprised.
Ren and Nora noticed her running off and talk to Jaune.
Jaune chases after her.
12523122313213232113213213.content:
“Ren and Nora will be fine,” Pyrrha decided. “I don’t think it will work, but let’s say it does, it’s better if we know them.”

“Good idea.” Jaune told her, holding out the remote in his Grimm clawed hand. “We both have to touch the remote.” Pyrrha nodded and took his hand. They pressed the button and there was a flash of green light.

Pyrrha nearly fainted.

“This… this… it’s impossible!” She gasped. Looking down, she was in Nora’s ginger haired body wearing her own clothes, which shrunk down to fit. Meanwhile, she saw herself wearing Nora’s white and pink outfit taking to ‘Jaune’ wearing Ren’s green outfit. Meanwhile, the real Jaune was next to her, with Ren’s body.

Jaune watched the Beowolf body that was now his due to the accident talk to Nora like nothing was wrong.

“I told you.” He finally said. “Here, let’s undo it.” He put the remote in Pyrrha’s hand and hit the button. There was a flash and everything was undone. Pyrrha slumped to the ground and Jaune set next to her. After a few minutes, she calmed down and her expression turned from shock to amazement.

“This remote is… I can’t describe it.” Pyrrha told him. “What all can it do?”

Jaune explained each of the functions again and then some of his exploits, skipping over the fact he had turned his team into animals for fun.

“… so I miss aimed and accidently swapped with a cow and someone tried to milk me.” He finished, not saying it was Nora. Pyrrha was laughing at this.

“So it doesn’t have any side affects once you swap back?” She asked.

“People will rationalize what they did,” Jaune replied. “As long as we don’t try to get people in trouble or go on a crime spree, little differences won’t be noticed. Life Swap’s let you kind of understand what to do.”

“Why show me this?” Pyrrha asked. “This seems like something you and Ruby would love.”

“because you’re my partner,” Jaune said simply. “And I realized we could have a lot of fun with it. You could escape the fame of being Pyrrha Nikos the champion to anyone you wanted. We could try new things, have fun, and not have to worry about consequences. We can just… cut loose.” He smiled. “Things are always more fun with friends.”

That last line both hurt and pulled Pyrrha in closer.

“So just us,” Pyrrha whispered. “Having fun and trying other all sorts of lives and bodies and other stuff?”

“Yep, just us.” Jaune assured her. He lost his body, but that was because he had been stupid. There really was no harm in this. Honestly, his new body was much stronger than his old one. “Pyrrha, you’re important to me.”

“I am?” Pyrrha’s breath caught in her throat.

“Thanks to you, I passed initiation, improved so much, and really enjoyed my time at Beacon,” Jaune told her. “You’re like a sister to me.”

“What if I wanted to be more!”

The words escaped her mouth and Pyrrha’s eyes widened as she covered it with her hands.

“Pyrrha?” Jaune thought he misheard.

“I… got to go. Sorry!”

Before he could say anything else, Pyrrha took off.
12523122313213232113213213.title: With Ren and Nora

choices: They talk and they decide to date.
They talk, but Jaune doesn't like her romantically.
Jaune needs time to think about this sudden confession.
125231223132132321132132133.content:
Having group up with seven sisters, Jaune knew what he had to do. He couldn’t let a girl run away like that. If he did something wrong, he had to apologize.

“Pyrrha!” Jaune chased after her and grabbed her arm. “Tell me what’s wrong!”

There was a sniff and Pyrrha refused to look him in the eyes.

“Pyrrha…?”

“I’m sorry…” Pyrrha muttered.

“Pyrrha, please.” Jaune whispered. “If I did something wrong, I’m sorry. I thought we could just have a good time with the remote-…”

“It’s not that!” Pyrrha spun around. “I really appreciate you sharing that with me. It’s just… I’m sorry.” She kept apologizing but Jaune wasn’t sure why. “I’m being stupid.”

Her eyes widened as Jaune wrapped his arms around her in a hug.

“J-Jaune?!” Pyrrha gasped. “W-what…?”

“Sorry, but this always worked on my sisters when they were having trouble like this,” Jaune told her. He didn’t let her go. “Pyrrha, if I did something, I’m sorry.”

“It wasn’t you.” Pyrrha assured him, actually calming down and enjoying the warmth of the hug.

“Then what is it?” Jaune asked, finally letting go. “I can’t help if I don’t know, Pyrrha.”

“It’s just… what you said about me being family…” Pyrrha muttered.

“Oh… I’m sorry I embarrassed you like that.” Jaune rubbed the back of his head sheepishly.

“That’s not it!” Pyrrha’s face turned the same color of her hair.

“Then what is it?”

“I…”

Pyrrha took a deep breath. You would think a champion fighter, model, and spokesperson would be able to speak to a boy, but Pyrrha had never been able to say what she wanted to Jaune. Even now, her mind was screaming at her body to tell him at last. Words were just not coming out. She took another deep breath. They were alone and her friends, Nora and Team RWBY, told her she needed to confess. This was the best time to do it. That didn’t stop her from being afraid.

“…want to be more.”

Jaune blinked.

“More?”

“I don’t want to be just a friend, teammate, or sister,” Pyrrha continued, the words tumbling out of her mouth. Once the dam broke, they just kept coming. “I like you, Jaune. From the first time we met. You treated me like everyone else. Not Pyrrha Nikos the champion, but Pyrrha the person. Being partners with you was a dream come true. The more I got to know you, the more I fell for you. You’re funny, a hard worker, smart, kind, thoughtful, and patient with all of us. I like you Jaune and I want to be in a relationship with you.”

Jaune stared at her.

That was the last thing she expected.

Adrenaline wore off and Pyrrha’s red face grew, if possible, even redder.

“I’m sorry…” Her voice was so weak.

“Pyrrha… I didn’t know.”

All thoughts of the remote forgotten, Jaune opened his mouth to answer her.
125231223132132321132132133.title: Jaune chases after her.

choices: The rest of their mission goes smoothly and they play with the remote.
More Grimm appear.
Skip to when they get back to Beacon.
1252312231321323211321321331.content:
“I… didn’t know.” Jaune muttered. “I should have noticed.”

“It’s not your fault!” Pyrrha assured him. “I hid it from you because I was scared.”

“Scared, you?” Jaune was surprised again. “But… you’re amazing in every way? Smart, strong, cool, everything a guy could want in a girl.”

“I’m still a girl and confessing is hard.” Pyrrha tried to chuckle weakly.

“I was kind of, no I was dense.” Jaune amended. “Thinking back, I should have realized you were helping me so much more than a normal person. We were kind of like Nora and Ren dynamic.”

Pyrrha gulped.

“You really meant all those things you said about me?” Jaune asked nervously. Pyrrha nodded and looked at the ground. “Pyrrha… You’re amazing and I owe you so much. If we start dating, it’s going to change things.”

“I know.”

“But…”

Pyrrha looked up at that one word from him.

“… I think I would like to see if it will work out,” Jaune continued. “On one condition.”

“One condition?” It was Pyrrha’s turn to be confused.

“If it doesn’t work out, we’ll still be friends.” Jaune told her. “I won’t compromise on this.

Pyrrha stared at him.

The silence lengthened.

“HAHAHAHA!”

She burst out laughing, she couldn’t help it. That was the last thing she expected. It was so like Jaune though. He was worried about her and the team more than himself. He didn’t once think about the struggles he would have to go though. Pyrrha knew she had to warn him, but if they were going to date, maybe they could get a little more intimate.

Pyrrha didn’t get up, but she moved onto Jaune’s lap and leaned her head on his chest. To his credit, while he stiffened a little at her boldness, he wrapped his arms around her to comfort her.

“It helps you’re taller than me too,” Pyrrha hummed. “Most guys aren’t and it’s nice to be able to cuddle like this.”

“Glad my chest is comfy,” Jaune laughed, partially thanking his fluffy Beowolf body.

“Jaune… I have to warn you because it wouldn’t be fair otherwise,” Pyrrha whispered. “Due to my fame, there are people who are going to talk about you. Paparazzi is going to want to follow you around. It will be difficult to go into public on dates. A lot of celebrity’s have trouble dating normal people because a lot of people can’t handle the pressure.”

“Well, I can’t say what the future holds,” Jaune admitted. “But if we can’t go out, we can watch movies in our room wearing pajamas and eat microwave popcorn.”

“That sounds romantic and I can’t wait.” Pyrrha said happily.

“Also, we happen to have a remote that can let us… bypass those fame restrictions.” Jaune reminded her and Pyrrha’s eyes shot open as she sat up.

“Wow… you’re right.” Pyrrha stared at him. “We can spend time together without other people recognizing us.”

“Yep, and if I’m with you, it’s sure to be fun.” Jaune smiled at her and she could only stare into his blue eyes.

Slowly, her head moved forward and their lips locked together as Jaune leaned against a tree.

“IT HAPPENED!”

The energetic cry caused them both to jump and they saw Nora and Ren peaking out from behind another tree.

“Sorry, we just noticed.” Ren apologized.

“So you two are together!?” Nora asked.

Pyrrha and Jaune looked at each other.

“Yep.” They said in unison.

“They took it better than I thought they would.” Pyrrha commented.

“We walked into the room and were bombarded with streamers,” Jaune replied, remembering what Nora, Ren, and Team RWBY did. “Actually… nothing blew up, so maybe you’re right.”

Pyrrha giggled as she and Jaune walked through the halls of Beacon. Their relationship has spread pretty quickly thanks to Nora and Ruby. It didn’t bother her as much as other rumors did. 13.content:
“Those two are so infuriating,” Weiss muttered, walking through the grounds of Beacon to clear her mind and get some peace and quiet.

Weiss Schnee was somewhat of a perfectionist. She had to have top grades, expert fighting abilities, and believed she would easily become a team leader. Reality came crashing down and instead, her partner, fifteen year old Ruby, received that honor. For a long time, Weiss wondered why Ozpin gave Ruby the position instead of her. Over time, it slowly became apparent and Weiss no longer hated her partner. She actually liked her. What she hated was when Ruby and her sister Yang took over the room and made so much noise she couldn’t work on her homework. While it was only Friday and classes ended roughly an hour ago, Weiss liked to get an early start.

She could have gone to the library, but instead decided to take the opportunity to get some fresh air.

“If only she would put half as much effort into her studies as she does her weapon,” Weiss continued to rant. “She could easily become a prime example of what a team leader should be.” Her footsteps faltered when she saw something sparkle in the sunlight. “Are people leaving junk out here? Why can’t they throw stuff away like a proper person?” As she drew nearer, the object became clearer.

It was a remote.

Why is this out here? Weiss thought. What possible reason would someone bring a remote out this far. She reached down and picked it up, briefly noting a folded up piece of paper under it. The remote was unlike any other remote she had seen before. Instead of letters or numbers on the buttons, there were pictures. One looked like a t-shirt, another an arm, a third had a rough outline of a body. The rest of the buttons were designed in similar fashions. Not sure what its use was for, she unfolded the piece of paper and began to read.

Your Guide to the Swapping Remote

“You have got to be kidding me,” Weiss stated at the stupidity of the information before her. “So someone bought this piece of junk and threw it away when they found out it didn’t work? This is something Ruby or that dunce Arc would do.” She spun the remote in one hand while her eyes skimmed the note. “Still, this instructional guide seems to be a little more detailed than a normal prank should be.” Suspicion conflicted with common sense. “I could just test it out for the hell of it. It’s not like it would work.”

Weiss glanced around the school grounds, trying to reconcile the thoughts bouncing around her head. All logic and common sense dictated that there was no way something like this could work. Coming from Atlas, she was very familiar with the latest technology, and nothing even remotely close to this had ever been developed. However, the instruction manual was so detailed, and the remote so meticulously crafted, that her curiosity couldn't help but be piqued. That was the only reason she hadn't bothered to simply throw this away like the trash it was yet. The longer she stood contemplating, though, the more the other students nearby would find it odd that she was just standing around holding a TV remote. She didn't exactly want her fellow classmates to think her strange, and especially didn't want to leave a bad impression on the students visiting for the Vytal Festival.

She shook her head, clearing her thoughts. "This is ridiculous," she mumbled to herself. "Something like this could never work." She decided to simply humour her curiosity quickly before tossing it. There was no sense trying to plan something out for searching for a target. There were enough students milling about that she could just point the remote at one of them and press a button. Despite not believing that the remote would actually work, Weiss at least had the sense to try something small. A body part swap should suffice. She didn't particularly care what part swapped, seeing as the remote was clearly a farce anyway, and she didn't see the worth in taking yet more time out of her day to decide on which part of herself she'd be willing to hypothetically swap away. She'd recognise whether it was or wasn't working all the same. And so, as she began to walk over to the nearest trash can, Weiss pointed the remote at a nearby crowd of students and pressed the button for a body part swap, and selected a random option, not bothering to pay attention to what she'd selected or who she'd targeted.

Weiss' finger pressed down on the button the moment she reached the trash can, and as she did, she immediately stopped dead in her tracks. Not because she was about to throw the remote away, but because she could tell something was wrong. Something was very wrong. Something that would stop her from throwing it away.

With a shaky hand, she slowly reached up to the top of her head, eyes wide in panic. Her hand recoiled as her fingers brushed against something furry. Gathering what confidence hadn't fled her, she sent her fingers back in, taking hold of the furry mass. She couldn't just feel it grasped between her fingers, she could also feel her fingers pressing against it, as if it were a part of her. Easing her hand up it, she found it to be somewhat thin, but very long. Once she reached the tip, show slowing lowered her hand once more, pulling whatever this furry thing was into view. If Weiss' eyes could get any wider than they already were, they did just that as she saw what it was she was holding.

Pinched between her fingers was the tip of a fluffy, brown rabbit's ear. Not only that, she could tell from the sensations her body was giving her that it wasn't just some random prop ear that had somehow wound up on her head, it was a part of her. Somehow, she had sprouted a pair of rabbit ears from her head.

Weiss's grip loosened as the colour drained from her face, allowing the ear to spring back up next to its partner. "Impossible..." she mumbled. Against all laws of science and reality, the remote had worked. Considering she'd selected a body part swap, she surmised that she must have selected "ears", and she must have targeted a faunus, resulting in swapping not only their normal human ears, but also the animal ears they possessed. As the shock of the situation slowly began to wear off, Weiss realised just how much louder everything sounded now that she possessed two sets of ears. In fact, her ears twitched slightly as she picked up a nearby conversation, a conversation involving the person she guessed was her target.

Looking over at the source of the noise, Weiss saw the second year team, Team CFVY, seemingly having just come back from town, engaged in conversation. Their conversation wasn't what Weiss was paying attention to, however. Something was very clearly missing from this picture. Velvet, the lone faunus of the team, was present amongst the group, but what wasn't present were her ears. The long, brown rabbit ears that usually sat atop her head were missing, and Weiss knew why. Velvet must have been the person she'd accidentally targeted. She seemed none the wiser, as did the rest of her team. It was as if she'd never had those ears to begin with. In fact, the same seemed to hold true for Weiss herself. Looking around, no one seemed to be looking at her strangely, as if she'd always had these rabbit ears.

"This... This is incredible. How...?" Weiss was at a loss for words. She looked down at the remote in her hand. There was certainly no way she could trash it now that she knew it worked, but in place of her scepticism, she now found her head full of all sorts of questions. Who made this remote? Why did they leave it there in the courtyard? How was anything it did possible? She had a feeling, however, that she'd never get the answers to those questions.

More importantly, though, was the question of what to do next. Glancing back up again, Weiss felt the colour drain from her face again as she realised her accidental target had disappeared; Team CFVY had retreated inside the building, out of Weiss' view. Instead of rushing after them, however, Weiss managed to keep a cool head and think things through carefully. The remote accounted for situations like these. Verifying her memory, she checked the manual again, a small smile appearing as she got to the part about the undo and reset buttons. She could give Velvet her ears back and de-faunus-ify herself whenever she wanted to. Speaking of which, she wasn't sure how this swap would affect the rest of her life. Her parents were both human before the swap, so was she a faunus with different parents now, or was she still considered a human, but with rabbit ears? Perhaps that was worth exploring. Alternatively, now that she had tested the remote first hand, there was no longer any question of whether it worked or not. She could perform any sort of swap she wanted, so long as it was detailed in the manual, and there were still plenty of targets nearby.

Now, Yang barely had any bumps pushing out her uniform. Weiss, on the other hand, was now feeling the weight of two heavy mounds threatening to pull her forward. Before Weiss could say anything, Yang stopped and turned to her with a hand on the door.

“You’re lucky, Weiss Cream,” Yang said. “Even though you’re short, you got an awesome rack.” She slapped her butt. “Best thing I can do is make a chiseled booty men would die for. If Blake stops by, tell her I want to meet for dinner around 6:30.”

“Will do,” Weiss replied automatically, her mind still stunned at what just happened. The second the door closed behind Yang, Weiss bolted toward the mirror to examine herself.

Her reflection looked normal except now her chest had two amazing breasts. They looked a little unusual on her smaller frame then on Yang, but they still fit. What was even more amazing was her clothes adjusted to fit her new assets. The clothes Weiss was wearing now was just her Beacon uniform. The shirt and bra she had was not made for Yang’s breasts. Yet, they adjusted to fit the second the swap was made. Weiss jump a little and felt her new breasts bounce up and down. Even if the size changed, her strapless bra was not designed to support a lot of weight. She would have to change. As she did so, ideas flashed through her mind on what to do next.
133.title: The Perfect Target

choices: Wardrobe/Clothing Swap
Life Swap
Personality or Personal Info Swap
1331.content:
Okay, so now that I know this remote is… magic. I really can’t explain it otherwise. What should I do next?

Weiss was somewhat of a perfectionist and her brain immediately began to think of how to proceed. She needed to be systematic in her swaps to test out each of the functions. As she dug through her dresser for a bra with a strap, her mind was already running through ideas. Everything stopped when she pulled out one of her favorite bras, a silver lace one with shoulder straps. This time the cups were much, much larger than they had been before. It seems all her clothing had adjusted. Weiss smiled and quickly changed out of her strapless one. Yang’s, well, her new breasts now were heavy. Weiss had no doubt she would be getting tired of the weight at some point.

Until then, why not show them off a bit?

She adjusted her current dress a little so the top of her new chest was clearly on display. Smiling to herself, she posed in front of the mirror, placing an arm under her breasts to push them up. It was one of Yang’s favorite positions.

“Heh, they might be a little big for my frame,” Weiss said softly. “Pyrrha’s or Blake’s would be a better fit, but there’s plenty of time to mix and match. For not, let’s see what else this device can do.”

There were several different swaps she could try out. Limiting her options, she decided to avoid another Body Part Swap until she tested out the others. Body Swap was also crossed off for now, due to being too similar. That left Wardrobe, Life, Personality, and Personal Info Swaps available. Each had pros and cons, something Weiss began to write down in her notebook. Carefully weighing her options and choosing the best course of action was how she liked to act.

Wardrobe Swap was perhaps the safest bet. Clothing was a simple swap compared to life or intangible things, like names and personality. The downside was Weiss’s clothing was all top of the line expensive goods. No one else in Beacon would have anything similar in value, except maybe Pyrrha and Coco. There was a chance whoever she swapped with would ruin her things.

Life Swap was the next choice. From what the instructions described, she would remain the same appearance except would be living the life or the target and them her. She would be in their clothes and everyone would see her as them. Part of her wanted to see if swaps beforehand were affected by the Life Swap and what would occur after. The downside was she didn’t know if she could act like someone else. The instructions said she would be able to understand how to act like the target, but it didn’t explain it in details.

Personality Swap was a risky but intriguing option. Weiss’s teammates kept telling her she needed to have some more fun and just relax, but that wasn’t like her. She wanted to work hard and stay ahead. Maybe swapping with someone would let her see the appeal of having time to goof off and discover a hobby. The risk was she may not want to swap back. She didn’t know the full extent of what that swap would do.

The Personal Info had the most choices, as she could theoretically swap anything she could imagine. Names, weapons, race, positions, occupations, intelligence, pretty much everything not listed in previous swaps was on the table. The risk was written down in a small subsection beneath the main instructions. It warned that some Personal Info Swaps could cause reality to alter in unforeseeable ways. Users needed to be careful. This sounded ominous with a device already capable of alternating reality and memories.

Weiss examined her notes and finally decided which swap she wanted to do next.
1331.title: Perfectionist

choices: Weiss goes with a Personality Swap.
Weiss goes with a Personal Information Swap.
Weiss sees a better target.
13313.content:
Weiss tapped her fingers impatiently on her desk as she thought about her next step.

Clothing Swaps aren’t that big of a deal. I can buy pretty much any female clothes I want and it’s not like I want to wear boys’ clothes. Life sounds interesting, but I’ll save that for later when one of my teammates show up. I want to observe how they act as me. So that only leaves personality or personal information. I am curious about how reality would change with these swaps.

For now, she really needed to find a target. The exactly swap could be decided then.

Weiss walked over to the window and looked out over Beacon’s courtyard. A good number of students were heading out to the city. Among them were two familiar faces. The first was her teammate Ruby. The short black haired girl stood out with her red and black gothic style dress. Next to her was Jaune Arc, a tall blonde scraggly boy who got on Weiss’s nerves constantly. He couldn’t take a hint that she wasn’t interested in him romantically and kept asking her out in so many cheesy ways. He was wearing typical jeans and a black hoody. Weiss had no idea what they were planning, but it was obvious they were heading to Vale.

“Probably going to pick up the new issue of the comic book or something,” Weiss muttered. How they could like that trash was beyond her. Blake may have had some… exotic tastes… but she had least read adult books without pictures. Her eyes narrowed as the two of them laughed about something and seemed to be enjoying themselves. Something Yang said echoed in her mind.

You have to have fun once in a while.

Weiss glanced down at her now sizable rack and smiled. Her very first swap had been… fun. Perhaps a little more was in order. Her eyes fell onto Ruby again and she made up her mind. There was nothing she wanted to swap with Jaune. Ruby would at least return to their room and Weiss could observe how they both had changed with the swap. As Ruby and Jaune continued to move further away, Weiss didn’t have long to decide.

A Personality Swap might allow Weiss to have some fun. Ruby always found entertainment in the weirdest activities. This was an opportunity to understand the appeal in such trivial things. Her own perfectionist lifestyle always held her back. It might be interesting. A Personal Info Swap was the other option. It could be something small like a name to something larger like friends. Weiss didn’t necessarily want to hang out with Jaune, but maybe he would act differently if he saw Weiss as a nonromantic friend.
13313.title: Let's get Personal.

Her aim was way off and she hit someone else.
133131.content:
Might as well see what it’s like not having a care in the world.

Weiss aimed the remote at Ruby, but hesitated.

The consequences ran through her mind. This was just what Weiss was like and until she squashed the nagging feeling in the back of her head, she wouldn’t want to press the button. Personality shouldn’t swap intelligence, so Weiss believed she would be able to tell what was different. Imagining herself running around excitedly, reading comic books, loving weapons to an unhealthy degree, and scarfing down cookies by the dozen didn’t seem possible. It was only thanks to the evidence of her new chest that she could.

Her thoughts snapped back to the present as Ruby and Jaune started to enter the crowd of people heading towards the landing platform.

Now or never.

Weiss was rather far away when she pressed the button and saw a flash of green light. Did she hit the right target?
133131.title: Seeing Things Differently

Use the remote some more
1331311.content:
Weiss immediately felt differently.

It wasn’t a bad feeling though.

The first thing she noticed was she suddenly felt less restricted. The desire to have everything perfect was gone. A weight had been lifted off her shoulders. Weiss shook her head and looked around. Things were still the same physically, but seemed different. Her eyes fell onto her desk and there was no desire to complete her homework. She knew she could do it later. Her gaze then fell to her dresser drawer, still open from when she changed bras.

I really should get some more variety in colors, Weiss thought to herself. Maybe some darker ones, like red or black. Out of nowhere her stomach growled. She opened her desk to look for a snack, but the health bar she kept stored there did not look appetizing. I’m sure Ruby wouldn’t mind if I borrowed a cookie or two. Ruby kept a stash in her desk, something Weiss was familiar with as Ruby ate them all the time and even offered her some before. Weiss opened Ruby’s desk and rummaged around in the back, to pull out a box of chocolate chip cookies. She popped one into her mouth.

Then another.

The box was only about half full, but a few minutes later it was empty and Weiss realized what she did.

“Ruby’s going to be upset with me,” Weiss realized. “Maybe if I act innocent, she will think someone else took it.” She rubbed her chin. “I could say I was working on a new attachment with Myrtenaster.”

She blinked.

Suddenly, her unusual actions dawned on her.

The desire to procrastinate, her change in color preference, the desire for sweets, and wanting to upgrade her weapon were all part of Ruby’s personality. Weiss forced herself to stand still and think, even though she wanted to run off in excitement. Her intelligence hadn’t been swapped so thinking this through was possible. She could remember being her old self up to the point where she had swapped with Ruby. Her originals likes and dislikes were accessible. Now, everything she did before just seemed boring. Just taking notes felt like a drag. Because this wasn’t a Personal Info Swap, reality didn’t seem to adjust to their new personalities. Everyone should just believe they were always like that.

“Heh.” Weiss chuckled. “This is kind of fun. Yang was actually right. No one should notice the sudden change, so I can take the day off and goof around.” She held up the remote. “Maybe do some more swaps. This remote is awesome.”

choices: Pyrrha

13313113.content:
Weiss couldn’t resist, she had to try out more functions of the remote. It was an amazing toy she could do whatever she wanted with and no one would know unless she wanted them too. Everything could even be reset if she messed up. There was no drawback whatsoever. Sure, Weiss knew deep down these feelings were part of Ruby’s personality, but she felt so free. Plus, her one inadequate part of her body had been changed when she stole Yang’s boobs. Weiss pocketed the remote and left the room, looking for her next target.

Beacon seemed somehow grander to Weiss as she made her way through the hallways, even though she has traveled the halls countless time. She couldn’t believe she managed to make it into one of the most prestigious schools in the world. She passed several students, but none of them stood out. The library where Weiss spent most of her free time didn’t look appealing in the slightest unless she was looking for Blake. She passed the dining hall where a few people were enjoying an early dinner. It wasn’t nearly as loud or excitable as it normally was. There was no one Weiss really knew there yet except Cardin and his team. No way was Weiss going to swap with bullies like them.

Part of her wanted to visit the forge and try some new weapon modifications, but that wouldn’t give her many opportunities to test the remote. Thinking she could head to the gym and visit Yang, maybe swap something else with her if no one else came to mind. Weiss turned a corner to make her way to the training wing. As she passed a training room, she heard some familiar voices and stopped. Peeking into the room, she saw three people talking.

Pyrrha Nikos, Coco Adel, and Velvet Scarlatina were chatting, surrounded by destroyed training droids. Weiss paused and listened for a moment.
http://pre06.deviantart.net/424d/th/pre/...
https://i3.kym-cdn.com/photos/images/ori...

“See? Bun-Bun here doesn’t need any help standing up to Winchester,” Coco assured her.

“Coco!” Velvet reprimanded, flushing at the nickname.

“Then why do you let him push you around?” Pyrrha asked. “If Jaune had intervened that one time….”

“That heroic act made her fall for him,” Coco interjected with a laugh.

“It’s not like that,” Velvet denied. “I just want to know a little bit about him. You don’t see a lot of people stick up for others like that.” Coco continued to laugh at her denials and only Weiss noticed Pyrrha’s smile appeared fixed.

Well, Jaune is pretty cool when he isn’t trying to flirt, Weiss admitted and immediately shook her head. She had to be careful or Ruby’s personality would cause her to do something stupid. The perfect opportunity to switch something with one of those three couldn’t be ignored though. A quick glance down the empty hall showed she was alone and she pulled out the remote. Taking careful aim before she was spotted, Weiss aimed at…

Coco’s outfit was pretty cool.

She was always at the forefront of fashion and her outfit reflected that. Ammo was even incorporated into her combat attire around the belt and slung over the shoulder. Her weapon was the bag she was carrying that transformed into a fully automatic Gatling gun. Plus, the sun glasses she always wore made her seem mysterious.

There was a flash of green light as Weiss selected the Wardrobe Swap option.

Coco had so many outfits, Weiss wanted to make sure she had the chance to try them all and see what would fit best with her body. She felt the changes instantly. Coco’s clothes covered more of her body than her dress and there was a distinct lack of breeze between her thighs. Combat skirt versus trousers. The beret covered her head, but didn’t interfere with her on the side ponytail. Her eyes fell down to her hands, now covered by gloves. Several necklaces weighed down on her neck. The biggest difference though was how dark everything got as Weiss’s eyes were covered by sunglasses.

She pulled down the shades to the end of her nose and smiled.

I feel like a secret agent.

Of course, that was due to Ruby’s personality taking charge. Even though Weiss’s intelligence told her otherwise, some wires were crossed because of her earlier swap. It wasn’t a bad conflict, just weird.

Looking back at Coco, Weiss was surprised how good Coco looked in her outfit. Both sets of clothes adjusted to their new owner. Coco was now wearing her white and blue dress with the high heels. Coco's boots had heels too, so there wasn't a drastic height change. Neither she, Velvet, nor Pyrrha noticed any difference in her clothes. Weiss couldn't believe how amazing this remote was..

1331311321.content:
There was no reason to stop swapping so soon. Weiss had only tried a physical swap by stealing Yang’s breasts, then a mental swap with Ruby’s personality, and lastly a Wardrobe swap with Coco’s clothes. Weiss thought about it for a brief moment before her eyes fell onto Pyrrha. Pyrrha had many things Weiss liked. She had looks, brains, skills, and more. However, there was one thing Weiss was focusing on.

It was Pyrrha’s height.

Weiss had always been short, one of the reason she wore high heels. Being the shortest member on her team always bothered her. Now she had a chance to rectify that. Her smile widened as she aimed the remote and hit the button. There was another green light and Weiss felt herself grow. It wasn’t so much stretching, but her entire body seemed to adjust to fit her new height. Looking down at her impressive chest, it didn’t seem quite so out of place on her new frame. Her eyes then traveled back to Pyrrha.

She laughed.

Weiss knew how to move without issue now.
1331311321.title: Growing Up

choices: Swap Personality
Swap Races
Swap Possessions (Books)
133133.content:
As Weiss brought the remote up and aimed at Ruby, another one of her teammates enter her sights.

Blake Belladonna, the Faunus who hid her identity and pretended to be human.

Weiss understood now why she hid her race from them. There were a lot of prejudice against Faunus, including some beliefs Weiss once held. Blake was still wearing her Beacon uniform and her face was buried in her book like normal. Her black bow covered her cat ears. Weiss thought about it and decided she would be a better target over Ruby. There were some interesting swap options with Blake.

Naturally, Weiss could go with a Personality Swap. Blake was smart like she was, but more reserved and enjoyed reading a lot more than she did. There were some slight differences that should be noticeable. Weiss could use this as a test to make sure Personality Swaps didn’t affect her own mind too much. Alternatively, there was the Personal Information Swap. The perfect test for this option swam to the front of her mind.

Swap races.

Weiss could become a Faunus for a short time.

Unlike a Body Part Swap, Weiss wasn’t sure what exactly would help if she swapped races. Would she grow ears like Blake’s, would she get some random Faunus trait, or would everyone just consider her a Faunus. This would be the sort of test she was interested in trying. Still, Yang’s words kept echoing in her mind. Having a little fun wouldn’t be a bad thing. Blake did have all those books and enjoyed reading them. Weiss was sure she had some hidden away to prevent the others from seeing. Probably to keep Yang from teasing her and Ruby from reading something she shouldn’t see. Weiss was kind of tempted at the thought of digging into interests of the most reserved member of her team.

What did she select?
133133.title: Windows Have a Wide View

choices: Weiss grew a pair of cat ears, but they were white like her hair.
Weiss obtained a different animal part.
There was no physical change, people just perceived her as a Faunus.
1331332.content:
Blake was walking across the grounds slowly, her eyes glued to her book, giving Weiss plenty of time to make a decision.

After a minute of pondering, she finally came to a decision.

When Weiss came to Beacon, she didn’t trust the Faunus, even if she tried to treat them the same as others. The White Fang had been attacking her father’s company since she was a child. People she knew just disappeared or ended up dead. It also didn’t help that a lot of people in Atlas looked down at the Faunus. The culture sort of just sunk in. One of the reasons she applied to Beacon was to get away from that, not counting her father. Blake hiding her Faunus identity was a shock to Weiss, especially since Blake admitted to once belonging to the White Fang.

It was an understatement that Weiss had been angry.

They eventually sat down and talked. Both of them explaining why they acted this way and made up. Weiss didn’t hold any animosity anymore for her teammate and friend. She also knew not all Faunus were bad. Velvet, a rabbit Faunus at Beacon, was one of the nicest, sweetest girls in existence. There was no way she would ever join the White Fang. Back home, Weiss had always been told Faunus were given the same wages as humans, so they shouldn’t be fighting for equal rights when they had them already. Blake had countered Faunus were usually given the most dangerous areas while maintenance and safety was ignored.

Weiss wasn’t blind. She saw how some people, like Cardin, treated Faunus. That explanation made sense.

Her fingers ran over the remote one last time before Weiss aimed it at Blake.

She was going to learn what it was like for them. What they went through. When she inherited the Schnee Dust Company, she needed to know how to mend the relationship between humans and Faunus.

There was a flash of light when her finger landed on the button.

How did the race swap take place?
1331332.title: Become a Faunus

choices: Weiss goes out to explore the new reality.
Weiss decides she wanted to test out other swap options.
Weiss notices something different about her belongings and it's not good.
13313321.content:
There wasn’t anything immediately noticeable when the light faded.

Blake kept walking until she was out of sight of Weiss’s window.

“Why didn’t anything changed?” Weiss demanded to no one in particular. “She still had her bow and everything.” She crossed her arms and huffed, upset the remote decided now to fail. All the excitement the first swap caused immediately faded away to be replaced by disappointment. Her chest bounced slightly and that wasn’t the only part of her that moved.

She felt a twitch on her head.

Eyes widening, Weiss rushed to the mirror and looked at her reflection. On top of her head was a pair of cat ears exactly like Blake’s except for the color. Blake had black ears, but the ones on Weiss’s head were snow white, matching her hair. Weiss’s eyes widened and she slowly reached up with one hand. Her fingers lightly brushed an ear and a shiver ran down her spine. They were soft, like fine silk. She examined herself closely in the mirror. Even with Yang’s chest and now white version of Blake’s ears, Weiss didn’t look that different from herself. Sure, the chest didn’t really suit for her small frame, but there were lots of women with that problem. The ears looked completely natural.

“And they are really sensitive,” Weiss muttered, feeling them once more to experience the sensation again. “No wonder Blake won’t let Ruby touch them.” She frowned as she remembered Cardin bulling Velvet. “That brute pulls her ears all the time. If they are anywhere as sensitive as Blake’s… She has to be in a great deal of pain.” The next time she saw Cardin do that she would step in. Like Jaune did that one time. “Looks like Arc was right in that case. I should commend him on that when I get the chance.”

“What to do now?” Weiss mused, tapping her cheek and admiring her reflection. The ears were cute and she enjoyed looking at them. The added bonus of being able to hear things better, like the people walking past her room, was only a benefit. “Ah, right. Note this down.” She grabbed her notebook and started writing her test results down. “Hmm, I need to see how this last swap alters people’s perception of me.” She frowned. “If everyone treats me like a Faunus, then people like Cardin will try to put me down. I wouldn’t let a brute do that of course, but I need to be prepared.”

After the pep talk, Weiss set down her notepad and thought about how to proceed.
13313321.title: Second Set of Ears

choices: Take some time to explore this reality.
Check in with her teammates or friends.
This is too much. Swap back.
133133213.content:
As Weiss was prepared to leave, she glanced at her bed and then froze.

“What the…?” She trailed off as she stepped forward and reached down to touch her sheets. “These aren’t mine.”

The sheets on her bed were the typical cotton sheets Beacon provided to each student. Weiss had switched them out on the first day with her own. A special silk blend that wasn’t as harsh on the skin. Confused, Weiss’s first thought was to blame Ruby. She probably messed up the sheets when doing laundry, but quickly pushed the thought from her mind. Ruby wasn’t that dumb. Figuring it had something to do with the remote, Weiss examined her desk. Most of the notebooks, and school textbooks were exactly the same, but she noticed several Dust vials were missing. Feeling she was overlooking something important, she went to the closet to check the rest of her belongings. I big surprise greeted her.

The entire wardrobe had changed.

They were still her clothes. They had to be. The white and blue color scheme was exactly the same. It was the outfits themselves that were different. Weiss grabbed the nearest one and looked at the designer tag. It was a brand far cheaper than her original outfit. Before the swap, all her clothes had been designer brands, these new ones were generic. It only took a minute to confirm this as she skimmed through multiple dresses, shirts, and skirts. More confused than ever, Weiss closed the closet door and walked back to her desk, thinking hard.

Why did everything change? Think through this carefully. When I swapped with Yang, my clothes adjusted. I’m wearing the school uniform, so it didn’t change like the rest of my clothes did after I swapped with Blake. A race swap shouldn’t have changed all the clothes. It’s not like I grew a tail and needed a hole for it to poke through. The only explanation was reality altered itself in some way. The question is, how? Is it just my clothes or something more?

Weiss pondered this for a moment and then she remembered a string of images in her mind that definitely weren’t her memories. She shook her head and they disappeared. Frowning a little more, she tried to concentrate on them. The memories flashed through her mind again and she saw herself in a past far different situation than she had been before. It turns out being a Faunus had much further implications than she could imagine. Her mouth fell open as she realized what happened in this reality.

She had been disowned.

More specifically, Weiss was a bastard child. Her mother cheated on her father with a Faunus. No one found out until Weiss was born. The rift between her pants continued to grow and strain their relationship. When Weiss was ten, her father had enough of her and sent her away to live with others, far away from him, the company, and the rest of her family. Determined to make her father proud and hopes he would bring her back, Weiss continued to strive to perfection. When this didn’t work, she decided to become a Hunter and protect the downtrodden. Due to the financial situation, her clothes couldn’t be top of the line brands. Most of her income had to go to Dust for her rapier, the one thing she inherited from her mother.

The only solace was her adoptive parents were kind and that her sister, Winter, maintained regular contact.

“Wow.” Weiss stood frozen, as the severity of changes one swap made sunk in. “Appearances are even more important to my father in this reality. To throw away his own daughter? He’s even worse.” Weiss shivered for a moment. “However, now I don’t have to focus on impressing him anymore. It’s not like he’s going to cut my allowance or pull me out of Beacon. He doesn’t care what I do as long as I don’t bring shame to the family.” Something occurred to her and she pulled out an ID card. It indicated her name and race.

“Really? He even went so far as to have my last name changed?”
133133213.title: Butterfly Effect

choices: Ruby
Blake
Yang
1331332132.content:
As daunting as it was to go through such a drastic change, Weiss decided to leave reality the way it was for now. She may have lost her family's money and influence, but it would give her first-hand insight into the discrimination the faunus faced. Plus, as part of the unintended side effects of the swap, she'd ultimately escaped her father, in a sense. That could be considered an upside all on its own, one she might want to explore further once she was done with this little experiment.

For the time being, Weiss slipped the remote into her pocket for later use, and considered her next course of action. The obvious thing to do would be to go out and see how people would treat her differently after this swap. People like Cardin were sure to try and talk down to her, but for now, she was more interested in those she already had a good relationship in the first place; her teammates. Her relationship with the rest of her team had already been somewhat strained by the White Fang incident, and though the situation had mostly been smoothed over by now, she was interested in seeing how things were now that the shoe was on the other foot.

Of course, if she wanted to go speak with her team, she'd need to find them first. Yang would be the easiest to find, since she had a good idea of where she'd be; the gym. She wasn't exactly the closest with Yang in the first place, but at the very least, cat puns would likely have made their way into Yang's repertoire. Aside from that, she couldn't really predict how Yang's perception of her would change.

Ruby also wouldn't be too difficult to find. From what she could tell from her window, Ruby had headed into Vale alongside Jaune, and Vale wasn't so large that it would be impossible to find them. While she doubted Ruby would treat her too differently, considering how little of a reaction she'd given to discovering Blake was a faunus, Jaune was another story. He'd attempted to woo her from the first day they met. Would he still treat her the same way now that she was a faunus, and didn't have her family's influence? Perhaps he'd be trying even harder now, since they were likely both victim's of Cardin's bullying to same degree now. That was certainly something worth exploring.

Finally, there was Blake. She'd only just spotted Blake outside her window to make the swap, but she had no idea where Blake was headed, so it might take a while to find her. Perhaps the library would be a good place to start? Blake was a very important person in the whole affair, though. It was rather easy to forget with how deeply Weiss' life had been affected, but Blake had been changed by the swap too; while Weiss had become a faunus, Blake had become human. Since at least one of her parents had obviously been a faunus before, did that mean her parents had changed too? And what about the White Fang incident? Surely Blake hadn't been a member of the Fang now that she was human, right? Did that entire falling out even happen in this reality? There was a lot to think about, and Weiss made a mental not to be very careful with how she used the remote in the future, considering how deeply the changes could affect reality.

Though there was certainly more she could do in the privacy of her own room, considering she still had her scroll on her, Weiss decided there was no time like the present to dive deeper into this reality. And so, her new cat ears twitching a little in anticipation, she left her room, and went off in search off...
1331332132.title: Re-meeting the Team

Go mess with her friends
Just go out and swap randomly
1332.content:
Weiss continued to marvel at her reflection for a moment, one arm resting beneath Yang's breasts, gently lifting them a little, while the other continued to firmly grip the remote. She had been more or less speechless since the swap had happened, partially because the remote had actually accomplished the impossible, and partially because of how surreal it felt to have her body altered in this way. Her mind could scarcely believe that she actually had Yang's large breasts hanging from her chest, and yet, the evidence was right in front of her.

She let out a small giggle, her awed expression finally breaking into a smile. "This is amazing," she mumbled to herself. The logical, analytical side of her brain, the side most often in charge, wanted to test the functions of the remote out slowly and methodically, recording all her findings. There was no way she'd ever figure out how it actually worked, as far as she was concerned it was magic, but once she had gotten a grip on the limitations of the remote, and how certain swaps interacted with each other, she could start to come up with more practical uses for the remote.

However, watching her new reflection, a gently smiling Weiss with an inflated rack, something else seemed to be awakening in her. Yang's words seemed to ring in her mind. "I should have fun once in a while, should I?" Weiss asked, rhetorically. She looked down at the remote, still held within her hand. "You know what, I think I'll do just that." Sure, she could methodically test the remote, but life had just handed her a magical device capable of altering reality, and she was the only one who would know that anything had been changed. Why not have a bit of fun with it? It's not like her first swap had been very methodical anyway, she was just sick of Yang poking fun at her breasts and wanted to do something about it. The world was her oyster now, and for once, she was actually going to enjoy it.

First things first, though, she needed to get changed. Her bra may have adjusted to fit Yang's, or rather HER new bust, but a strapless bra like that just wasn't built to support breasts of this size. For a moment, Weiss debating using this opportunity to examine her new assets a little better, but decided against it. Right now, she was more excited by the remote. Quickly heading over to her dresser, she fished out a different bra, grinning a bit as she saw how the cup size had changed, and began to strip. Blazer and shirt were placed on her bed, while the bra was put into her laundry hamper, eliciting a gasp as she felt her breasts bounce a bit when she removed it. She couldn't remember the last time they'd done that before the swap.

As she began to get redressed, lingering a bit to admire her new assets, Weiss began to let her mind wander between different things she could do with the remote. Her first thought was just to continue what she'd started with her first swap. Weiss had always been a little self-conscious about her small bust size, and now she had the breasts of one of the bustiest girls she knew. Why stop there? Her new breasts looked a little out of place on her small frame, but she could fix that. She could borrow someone's height, for instance. Or perhaps she could enhance her downstairs curves to match those on top. She may prefer to wear skirts, but that didn't mean she couldn't still have "a chiselled booty men would die for", as Yang had put it.

Of course, while Weiss was happy with her new breasts, that didn't mean she had to go overboard redesigning herself. There were plenty of other things the remote could be used for. For example, she could mess with her team some more. She'd already taken Yang's breasts, and for the time being she wasn't in the mood to give them back, but there was still more she could do to her. Ruby and Blake were also unswapped, and she was sure there was plenty fun to be had swapping with them as well. If she wanted, she could even swap lives with someone else so she could go up and talk to them without them ever knowing it was her. She could even try swapping them with other people, although to make that work she'd have to use herself as a middle step, since the remote didn't seem to be able to swap between other people, only between the user and a target.

However, as Weiss began to put her blazer back on, almost fully dressed, she began to think that perhaps she was overthinking this. Meticulously planning things out what what the analytical Weiss would do, why should the fun Weiss be coming up with a plan? Maybe she should just go out with the remote and see what targets arise, not caring about who or what she might swap with. The remote could give her experiences she could have never possibly had before, after all. She could be older, younger. She could swap with a faunus, she could swap with a boy. With this remote, she could experience anything, and so long as she didn't lose it, she could undo them at any time if she didn't like them, or if she got bored. Perhaps that was the best way to use a device like this, just keeping it with her and swapping whenever an interesting opportunity presented itself. It didn't seem like a very Weiss-like approach, but perhaps that was why the idea sounded so exciting to her.

Before long, Weiss was fully dressed again, slightly disappointed that her uniform didn't give much of an opportunity to show off her new assets. There'd be plenty of time for that later, though. For now, she snatched up the remote, twirling in her hand a little, and grinned as she thought over what she was going to do with it.

“Above!”

Yang thought, moving away from the expected point of attack, using her off hand to punch towards her target…
Only to be stymied by a round shield.
Her attack blocked, she immediately disengaged, moving back a little, but still staying within the range of the spear…

Which had changed into a short sword.

“Gyah!” she grunted as the sword made contact with her stomach, her hands and the gauntlets on them too far off to be able to block the attack. She felt her semblance charge even more, and she prepared to unleash the fury of her semblance in one punch…

“HALT!” Professor Goodwitch called out. “Pyrrha Nikos wins!”

Yang fumbled a bit, redirecting her already thrown punch into the ground beside Pyrrha, causing the metal floor to crack and crater.

“Dammit!! That punch would have done it! C’mon teach, I can still fight!!” she whined, even as she started to get out of her battle mode.

“Your aura has fallen below 10%, and thus, by the rules of this match, you have lost,” Goodwitch said with a glare to emphasize her words.

Beside Yang, Pyrrha giggled nervously, her eyes on the crater that Yang had just made.

“It was a good match Yang” she said in her perpetually soft tones.

Yang rolled her eyes. “I didn’t even touch you!” she grumbled. Pyrrha gave her an awkward smile, causing Yang to deflate a little.

“I will get you once Pyrrha. One day, I will land a punch on you!”

“Ms. Xiao Long. You need to be more aware of your opponent’s equipment. Ms. Nikos is not the most tricky opponent you will ever come across, and being able to anticipate changes in a weapon is something you need to work on. Ms. Nikos, good match. You may change and return to your seats." Yang sighed once more, and slung an arm around Pyrrha’s shoulder.

“Let’s go! I want to be back before the next match starts!” she said, pulling Pyrrha along.

X---X

Yang opened her locker to see an unfamiliar box in it.

“The Life Swapping Remote?” Yang read of the cover, giving it a dubious look. “Looks like the sort of think that Ruby would play around with….Dammit Ruby, I have told you not to leave your stuff in my locker!” She thought, frowning a little. A piece of paper fell out of the unsealed box.

Yang picked it up, and by chance read the title.

Your Guide to the Swapping Remote

Her eyebrows rose, wondering just what new foolishness her sister had gotten into. Her eyes widened further as she read on to the end of the small manual.

“Really Ruby…” She thought with a sigh.

“Are you done yet?” Pyrrha asked, startling Yang a little.

“Just a minute!” Yang replied, stuffing the manual back into the box. She gave the remote a contemplative look. “The possibilities though….Maybe I can find out just how many books Blake has in her collection. Or a few more embarrassing secrets of Weiss’. Oo, oo, Maybe if Goodwitch has a secret fetish?"

It was still early, meaning that the heat of the day was yet to set in, making Yang pull her brown and sandy yellow duster around her body as she felt the slight chill. Yang’s finger firmly presses the button and a small light on the tip flashed green, an odd feeling washing over Weiss, making her stumble back slightly. Yang aims at Blake, silently lying on her bunk as she ignores the two, and clicks again.

Nothing seems to have happened.

That is until Weiss speaks again. Gone were the posh accent, piercing pitch and annoying tone, now replaced with Blake’s smooth lower voice, one that made Yang smirk slightly as she heard the bossy nature of it, reminding her of a few nights of fun she’d had with the cat on the bed nearby.

“A-Anyway! You shouldn’t play with toys! You and your sister need to both learn to grow up! I like to have faith that she’ll change but you? You’re a lost cause!” Weiss declares as she backs off, Blake’s voice passing through her lips yet she was none-the-wiser than Blake, silently reading her book, yet to speak a word.

“Hey… Blake?” Yang smirked slightly as she across to her lover, her magenta eyes narrowing slightly in anticipation of what was to come next.

“Hmm, yeah?” Blake mumbles, still engrossed in her book, eyes never leaving the page.

“Blaaaaaake!” Yang repeats, this time in a more irritating tone.

“Ugh, Yang… Can’t you wait? Yuri is about to confront Miyamoto…” Blake begins to explain, her voice whiny and higher pitched. This was mostly due to Weiss’ voice but that wasn’t helped by the way Blake was when she was disturbed from her reading.

Yet Yang’s smirk didn’t fade. Instead she slowly raised the remote again, levelling it with Blake’s head and looking over the plethora of buttons available to her. She’d been careful. The remote seemed safe. Now it was her time to play.

She clicked the body button and then spun her arm to aim at Weiss, clicking again and smirking as she watched, in the blink of an eye, the two seemingly swap places. Caught up in the excitement, Yang hit another swap; this time their hair styles, then another; their races.

Finally starting to slow, Yang looks at her newly mixed up friends. Weiss’ body was lying on Blake’s bed, thick hair flowing down her shoulders, bow in place, in the body’s usual snow white colour. A pair of cat ears tricking affectionately as she intently read her book. Yang was starting to doubt if she would even notice all the changes if she was aware of the swaps.

Blake’s body was sitting, an angry pout on her face as she examined the grimm biology textbook, occasionally brushing her black hair’s fringe out of her face. Her body was clad in Weiss’ white and light blue battle-skirt.

With a small nod of approval at her work, Yang finally put down the remote and contemplated what to do next.

14411.content:
Yang hit the Reset Button and everything swapped back to how it was originally.

Deciding to act normal, Yang hopped on her bed above Blake’s and pretended to busy herself on her scroll. In reality, she was thinking about all the cool things she could do with the remote. Sharing it with her partner was her final decision, but she had to wait. Weiss was a kill joy and would ruin a good thing if she showed them both what this remote was capable of. Eventually, Weiss stood up and headed for the door.

“If you see Ruby, tell her I’ll be at the training rooms.”

“Sure thing.” Yang gave a mock salute and Weiss rolled her eyes.

“So childish,” Weiss huffed. “It would be better for you to act your age and quit goofing around with random junk.” She left and Yang had to resist the urge to swap something with her.

“So what’s so special about that remote?” Blake asked from below her. “You wouldn’t give it to Weiss and you didn’t throw it away.”

“Funny you should ask, Blakey.” Yang jumped down off her bed and landed next to Blake. “This amazing device here seems to be able to alter reality as we know it.”

Blake turned her attention back to her book.

“Nooo! I’m serious.”

“Fine,” Blake relented. “Tell me how that remote alters reality.”

“This remote is supposed to swap things between two people.”

“Swap?” Blake raised an eyebrow.

“Pretty much anything and no one notices except the people touching the remote. It even has a Reset Option to fix everything.”

Blake stared at her for a minute.

“Did you hit your head or is this some joke you and Ruby are trying to play on us?”

“No!” Yang protested. “I’m one hundred percent serious.” To prove it, she pulled out the remote, grabbed Blake’s hand, touched them together, and then pressed the Body Swap option.

There was a flash of green light.

“Yang!” Blake yelled and jumped back. She looked down frantically at herself. She was still in her black and white outfit, yet her chest was much larger and she was definitely taller. Her mouth was agape as she stared at herself wearing Yang’s tan jacket, yellow undershirt, and block shorts. “What did you do?!”

“I swapped our bodies.” Yang told her, twirling the remote in her hand and stretching. “Wow, Blake. You’re flexible.”

“Knock that off!” Blake took a couple deep breaths to calm herself. “You wanted to demonstrate this… thing… and you chose bodies as the first swap?”

“Wanted something big to show you its power.” Yang explained.

“Cover yourself up then,” Blake hissed. “If someone sees my ears…”

“They will consider it normal,” Yang insisted. “The remote alters reality.” She grabbed her student ID from her desk. “Look. It still says I’m a human. If you wanted to swap race, that’s another option.”

Blake just stared.
