“So, what do you want to do next?” Pyrrha asked. “We could get some dinner, do more swapping, just hang out.”

“Which options didn’t we try yet?” Jaune asked.

“The Life Swap is the main one,” Pyrrha said. “It puts us into someone’s life and, while we see ourselves as normal, wearing their clothes, everyone else sees us as them.”

“Wow, that sounds like we are possessing them.” Jaune said.

“Well, they are in our lives and we see them as us,” Pyrrha pointed out. “Though they believe they are us too, as they weren’t touching the remote. There’s supposed to be some guides when living their life so you can mimic them. I don’t know what that means. The instructions were rather vague.”

“Anything else?” Jaune asked.

“Personal Info Swap has a lot of options,” Pyrrha said. “We just did weapons, but it can swap any two things between people. As long as it relates to the person and both people have similar things. Even intangible things like jobs, ownership, like weapons, names, relationship, memories, traits, anything really.”

“What if we swapped teams?” Jaune asked.

“Teams?” Pyrrha repeated.

“Like instead of Life Swap where we become them, we just joined their team.”

“Huh, not sure.” Pyrrha admitted. “In theory it should work.”

“Life will be fine too.” Jaune assured her. “I was just thinking out loud. We should try them all.” He looked down. “Though, can we swap bodies back. I just feel comfortable in my own.” Pyrrha smiled, knowing inside her plan was working. He was now self-conscious about how attractive she was.

“Okay, what first?” She asked, after returning them to normal. "Let's choose people together though. Being on different teams might cause problems with Life and Position Swaps."

"Ruby and Yang really don't like this class, not sure why!" Pyrrha mentioned to Jaune quietly.

"Their personalities I guess, Yang's likes action and Ruby has trouble focusing." Jaune mentioned.

"I wonder if helping them in class will do anything?" Pyrrrha asked.

"Well we are them so anything we do, they'll do when we swap back." Jaune mentioned.

"Yeah, and the same thing goes for Ruby and Yang." Pyrrha added, then her eyes widened in horror

"Oh my, I just realized we made an error, we just told them we are in a relationship before we swapped with them." Pyrrha gasped, Jaune did too.

"Um, they are us right now so them making out might be fine." Jaune replied uncertain.

"Are you sure?" Pyrrha asked.

"Well, yeah, it'd be weird to us but they are effectively us, but we can check up on them, we don't flaunt our relationship and be affectionate in public after all." Jaune reminded.

"If we can find a way." Pyrrha added.

15122132211222211111121222.content:
Pyrrha tried to take notes like she always did in Oobleck’s class.

Her mind kept drifting away, getting distracted, and causing her to miss things Oobleck was saying. It didn’t help that he talked at 1000 words a minute. Pyrrha tried and her notes were okay, just not nearly as good as her own. Out of the corner of her eye she saw Ruby and Jaune living in their lives. Ruby had Pyrrha’s long red hair and Yang had Jaune’s short red hair. Ruby’s outfit didn’t look different, except she didn’t have her normal cloak. Pyrrha was wearing Jaune’s male uniform.

Ruby was, surprisingly, taking notes dutifully like Pyrrha always did. Yang was sort of taking notes, but Yang and then quickly looked frantic as she tried to catch up. Pyrrha couldn’t helping giggling softly know that’s exactly what Jaune would do. Glancing over, she saw he was doing something similar. Yang wasn’t a great note taker either. Port’s class was a little easier, as everyone just slept, doodled, or read.

At last, the bell rang and Pyrrha left with Jaune, Weiss, and Blake.

“I’m not going to let you copy my notes.” Weiss told Jaune.

“Hey! I tried.” Jaune protested.

“I can account Yang did try, even if her handwriting might not be legible.” Blake said.

“Traitor!” Jaune gasped, putting a hand over his chest. “You’re supposed to be on my side!”

“Hmmmm.” Blake faked hummed in thought. “I suppose I can lend you my notes, if you clean the bathroom my next three turns.”

“You… fiend!” Jaune gasped, while Weiss and Pyrrha laughed.

“Come on, everyone.’ Pyrrha said cheerfully, letting Ruby’s life guide her. “We have a free period and then have to sit through Port’s lecture this afternoon. Let’s blow off some steam with a quick training session? The Vytal Tournament is just around the corner.”

“Ruby is right,” Weiss said. “We should take every opportunity we can.”

“I suppose.” Blake said. “There’s something I want to try and need Yang’s help with.”

“Huh? Sure.” Jaune shrugged. “Meet up in 15 minutes?” She nodded and walked off.

“Same, Ruby.” Weiss said to Pyrrha. ‘I have to run a quick errand.”

“What now?” Pyrrha asked. “Looks like they are going to split up. I don’t know if we can use their weapons.”

“Well, we can swap back,” Jaune said and then he pointed. “Looks like Ruby and Yang are going off somewhere in our bodies, we can check on them first.” He shrugged. “We could hop into other people and let them deal with the training?”

Pyrrha and Jaune figured Glynda had a point and decided not to swap during class. This led to Pyrrha fighting a couple students at once and Jaune facing off against Cardin. She won of course, but Jaune lost, though he was getting better. Still, the constant string of losses was getting to him.

“Cheer up, Jaune.” Pyrrha said. “When you first faced him, his Aura was near full, now you can get him to almost 50%. You are improving.”

“Yeah, but I just want to beat him once.” Jaune moaned. “Your training is helping a lot, but I just wish I was improving faster.”

“You can’t skip steps in making a house and expect it to stand against the forces of nature,” Pyrrha told him. When he looked at her, she shrugged. “It was my old trainer’s favorite saying. He meant you need a strong foundation for a strong body. If your body isn’t trained thoroughly, you will just end up hurting yourself. It’s why we keep practicing the basics. Your body needs to get used to it before we can move on to complicated moves. My fighting style took years to learn and even now, I’m still tweaking it.”

“I know you’re right, but I’m just frustrated.” Jaune assured her.

“Well… we have a couple hour free time for lunch and then a break before Port’s class.” Pyrrha reminded him. “We could do something with the remote.”

“Mmm, that might be fun.” Pyrrha saw his eyes light up. “Did you have something in mind?”

“Well, there’s still a lot of Personal Info swaps we haven’t done,” Pyrrha suggested. “Then there is combination swaps. We could do a Life and Body. It would be like Life, but we would have their body too. If we choose someone with good combat skills, you might learn some new tricks.”

“That sounds handy.” Jaune agreed.

“Of course, if you want to try something else, I’m all ears.” Pyrrha added quickly. The point was to make him feel better. “I’m just interested in trying out the remote more.”

Pyrrha knew he was a guy and was attracted to a girls’ body. The thing was, she knew Jaune wouldn’t fall for another girl while dating her. He was much to caring to do that. He might feel his body up, but Pyrrha could easy ignore that. It would make him more comfortable around women’s body when they finally… got around to those kind of activities. “I believe so.” Pyrrha agreed.

Right now, Pyrrha and Jaune were just having fun playing with Adrian.

Turns out Adrian was really smart. He could mimic a lot of things he saw and even began to recognize colors and numbers. He was also really expressive. Pyrrha found it really easy to know what he was thinking and adjust what she did to make him happy. That might have been the Terra instincts too. She also got to enjoy herself watching Jaune.

Like Adrian, he was expressive. It was obvious he wasn’t bored or tired of playing with his nephew. Not only that, he was always one step ahead of everything. When Adrian was thirsty, he already had the bottle, when he soiled his diaper, Jaune was on it already to change. Pyrrha didn’t have to do anything. Hours passed and they forgot they were just suing this to skip class. Jaune started making dinner while Pyrrha sat on the couch and watched Adrian watch a TV show while playing with a spaceship.

Would this be what marriage life is like with him?

Pyrrha flushed as she thought about what her future would be with him. Sure, they both would be Huntsmen and fighting Grimm, but eventually they could settle down. One of them could go and do missions, while the other watched kids. Though, that meant there was always risk involved and there may be a time when one of them doesn’t return.

She vowed to train Jaune even harder than ever until he was better than she was.

Pyrrha suddenly felt bad at thinking about unpleasant thoughts. Instead, she turned back to watch her adorable ‘son’ play. The only downside was Jaune did spend a little more time with Adrian than her.

1512213221122221111112122222213233121121.content:
After they took turns playing with Adrian, Jaune more so than her, he went to make dinner as Pyrrha went to watch Adrian, as he was making dinner.

"We make a good couple don't we?" Pyrrha cooed t him, Adrian giggled at that as she tickled him a bit. Giggling herself at how cute he is. She continuing playing with him for a while until she heard Jaune's voice.

"Dinner's ready." He called out, Pyrrha smiled at this, picked Adrian up and went to eat. Adrian was on his high chair while the two of them were eating, Pyrrha and Jaune took turns feeding Adrian.

"Jaune, do you see this being us one day?" She asked.

"Well, it's possible." He replied with a blush, she smiled at that.

"I do too." She mentioned, "I still can't believe I ditched class, but it's so exciting."

"It's the thrill of doing something you know is wrong, don't get too attached or you'll be lost to it." Jaune warned.

"Sounds like you had experience." Pyrrha noted.

"I forged my way in Beacon remember and well, you know what happened next." Jaune said.

"I already forgive you for it, but you don't need to be embarrassed with me, I'm always here to help." Pyrrha told him.

"Yeah, thanks Pyrrha." Jaune thanked. After they ate Adrian was tired.

"Looks like he's sleepy." Pyrrha giggled, "let's put him to bed." She said. Jaune nodded and the two of them put him to bed, and after a lullaby he slept soundly. Jaune looked at Pyrrha.

"So what now?" He asked. Looking at their lives the two of them spent time together in bed all night, they blushed at that.

"Oh." Pyrrha blushed.

"We don't have to do it, we can swap back." Jaune told her.

"I don't mind." Pyrrha said with a blush, "but if you think it's too soon."

1512213221122221111112122222213233121121.content:
“We’re adults…” Pyrrha muttered. “…and who knows how long it will be before we get a chance?”

“Velvet and Coco have been doing it for who knows how long…” Jaune added. Both of them were refusing to look at each other in the eye.

“They seemed happy.” Pyrrha agreed. “Though, doing it now would mean that we are doing it in Saph and Terra’s lives.”

“Yeah…” Jaune blinked. “Oh, god. I just saw a flash of them doing it” He covered his eyes. “I can’t un-see my sister nude!”

“Jaune, quick, look!”

Jaune looked and froze.

Pyrrha had pulled down her dress to reveal a black bra barely covering her breasts.

“…glug?” Jaune muttered.

“Oh my god.” Pyrrha covered up. “I think that was Terra’s way to tell you she was in the mood.”

“Maybe we aren’t ready,” Jaune said, sitting down next to her.

“Yeah,” Pyrrha muttered. “Neither of us have experience.”

“Though, I still think you’re beautiful and that I don’t not want to do it.” Jaune said.

“Keep this up and you might earn a reward.” Pyrrha whispered.

The two them leaned forward and kissed passionately, their tongues wrapping together. Their hands pulled each other close and Pyrrha fell back on the couch as Jaune laid over her. They finally broke free and cuddled closely to each other, neither wanting to break contact.

“Jaune,” Pyrrha said.

“Hmm?” Jaune asked.

“I… think I am ready for our… first time.” Pyrrha admitted.

Jaune’s eyes widened.

“But I want to do it in our own bodies and own lives first,” Pyrrha said. “Maybe after our date Friday, we could… not go back to Beacon immediately?”

“I… would like that.” Jaune said. “But only if your comfortable with it.”

“I’ve… never been happier with anyone else than I’ve been with you.” Pyrrha told him.

They kissed again, lost in their own world.

They cuddled together and enjoyed the scenery together never wanting this to end, alas all things must come to an end and this was one of them.

"I think we should head back." Pyrrha muttered.

"I think so too, it's great having a family but I'd like to have my own." Jaune nodded.

"I feel the same way." Pyrrha smiled as the two of them kissed, eventually they had to swap back. Holding the remote the hit the reset button and found themselves in the dorm room with Nora and Ren.

"Hey guys, let's go play video games with Ruby and Yang!" Nora said.

"We should train some more." Ren added.

"Guys we don't have to spend all our time training." Pyrrha mentioned, Nora and Ren looked at her, Nora felt her forehead.

"No she's not sick." Nora muttered, "who are you impostor?!"

"Cut it out Nora, being with Jaune taught me we can't always ignore fun, otherwise we lose out on so much." Pyrrha mentioned, "still Ren is right we do need to prepare for the festival."

"I like both ideas, but I'm sure we can think of something for us to do." Jaune mentioned.

"We follow your lead El Capitan." Nora saluted.

"I'm not coming if you play games." Ren mentioned.

"I will, I don't mind." Pyrrha mentioned.

“That’s why you’re the leader!” Nora said with a salute.

Little did they know someone saw them and snapped a picture with their scroll.

The next morning Pyrrha was talking to her manager on the scroll with Jaune near by.

"What do you mean a picture of Jaune and I kissing went viral, how?!" She demanded.

"I'm just telling you this Jaune kid and you kissing went over the net fast, it's everywhere." He said.

"Gah!" She yelled hanging up on him, "I can't believe this!"

"Some people have no privacy." Jaune muttered, she calmed down and faked a smiled.

"I guess you heard, yeah someone caught us kissing and now all of Beacon maybe all of Remnant knows." Pyrrha groaned, "who would do this?"

"Cardin!" He growled.

"Wouldn't surprise me, Cinder might do something like this too." Pyrrha mentioned. An annoucnement was made about this as they all went out with an angry Glynda and a disappointed Ozpin.

"SILENCE!" Glynda shouted as they all went silent, she showed the picture, "never in my years have I witnessed a vile act of breach in privacy, I want whoever took this picture to step forward, NOW!" She demanded.

"You should be ashamed of yourself, trying to ruin someone's life for personal gain." Ozpin added.

"Well, who did this?!" She demanded, Pyrrha and Jaune went to them.

"Pyrrha, Jaune, I want to say I'm deeply sorry about this and I will get to the bottom of this, you have my word." Ozpin told them.

"Thanks." Jaune thanked.

"Though for the future, avoid public affection at all costs." Glynda added.

"I didn't think one kiss would be a big deal." Jaune mentioned.

"It is when it's me." Pyrrha grumbled.

"Last warning, come forward or I'll punish all of you!" Glynda warned.

1512213221122221111112122222213233121121.content:
“Sorry,” Pyrrha apologized, as the two of them left Ozpin’s office.

“For what?” Jaune asked.

“I should have warned you before we went out that my… celebrity status might cause some problems,” Pyrrha explained. “Anything I do is heavy scrutinized. It’s one of the reasons I liked going to movies, cause it’s dark and I can hide.”

“Oh.” Jaune looked at the ceiling. “I did hear you were famous, but I didn’t realize how so. You were always just, Pyrrha. The girl on a cereal box.”

Pyrrha couldn’t help but giggle.

“It’s one of the reasons I fell for you,” Pyrrha admitted. “You saw me for… me. Not my fame, not my status, but just me, faults and all.”

“Like your horrible gaming skills? Ow!” Jaune rubbed his shoulder where Pyrrha hit him. “I deserved that.” He didn’t regret it, because she looked a little more cheerful.

“I guess I overlooked that someone in Beacon might have taken a picture and send it to a newspaper for some money,” Pyrrha continued. “My manager is in an uproar and trying to do damage control. He’s probably going to try to get me to break up with you.”

Jaune opened his mouth.

“Which I’m not!” Pyrrha stated firmly. “I don’t care. You make me happier than I can ever remember being. Even winning tournaments. I’m not going to let someone I don’t know break up the best thing that happened to me.”

“That wasn’t what I was going to suggest.” Jaune said, patting her shoulder. “But I do look forward to seeing you compete sometime. See what the fuss is all about. I’ll let you do the final fight in the Vytal Tournament too. Just cause I’m nice. I’ll even convince Nora.”

Pyrrha gave a weak chuckle.

“If we get that far.” She reminded him.

“Nora will break my legs if we don’t.”

“So we must, for your legs sake.”

They both laughed.

“Thanks for cheering me up.” Pyrrha said and hugged Jaune quickly, before letting him go. They had to avoid some public display of affections. Her scroll beeped and she answered it. “Nora? What is it?”

“Glynda has all the students not on a mission in the auditorium trying to figure out who breached your privacy,” Nora explained. “Only Ren and I are above suspicion. Nearly everyone thinks Cardin did it. I do too.”

“Do you have any proof?” Jaune asked.

“Nope, but he’s a jerk and obviously did it.” Nora glared off to her side. “His team said they were all in their room hanging out when the picture was taken, but we know they are liars.”

“We… can’t just say it’s him.” Jaune said with a sigh. “I think it’s him too, but I’m not going to blame him for something unless we have proof. Nora, I know this is asking a lot, but can you and Ren try to let others know that. It’s only going to make him act out more if people blame him for something he didn’t do.”

“I… but… Fine!” She crossed her arms. “But only because it’s you, Fearless Leader.” She hung up and Pyrrha put the phone away.

“That was nice of you.” She said.

“If he didn’t do it and we punish him, then the person who did it can keep doing it.” Jaune explained. “We need to know for sure who did it.”

1512213221122221111112122222213233121121.content:
Suddenly Pyrrhas scroll was ringing and the picture of her mom was on screen.

"Great, like this day can't get any worse." Pyrrha groaned and picked the phone up.

"Hi mom!" She greeted.

"Pyrrha deal what's this about you kissing a boy?" She asked.

"It's true, this is my boyfriend Jaune!" Pyrrha replied, Jaune waving at her.

"That's him, Pyrrha honey I told you to be careful about what you do in public." Her mom said.

"Sorry, I didn't think kissing her would be this problematic." Jaune apologized.

"Nonsense, I'm happy for my Pyrrha, those vultures need to shove it." Her mom said.

"Mom!" Pyrrha blushed.

"It's true sweetie, I wish you told me about him earlier." Her mom said.

"Sorry you're right, but I'm dating him and not breaking up with him." Pyrrha mentioned.

"Didn't think you would, I'd be a terrible mother if I told you what to do, now let's discuss grandkids." Her mom gushed.

"Got to go mom bye!" Pyrrha stammered as she hung up.

"Well that went well." Jaune noted.

"Mom is thankfully supportive, but I knew she embarrass me about it too." Pyrrha groaned.

"She's just trying to help." Jaune noted.

"I know but still." Pyrrha mentioned.

"Let's just focus on our situation, what do we do?" Jaune asked.

"We could use the remote." Pyrrha whispered.

"Would that be right?" He asked.

"I want to know if it is Cardin and we have the perfect means, infiltrate his dorm as his lackeys and look for the evidence, better yet swap to him himself and check if he did it and if he did have him turn himself in!"

"The second option will raise too many questions, but you have the right mind set." Jaune noted.

"I won't let this continue Jaune, he needs to be brought to justice." Pyrrha growled.

"If it's him, what if it isn't?" He asked.

"I'll be very surprised if it's not, who else would do this to us?" She asked.

"I don't know, we can rule out Nora and Ren." Jaune mentioned, "Also Yang and Ruby since we played video games with them."

"Yeah I know, what a mess." Pyrrha sighed.

"This person will pay, I promise you." Jaune assured.

"Thanks, maybe we should just wait?" Pyrrha wondered.

"That's the better option but it's up to you, keep in mind while we can use the remote to help us, it doesn't mean we should." Jaune told her.

"Would you think less of me if I want to use it?" Pyrrha asked.

"Of course not, but I want you to be mindful of the consequences." Jaune told her, Pyrrha giggled.

"You're giving me advice, you came a long way Jaune." Pyrrha praised with him blushing.

1512213221122221111112122222213233121121.content:
Pyrrha’s scroll rang again.

“Who is it… dad?” Pyrrha looked at it and finally answered. “Hi, dad.”

“Hey, Pyrrha.” A gruff voice said, Jaune had frozen.

“You heard huh?” Pyrrha asked sheepishly.

“You’re mom found out pretty quick,” he admitted. “I wanted to warn you she’s packing and preparing a trip to Vale as we speak.”

“W-what?!” Pyrrha stammered. “She doesn’t need to do that.”

“We both know once she makes up her mind she’s going to do something,” her dad said.

“Are… you coming too?” Pyrrha asked.

“No, I have some high priority duties to handle in Mistral this week, but I’m not worried about you.” He smiled. “You have a good head on your shoulders and if you like that boy, he’s probably a fine kid. Your mom just wants to meet him personally and hasn’t had any vacations recently. Your manager is trying to smooth everything over, but I understand you’re a teenage girl. You’re not a machine. I’m not going to tell you to break things up with that boy.”

“I wasn’t planning to.” Pyrrha replied and he smiled.

“The shock will blow over soon enough,” her dad told him. “But you should make sure he knows what’s going to happen. The media will start taking pictures of him constantly and I doubt he will get a moment to himself out in public.”

“I was telling him about that.”

“Good. Well, I’m going to make sure your mom doesn’t take all your baby photos, bye.”

Pyrrha hang up, red faced.

“Sooo…” She said slowly. “Want to meet my mom?”

“Guess I kind of half too since everything is out in the open,” Jaune said. “I just found out my sister’s saw everything too. Scroll’s on silent, but it’s been blowing up.” He raised an eyebrow. “One of my younger sisters is a fan of yours it seems.” He face palmed. “She told me to bring you back for an autograph.”

Pyrrha giggled.

“I can send her one if you like.” Pyrrha told him.

“I don’t want them to think just because we’re dating they can trouble you.” Jaune said.

“I don’t mind if it’s your sister,” Pyrrha assured him. “It will make her happy.”

“Let’s worry about who spread the picture first then we can deal with paparazzi and family,” Jaune said.

“We still have the remote.” Pyrrha pressed.

“If we do the Life Swap on Cardin,” Jaune said. “We can learn if he did it or not. If he did, we can find proof, but if he didn’t, we know someone else did it.” He sighed. “It’s possible someone didn’t mean anything bad by it I suppose and just posted it online.”

“They took a private picture of us.” Pyrrha reiterated.

“Yeah, I didn’t say they were smart.” Jaune said. “So, do you want to try the Life Swap or wait for Beacon’s investigation?”

"Let's life swap him." Pyrrha said suddenly her eyes narrowed.

"Are you sure?" He asked.

"I am, I can't think of anyone it can be other than him, and if by some chance it's not him, we'll know for sure." Pyrrha told him, Jaune nodded at that.

"Alright then, let's do this." Jaune said as they went to find him, like the smug bastard he was he was hanging with his team laughing it up, probably over what they did.

"He has no morals." Pyrrha growled, "that should be proof alone, who enjoys the misery of others?"

"We still need more, let's do the swap." Jaune mentioned.

"I'll do it, it's my life he tried to ruin." Pyrrha said.

"If it's him." Jaune reminded.

"It is, I know it." Pyrrha insisted, Jaune held the remote and with a press of the button she life swapped into him. As Cardin she checked his life to see what he did, and sure enough he was guilty, he took the photo and posted it in an attempt to ruin and humiliate her for what happened at the tree sap incident. The idiot stored it in a USB file which he had in his dorm inside his bed, just too gloat over his accomplishment, truly this man was vile. Before she became sick she undid the swap to let Jaune know.

"Well?" He asked.

"It's him alright, the proof we need is in his dorm inside his bed." Pyrrha growled.

"I had a feeling, I was just hoping even he had some morality." Jaune mentioned, "but now we have a problem."

"How do we go about this?" Pyrrha asked for him.

"Yeah, if we inform Ozpin it'll expose the remote." Jaune mentioned.

"What if we have him turn himself in?" Pyrrha asked.

"That could work, but it could also rouse suspicion." Jaune said.

"So what hope they find the evidence, it might be gone by then." Pyrrha was a bit agitated.

"Calm down, he'll pay for this, we just need to think of the best course of action." Jaune assured, Pyrrha sighed.

"You're right, let's think." She agreed and they thought together.

“Thank you.” Pyrrha muttered and kissed his cheek. “I’m never letting you go.”

“You might need to. Walking to class like this will be awkward.”

Pyrrha broke out laughing and separated from him. They turned down the corridor and headed to class.

“He deserves it for what he did.” Blake assured her. She waved and headed off to prepare.

“So?” Jaune asked. “To class?”

“I can’t wait to see Cardin’s face when he gets caught.” Pyrrha said cheerfully.

“Umm, yeah…” Pyrrha muttered. “It did. Excuse me.” She rushed into their bathroom to avoid awkward questions.

“When did you two get back?” Jaune asked.

“About half an hour ago.” Ren answered.

“You two were soooo cute.” Nora squealed, causing Jaune’s face to redden.

“Thanks for doing this for me.” Jaune said.

“No problem.” Nora replied.

“It was our pleasure.” Ren assured him.

“I just hope it doesn’t get out we… did it.” Jaune muttered. “Pyrrha went through a lot just because of that picture.”

Little did they know, Pyrrha was listening though the door. It made her heart flutter to know that, even after all this, Jaune still truly cared for her.

“We still on for group training today?” Nora asked.

“Of course.” Jaune said. “We have a tournament to win.”

“You’re not just pumped up because of other reasons?” Ren asked with a slight smirk.

“W-wha…” Jaune gasped. “No! Of course not!”

Pyrrha giggled to herself and got ready.

“Random Swaps sounds fun,” Pyrrha agreed. “So one of us makes one and then the other tries to guess?”

“Three guesses,” Jaune said.

“What happens if I guess it right?’ She asked.

“You win.”

“And if it’s wrong?”

“You lose.”

“That’s it?”

“Well, maybe a penalty game for whoever loses the most.” Jaune said shrugging. “We each get three swaps and whoever gets the most wins? Loser has to do a swap the winner decides.”

“Hmm, I guess that sounds okay. We can always swap back and neither of us would do anything bad.”

“Just funny.” Jaune pointed out and Pyrrha laughed.

“So, who goes-…” Pyrrha’s scroll rang. “Hold on, it’s mom again.”

“Hi, dear!” Her mom said. “Just wanted to let you know we are almost in Vale and were hoping you would be free this weekend.”

“W-what?!” Pyrrha choked. “Is dad with you?”

“No, he had to stay in Mistral,” Her mom replied. “We almost got him time off, but an emergency came up.” She smiled. “Soooo, Pyrrha. Are you free?”

“Yes… but-…”

Jaune encouraged her to go meet her mom with his hands.

“I suppose I can.”

“I really want to see how you are doing.” Her mom said. “it’s been lonely without you.”

“I… want to see you too, mom.” Pyrrha agreed. “I can be down in Vale shortly.”

“I love you, dear.”

“Love you too, mom.” Pyrrha hung up and looked at Jaune. “Looks like I’m going to be busy.”

“Hey…” Jaune put his hand on her shoulder. “Your mom is family and lives far away. We can play with the remote any time. You go and spend time with her.”

“I kind of want to introduce you to her,” Pyrrha admitted. “But we are supposed to avoid attention in Vale.”

“I can stay behind,” Jaune assured her. “She can always come here afterwards.”

Pyrrha smiled and hugged him.

"You can stay behind, but how are you going to meet my mom?" She asked. Jaune's eyes widened.

"You mean?" He asked, Pyrrha smiled and nodded at his question, happy to inform him of what she has in mind.

"Yes, I'm taking you with me." Pyrrha told him with honesty and dedication.

"But what about the public?" He asked her.

"What about them, I don't care what they think, let them say what they want all that matters is I'm happy and I'm with you." Pyrrha assured.

"Pyrrha!" Jaune gushed as they kissed, a sign that she no longer cares what they think.

"I'm done caring, people can say whatever they want, I love you and I'm not afraid to show it, let all of Remnant know this, I LOVE JAUNE!" She shouted the last part.

"We know already!!" A voice shouted back. Pyrrha blushed at that, thinking she might have gotten a bit carried away.

"Oops!" She flustered.

"To Vale." Jaune nodded as they went to Vale. After a long trip the two of them arrived and headed to where her mom will be meeting them. They got stares and glares and she saw people whispering but she didn't care any more, she held him closer and glared at them.

"Yeah I'm dating him, what of it, jealous?!" She told the people gawking at them, they ignored her and carried on she heard murmurers of how far the famous Pyrrha Nikos as fallen.

"Ignore them, they're idiots." Jaune told her holding her hand.

"I am, they no longer concern me, I'm happy now and that's all that matters." Pyrrha assured, she then received a call from her manager.

"I heard you're in Vale, with your boyfriend, damn it how am I suppose to play damage control with you doing this to me?" He asked.

"You're not, I'm with Jaune and I'm not leaving him, if you have a problem with that then find another huntress to sink your teeth into." She informed him.

"Pyrrha, don't do this to me." He begged.

"I'm doing anything this is your choice, let me be happy or I'm done with you." Pyrrha said to him.

"You're making a mistake." He groaned.

"I don't care if I am I'm not giving up what I have, now you have your option, I'm going to hang up now, call me back within a week then all is good, don't then this is goodbye." Pyrrha said as she hung up.

"Wow Pyrrha." Jaune said, "I'm glad you're doing this for me."

"I'll do anything for you Jaune, I love you and I don't care if Remnant knows that, if I lose my fame and popularity for this then so be it." Pyrrha told him.

"Thanks Pyrrha." Jaune smiled as they waited for her mother to arrive.

1512213221122221111112122222213233121121.content:
They only had to endure about twenty minutes of stares as they waited at the docks for Pyrrha’s mother to arrive. The biggest issue Pyrrha had to deal with was ducking to the restrooms and coming back to see a couple girls talking to Jaune. They recognized him from the picture and knew he was with Pyrrha. Two of them wanted his phone number and one wanted him to get Pyrrha’s autograph. Pyrrha was curious as to what Jaune would do and hid. To her immense pleasure, he told off the girls who wanted his number that he was in a commit relationship and then told the girl she should ask Pyrrha directly, but not to impose if she’s busy.

Pyrrha decided to show up a little after that and sign the girls book.

“You made her day.” Jaune told her.

“I’m happy to sign things for them,” Pyrrha assured him. “As long as they don’t crowd me in the middle of the street or restaurant.”

A few minutes later, a woman approached them. Pyrrha knew her and rushed forward. They embraced each other and Jaune hung back a little. The woman had bright red hair like Pyrrha’s but much shorter and bright green eyes. The woman did wear glasses and looked to be only a few years older than Pyrrha.
https://images.app.goo.gl/PpFK7wZXAXG1Jk...

They finally approached them and Jaune waved.

“Did you sister come too?” Jaune asked.

Pyrrha and the woman stared at him.

“I like him.” The woman said and Pyrrha’s face flushed crimson.

“Jaune…” Pyrrha said slowly. “This is my mom. Mom, this is Jaune Arc, my boyfriend.”

Jaune realized what he did.

“I’m sorry, Mrs. Nikos.” Jaune apologized. “I didn’t mean… you’re so young and look exactly like Pyrrha… and I’m just going to stop talking.”

Pyrrha’s mom laughed.

“I see why Pyrrha likes you already.” She said. She stepped forward and shook his hand. “It’s nice to meet you, Jaune.”

“Nice to meet you too.” Jaune replied.

“It’s been a long flight and I need to stretch my legs a bit,” Pyrrha’s mom said. “How about you two show me around Vale a bit and I’ll treat you both to lunch.”

“You don’t have to, Mom.” Pyrrha said.

“Nonsense, there’s no way I’m going to miss the opportunity to treat my daughter and her boyfriend.”

“I’ll be happy to show you around,” Jaune offered.

“Thank you.” She smiled at Jaune. “I can’t wait to hear how you two met and got together.” When Jaune turned around, Pyrrha’s mom whispered into Pyrrha’s ear. “You always did like blondes.”

Pyrrha’s face was burning.

"She had to make the first move, I was admittingly dense at her advances." Jaune flushed at that.

"Just like my husband, dense as a brick until I had to spell it out for him, most men are apparently." Her mom said. Pyrrha was groaning a bit wanting this to end soon.

"Er, yeah." Jaune flushed himself unsure of what to say.

"Plans for kids?" She asked.

"MOM!!" Pyrrha said in an embarrassed tone, Jaune was flustered himself.

It was a good thing Jaune dressed up nicer than he usually did to impress her mom, or he would have been out of place. The food was great and even though Jaune would have been fine with simple dishes, he enjoyed himself. Pyrrha liked the food and was happy Jaune and her mother got along.

If it only wasn’t so embarrassing.

“How are your grades in school?” Her mom asked Jaune after Pyrrha.

“I’m doing fine in strategy and history,” Jaune said. “But I’m a little on the low end of our combat class. There’s a lot of amazing fighters in our year.”

“Yang has thrown me off guard several times.” Pyrrha agreed.

“It looks like you settling in,” Pyrrha’s mom said, eyeing his arms and shoulders. “Keep up the hard work and you’ll catch up. Pyrrha didn’t become a champion sitting around all day.” Pyrrha blushed. “The first time she threw a weapon, she tripped and hit her head against a rack.

“Mom!” Pyrrha gasped horrified, while Jaune laughed.

“Well, I need to freshen up.” She said, standing up. “You two behave yourselves while I’m gone.”

“Oh my god.” Pyrrha moaned, putting her face in her hands.

“Do you think she had pictures…owe!”

Pyrrha punched him in the arm.

“Sorry, but it is nice to hear those kinds of stories,” Jaune assured her. “It makes you seem like the rest of us. When you eventually meet my parents, you will need to get comfortable for the embarrassing stories about me.”

Pyrrha involuntary giggled.

“It’s just hard because my mom means well and I can’t really say it’s wrong.” Pyrrha sighed.

“Why not make it funny?” Jaune asked.

“Funny?” Pyrrha asked.

“What if we use the remote?” Jaune asked quietly. “I can Body Swap with your mom and it will be like I’m saying it. I bet you won’t be able to stop laughing.” Pyrrha chuckled at the though of seeing Jaune in her mom’s clothing telling her mom in Jaune’s clothing about Pyrrha. “Or a Life Swap,” Jaune said. “I can try to steer the conversations away from the embarrassing stories… though I might see a few in memories.”

“I wouldn’t mind you seeing them, just don’t tell me you know.” Pyrrha muttered. “Though, not sure. It’s been a while since I’ve seen my mom. She’s going to be here a few days. So I might spend the day with her tomorrow.”

“Up to you.” Jaune said. “Shoot, you can even do a swap if you want. Just have some fun and don’t let your mom get you down. Moms are supposed to embarrass us.”

Pyrrha chuckled again.

“One roller coaster,” Jaune said. “Space is limited.” He looked at his watch. “I really should be heading back too. One of our team mates can be a little… overzealous if you leave her alone for too long.”

“I believe you mentioned her,” Pyrrha’s mom recalled. “Nora, right?”

There was also a wardrobe swap, maybe even body part swap, plenty of fun to have there, he might stay away from life swap though at least for now, save that for later or when Pyrrha comes back, then again a life swap won't hurt if he's careful.

One swap later, he now had Weiss’ impressive glyph Semblance. Jaune felt his chest and squeezed Blake’s boob before catching himself. This wasn’t the place to do it. He left and began to wander the halls of Beacon.

Maybe he could take clothes and weapon from the last two? That might be fun. There were other choices though. Whatever he chose, he needed new clothes. Same reason why he won't do a perceived gender swap, he'd be seeing other naked girls that aren't Pyrrha, and granted he'll so see Blake's body nude that's only because of the deal. Once again Pyrrha needed to give him the okay for it.

This left Position Swap, his safest option since he'll still be a guy and dating Pyrrha, so if he wanted to hang out with say team NDGO, he can and they won't do anything to him, yes that can work perfectly. But did he want to swap with team NDGO, he did them already before with Pyrrha, maybe another team will suffice? He can do team CMEN, or team FNKI, or team ABRN he hasn't tried those teams yet, he can swap with one of them.

Jaune thought about it for a while, there were a lot of good options to choose from and he supposed it didn't really matter which team he picked as long as he picked it. Walking towards his destination he was eager to do his swap idea, his finger ready to make the swap happen with his choice of team, wanting to spend time with them and see what they do for fun.

Jaune sighed a bit as he got to position of his choice team ready to press the swap button on one of their members and see what their team life is like, he hoped it was good and nothing boring, that would suck big time.

1512213221122221111112122222213233121121.content:
Jaune figured Team NDGO would suffice, as he knew them a little.

The question was how to find them. He didn’t know their schedule and he began to scour the school for them. They weren’t in the cafeteria, or the library, or the training rooms. Jaune thought about asking someone if they saw them, but then he would need a reason why he was looking for them. If they were out killing Grimm or something, Jaune probably wouldn’t find them. Pyrrha said she would be back shortly before curfew, so he had a good part of the day left.

He glanced out the window and finally saw the four girls. They were moving quickly across the grounds. The distance was far, but Jaune figured he could get a good shot. Carefully aiming, he targeted Gwen, the shyer girl in the back and hit the Position Swap option. The world blurred as Jaune found himself out in Beacon’s ground. It took a moment for him to orient himself.

“Ruby, come on!”

Dew grabbed his hand and pulled him after her.

Turns out the four of them were trying to catch a Bullhead. Jaune never bothered to question why they were running.

Where were they going?

"So where are we going?" Jaune finally asked, it would seem weird but he needed to know.

"Come on Ruby don't you remember, never mind we're going to the photo shoot." Nebula explained.

"By we, Neb means us, you're there as our 'protection.'" Dew explained.

"Yeah, they want girl models, sorry Ruby, but we want you around because well, after Cardin did what he did and exposed your relationship with Pyyrha from team PRNG you're way more popular than us." Octavia mentioned.

"Great so I take the brunt of your fans while you photo shoot in peace?" Jaune grumbled.

"We knew you'd understand Ruby!" Octavia smiled. Dew shot her a glare.

"What Octavia MEANT to say, is that the fans are restless and they'll swarm both us and you, we want you to fend them off." Dew told him.

"We're sorry about this Ruby but this photo shoot is important, we'll make it up to you by helping you get stuff on your next date with Pyrrha, what do you say?" Nebula asked.

"I don't know, I don't want to be the forth wheel." Jaune said, knowing anything they give him will be moot after he swaps back.

"Come on there must be something we can do to convince you to help us out, anything!" Octavia pleaded.

"Anything but sex." Dew glared at her for forgetting about that.

"Right anything but that, don't want to piss off Pyrrha after all." Octavia mentioned.

"It's your choice Ruby if you don't want to do it we can go back to Beacon and drop you off." Nebula told him.

"Please!" The girls begged giving him puppy dog eyes to entice him to help, Jaune having a lot of sisters was use to this and was practically immune, still was there anything he can have that he can enjoy before swapping back?

choices: Things go as plan.

The crowd was bigger than any of them expected.
1512213221122221111112122222213233121121.content:
Jaune may be immune to puppy dog eyes, but he felt like he should protect the girls at least. He could deal with some rabid fans. Probably. It was rather interesting that they considered him a guy when he had a female body, clothes, and name. The world still considered him a guy, even if it’s okay for him to have breasts and wear girl clothes.

“Fine.” Jaune said. “What do you need me to do?”

“Not much,” Nebula promised. “We have a photo shoot in a corner of the mall. All we want is for you to stand guard until the door shuts, then lead the fans away to another part of the mall. Hour at the most.”

“And you think most of them will follow me?” Jaune asked.

“Definitely,” Dew said. “As Octavia said, you’re more popular than us now. It’s going to blow over eventually, but for now we can use it to our advantage to finally do a shoot in peace.”

“And we can help you with anything.” Octavia promised.

“Well, I do need some good ideas for dates,” Jaune said.

“We can defiantly help you with that.” Nebula promised. “Here.” She handed Jaune some money. “The dust for your Hard Light Weapon is low, right? Go ahead and buy what you need on me. As a personal thanks.”

“Careful, Neb.” Octavia said smiling. “Someone might think you have a crush on Ruby.”

Dew flicked her in the nose.

“Shouldn’t be too hard.” Jaune muttered, following the girls to the mall.

1512213221122221111112122222213233121121.content:
Jaune was incredibly lucky that the fan base was manageable, there were some rabid fans that wanted to meet team NDGO but that changed when they saw Jaune the guy dated Pyrrha Nikos.

"Ruby how is it dating Pyrrha?" A guy asked.

"Have you did it yet?" Anohther asked.

"Any chance you'll broaden your horizons?" A woman flirted with him, he tuned them all out and Dew comforted him.

"We have to deal with this every day, I wish I can say it gets better but it really doesn't." Dew said.

"Damn, I really hope this goes away soon." Jaune said.

"It will, lucky for you kissing a celebrity gets stale fast and then they'll move on to something else." Nebula told him.

"For sure, a few days max, maybe a week." Octavia added.

"Well wish us luck." Dew said as they went to do the photo shoot with Jaune guarding the door. Once it was closed Jaune lead them else where and dealt with them for a hour, after words he managed to duck them and avoid them to meet up with his 'team.'

"How was it?" Jaune asked.

"Boring, you're lucky you're not a girl." Dew groaned.

"Ugh, pose with this hold that, I can't stand them." Octavia added.

"Then why do you do them?" He asked.

"For charity, all proceeds goes to Shade Academy and those that need it, we get maybe fifty percent of the money." Nebula sighed.

"At any rate we're done now, once we ditch the crowd we can have fun." Dew said.

"Hopefully somewhere quiet." Octavia said.

"Good luck finding it." Nebula groaned, "but we have options, we can hit the arcades with disguises, we can head back to train or if anyone has any better ideas I'm all ears."

"I want to shop." Octavia said.

"Of course you do, but it is an option." Dew admitted

"What about you Ruby, what do you want to do?" Nebula asked.

“I could handle some shopping,” Jaune said. “I didn’t really get anywhere without being mobbed except for Dust.”

“We can go to the arcade afterwards,” Jaune promised.

He noticed they were mostly bright colors, stuff Yang would wear. It made sense, as he had Yang’s wardrobe.

In the private dressing room, he got to explore her body and sensitivity a lot. He found all the places to touch pretty easily so Blake was going to be surprised when she joined them. “Maybe you’re right.” He stepped out in it and Nebula grinned.

152.content:
"Hmm?"

Blake Belladonna, the serious and reserved member of team RWBY, was laying on her bed reading her book like normal. Weiss was at her desk studying for an upcoming test, Yang and Ruby were out causing ruckus as always. Blake leaned forward after feeling an object under her pillow, a small black box with a manual on the outside. She looks around the room trying to figure out how it got there.

She looks closer at the strange box, "A remote?" She closes her book and gives her full attention to the box before taking the manual off opening the box, the manual's title caught her attention.

Your Guild to the Swapping Remote

"You've got to me joking me, this must be Ruby's or Yang's attempt at a joke" She muttered as she took out the remote and continued to read. Her ears started to twitch the more she read. Thinking about how this remote could do anything it claims. She think it over before her curiosity starts to take over. "I mean I have to know if this thing works" She said before slyly pointing at Weiss.

She decided to try a swap that won't effect them both too much. "Body part swap seems like a good idea" she whispers too herself before pressing the button. And in a green flash she looked across the room and let out a quiet gasp. Weiss Schnee, the so called Ice Queen, sat at her desk with Blake's long black hair. Blake couldn't believe it, Weiss had her hair and she had her snow white hair. Blake couldn't resist but run a hand through it to make sure it was real. A small grin forms on her face
152.title: Blake

choices: Keep things as is and go with Weiss.
Undo the swap and go with Weiss.
Decline and find someone different to test the remote on.
1523.content:
Another test couldn’t hurt.

Blake was eager to see what this remote could do. Since she just did a Body Part Swap, a different swap was in order. Nothing big of course, but something that was obvious. She settled on a Clothing Swap. Weiss was the only target in the room, so Blake figured she might as well use her. Aiming the remote, she hit the button. There was a flash of light and Blake saw Weiss sitting at her desk, but wearing a completely different outfit.

Weiss’ white and light blue strapless dress, white bolero, and white heeled boots were replaced by Blake’s black vest, white sleeveless undershirt, shite sorts, block boots and full stockings from black to purple. Blake looked down at herself and saw Weiss’ outside on her body. Wanting to checking something, she got off her bed and went to the closet. On her section of the closet, Blake found all of Weiss’ clothes, though sized to fit her own body. Not only did they swap, but everything adjusted automatically.

Weiss didn’t notice a thing.

Blake could only stare at the remote for a moment before shoving it into her pocket. There was so many things she could do with this and she wasn’t sure how to start.

“Everything okay, Blake?” Weiss asked, turning.

“Umm, yeah, just… looking for something.” Blake lied. “Something seems off and I’m not sure what.”

Weiss looked around.

“Probably Ruby and Yang haven’t made some noise in a while,” Weiss replied. “Actually, that worries me too. We should probably find them.”
1523.title: Another test won't hurt

Blake wants out
15232.content:
"Why don't we just call them?" Blake suggested as she attempted to call Yang with no response. Her attempt to call Ruby just led to her scroll vibrating off her bed

"Great! Why are they so forgetful and immature?" Weiss said. She could only sit at her desk and groan at their incompetence. Weiss started pulling on her black hair and tapping her feet. Blake had seen her annoyed before but it was so different because of her current attire and hair.

Blake quickly pressed the reset button after noticing Weiss was wearing her ribbon. Being a bit unsure of the remote she couldn't risk anything. Besides there will be plenty of people for her to test the remote on. She oddly felt at ease wearing her own clothes again and having her hair back, even though it was only a short stint without them. Blake turned to Weiss, who was finishing up the chapter she was on, happy to see her back in her white dress and with her white hair.

"Ready Weiss?" She said eagerly wanting to go out

"Yes. Let's to find those troublesome teammates of ours" Weiss said standing up from her desk.

Weiss grabbed her scroll and headed for the door with Blake in tow. Blake kept a firm grasp on the remote in her pocket, resisting every urge to take it out and swap with someone. "Alright Blake, calm down" She though to herself. There was no reason for her to ruin a good thing.

Walking the Beacon campus only made things worse. Ideas kept rushing into Blake's head and she had to shake them off by letting go of the remote.

"Where could they be?" Weiss said getting more annoyed with every location they checked

"I'm not sure. Maybe one of us should go back to the room while they other looks, you know just in case they come back" Blake suggested, just trying to get some alone time to do more tests with the remote.

152322.content:
Blake’s Scroll started to ring.

“That her?” Weiss asked.

“Yep.” Blake said, and opened her Scroll.

“Sup, Blake?” Yang said. “You need me? I’m kind of busy.”

“Weiss was looking for you and Ruby.” Blake said.

“Huh, why?” Yang asked.

“No, idea.” Blake said with a smirk and looked at Weiss. “Why are we looking for them again?”

“I always get paranoid when you and Ruby disappear without notice,” Weiss huffed. “Remember last week? When you two and Nora decided to try out some explosives?”

“Goodwitch only gave us a week’s worth of detention.” Yang brushed off.

“What are you doing anyways?” Blake asked.

“Ruby and Jaune went to Vale and I’m seeing if it’s a date or not,” Yang explained. ‘Right now they are at an arcade and it’s pretty tame. Can’t get close without a bunch of nerds gawking at me.”

“That would explain why Ruby didn’t pick up.” Weiss admitted.

“So thaw out a bit and relax, Weiss Queen.” Yang said. “When I get back, Blake, let’s do something. No hiding in the library, got it?”

“Okay.” Blake said and then hung up. “That suit your needs?” She asked Weiss.

“Well… yes.” Weiss nodded. “At least we don’t have to worry about them getting our team in trouble. You know how Professor Goodwitch likes to give our team punishments.” She smiled. “I do hope Ruby and Arc are on a date.”

“Really?” Blake was surprised at this.

“Yes, if he’s dating her, he will leave me alone.” Weiss replied, sounding a little bit evil.

“Oh. Right.” Blake paused. “He means well. It’s not like he likes you for your name.”

“Yeah… and that’s the reason I don’t stab him,” Weiss admitted. “If he wasn’t so… stupidly forward, I might actually be okay in his presence, but he was just getting worse.”

“Like that serenade?” Blake asked with a smirk.

“ARGH, don’t remind me.” She threw her hands into the air. “Thanks for coming along Blake. Sorry for being short. Was just in the middle of some tough homework and was a little frustrated.”

“Yeah.” Blake nodded. “I know what part you’re on. It’s not easy.” The two of them headed back toward the room.

She took the remote out of her pocket and places it besides her. She tried to put the thoughts out of her head and enjoy her book. Constantly taking glances at Weiss and the remote as her scroll goes off.

Hey, going to be there in like an hour Yang texted

"Oh? I guess one swap won't hurt" Blake thought with a smile on her face. She picked up the remote and pointed at Weiss, looking at the other options.

"Definitely not a body swap....maybe personal info?"

She selects the option to swap names and presses the button. A green flash goes off and she doesn't feel any different. She looks herself over, expecting something else to be changed by the swap. She turns to Weiss, who silently studied.

"Hey.......Blake? Do you remember when Yang and Ruby were going to get back?" Blake voice trembled as she spoke.

"Weiss, you're the one that talked to her" Weiss said sounding very annoyed.

"Oh right..Sorry Blake. Didn't mean to bother you" Blake replied before swapping their voices

"No idea, She hasn't told me yet" Blake grabbed her throat. Hearing Weiss' higher pitched voice made her sounded a little annoyed. She quickly shrugged it off and returned to her book, resting the remote on her chest. Blake started to calm down and enjoy her book, listening to Weiss groan softly with her new voice.

15232211.content:
Blake figured another swap wouldn’t matter and quickly undid the Weiss ones.

There was something she was interested in trying. Under the Personal Information Swap was a race option. Blake didn’t hate being a Faunus, but she wanted to know how it worked. She knew it had to work, her earlier experiments proved it. Carefully aiming her remote at Ruby, who plopped down on Weiss’ bed to talk to her partner, Blake hit the button.

There was a flash of light and things seemed to quiet down.

Blake reached up to her head. Her bow was still there, but there were no ears. Instead, Ruby seemed to have grown some new ears herself. They weren’t cat ears though, they were floppy dog ears, matching her hair. Blake couldn’t believe it.

Ruby was a dog Faunus.

“So, Weiss,” Ruby said excitedly. “We should do stuff together. As partners. I just added a cool new attachment on Crescent Rose. Or maybe we could go to Vale. I just got back but I can go again.”

“Slow down.” Weiss huffe,d rubbing her temples. “You always get excited and everything blurs together. Clam down and speak slower…”

“Oh, sorry.” Ruby’s ears dropped. “I just want us to do stuff together.”

“Yang’s stopping by soon,” Blake told Ruby. “She might have something planned. Her text was kind of cryptic.”

“If you want to hang out with us, you can.” Ruby told her. “Knowing Yang, she might want to take you clubbing.”

“…Great.” Blake moaned.

“You can do your homework until Yang returns then,” Weiss told Ruby, smirking.

“Awww!” Ruby whined.

Blake couldn’t help stare at the new Faunus Ruby. Finally shaking herself out of her shock, Blake pulled out her student ID. It said she was a human, but she shouldn’t have been surprise. She had been pretending to be a human before the swap. Her eyes traveled to Ruby’s desk, where her ID laid. It listed Ruby as a Faunus.

“…so Cardin tried to pick on me.” Ruby told Weiss.

“Did you smack him around?” Weiss asked.

“Yep!” Ruby said proudly. “He won’t pull my ear again.”

Blake felt bad and quickly undid the swap. Ruby didn’t deserve being a Faunus and being mistreated. She was one of the nicest girls Blake had ever met. The swap was only meant to be a test anyways. Laying back down, she looked at her book as if she was reading, but was really thinking about how to use the remote.

A short while later, Yang finally arrived.

"You know the club isn't my favorite place, right?" Blake giving Yang an annoyed look

"it's called team building Blake, besides we won't have time this weekend" Yang took a quick glance at Weiss with a smirk on her face.

"Because you and your sister want to goof around in class and you want to not take Professor Goodwitch seriously!" Weiss yelled at her

Yang just smirked and turned her attention back to Blake, lowering her book to look at her face. Blake shot Yang an annoyed look and tried to continue her book.

"Yang, I'm okay with dinner but the club? Yang I can't I'm sorry" Blake said with a little sorrow in her voice

"Well it's my turn to pick where we go so better get ready!" Yang said shaking Blake a little bit

"Alright Yang just let me get ready" Blake sighed and got up, accepting she wouldn't be able to get out of this. She walked into the bathroom. She stopped in front of the mirror. She hadn't actually gotten a look at herself since her swap with Pyrrha. She touched her face, feeling her new features: Nose, lips, cheeks. She then turned her attention to her hair, it was a drastic change in volume and color. She turned her attention to the rest of her body, flexing and stretching. Even lifting her shirt to look at her abs

"This is incredible, I knew Pyrrha had a fit body but this is incredible" She thought before getting ready for her dinner with Yang. She left and stood in front of Yang who was still sitting on her bed*

"Ready Blake?" Yang said with a smirk on her face and heading towards the door

"Yeah, let's go" Blake quickly going to her bed and grabbing the remote and putting it in her pocket, reluctantly following Yang out of the room

1523222112.content:
Blake followed Yang silently.

“Come on, Blake.” Yang said. “Don’t be like that. I’ll take you to that fish place you like as thanks.”

Blake’s bow would have twitched if she had her ears, but it didn’t since she was in Pyrrha’s body. She actually hadn’t been quiet about going to the club, though she didn’t want to. No, she was quiet because she was examining her new body. Though, she didn’t really want to keep it right now. It was just something new she was checking. Blake decided to undo the swap.

She did feel more comfortable in her own body.

“Getting out and socializing will do you some good.” Yang added. “We got to get you out of the room sometimes.”

“I do get out.” Blake pointed out. “Training, class, I go to Vale to get books-…”

“Don’t make yourself sound like a nerd,” Yang interjected. “You’re way too hot for that.”

Blake’s cheeks flushed ever so slightly. Still as, they closed in on the front doors of Beacon, Blake began to look around. A Life Swap would get her out of this and she could test out that function too. From what she understood, she would keep her body, but live someone’s life as them with their clothes. Everyone would see her as them.

The only two people she saw that she knew were Pyrrha and Jaune coming from the training wing. They must have been practicing. Jaune was one of the lowest performing students, so he needed all the practice he could get. Blake would have to swap with them to avoid going out with Yang or hope a better target showed up before they got to Vale.

choices: Make Cardin less on a man
Forget it and go to team JNPR's room
Undo the swap
15232221122.content:
Blake's curiosity and a weird desire lead her to point the remote at Jaune. She didn't know why but it just interested her to try it. A flash goes off as she presses the Life Swap button and found herself walking next to Pyrrha wearing Jaune's clothes and carrying his shield. The armor adjusted for her but it was really uncomfortable for her, not to mention the her new hoodie and jeans didn't feel like good combat attire. She looked up to see Yang and Jaune walking away and noticed Jaune wearing her clothes.

"Nothing too out of the ordinary" She thought reaching up and feeling she no longer had her cat ears. Her assumption was that with Jaune assuming her life, that he gained her Faunus traits.

"Jaune, is everything alright?" Pyrrha said looking at Blake.

"Yeah Pyrrha. I'm fine. Just a little sore" Blake replied, trying to stretch. She figured her body was a little tight because of the added armor but she was aching from head to toe

"Well I feel like we're really making progress Jaune and we'll have that semblance unlocked in no time" Pyrrha talked with such confidence and hope that Blake couldn't help but a little excited. As they were walking back the both decided that they should get something to eat before going back to their dorm room. Both go to the cafeteria to get some dinner and talk about how the training went.

"We may just need to focus more on concentrating rather than combat for a bit. Maybe that's the key to unlocking your semblance" Pyrrha suggested as Blake ate. Blake couldn't help but think about Pyrrha, after all she had her body for a little bit.

"I wonder if there are any flaws with her? She can beat Yang in combat and she can out smart Weiss. What's she not good at?" Blake thought to herself, not paying attention to what her partner was saying.

"Does that sound good Jaune?" Pyrrha asked

"Huh? Yeah,sounds great Pyrrha" Blake responded with a little panic in her voice.

"Good. Maybe we can get Ren and Nora to help" Pyrrha said before continuing to eat her food.

Blake's hidden desires were only partially fulfilled. Even though she was living the life of a boy, even though Jaune has flaws, she was missing the part that really made a man a man. She clenched the remote in her pocket looking around the room. The cafeteria was participial empty because it was so late and she didn't have many choices.

She decided to hold off and finish her meal. Pyrrha was sitting patiently for her to finish so they could return to their room.

"Ready Jaune?" Pyrrha said with a smile on her face. She had already stood up from the table before Blake could respond.

Blake just nodded and stood up, keeping an eye on the room just in case she found someone to swap with. Sadly there was no one for. As they leave Cardin comes in and shoves Blake to the ground only for Pyrrha to help her up.

"My bad Arc. Didn't see you there" He said with a smirk on his face and spitting on the ground next to her.

"Cardin! We both know you did that on purpose!" Pyrrha spit back at him after helping Blake up

"This doesn't concern you Nikos!" He yelled back.

Pyrrha got in his face and just stared him in the eyes. He glared back before heading into the cafeteria. Blake felt so helpless in the situation, like she couldn't defend herself.

"Are you okay Jaune? And don't worry about him" Pyrrha exhaled at turned back to Blake.

"I'm fine. Thanks Pyrrha" Blake said looking down at the remote in her pocket.
15232221122.title: Her hidden desires couldn't resist Life Swa...

152322211223.content:
Blake held off her anger and proceeded back to Team JNPR's dorm. She hadn't felt that helpless and couldn't figure out what happened. The more she thought about it, the more it frustrated her. She couldn't figure it out and pulled out the remote, staring at it while walking with Pyrrha. "Maybe I Yang was right and I should loosen up" She thought to herself as her finger lingered over the undo button. She wasn't too sure where she'd end up but it was a little excited to find out. As she pressed the button a bright flash went off and she found herself sitting at a table in a club.

"C'mon Blake! Stop being shy and dance!" Yang yelled from the dance floor. Blake looked around the club and then the remote. The club was a place Blake wouldn't be caught dead in by herself and even though she was there with Yang it still made her incredible uncomfortable. Yang came off the dance floor and grabbed her hand, "Didn't you hear me, let's get out there and dance!" Blake nodded not letting go of the remote and aimed it at a random girl in the club, "Maybe a personality swap will help me" she thought. As she the flash went off she felt so energetic, she stood up and dragged Yang out to the dance floor. Both girls proceeded to dance and have a great time, maybe the most fun Blake had in a long time. "This is incredible! I've never had so much fun!" she yelled to Yang.

The whole time she kept tabs on the remote in her pocket, even though she was enjoying her new outgoing personality she won't want to stay like this. She noticed Yang was heading back to the table she was sitting at before the swap. She practically skipped back to the table and sat down next to Yang. "Getting tired?" Blake asked resting her head in her hands. Yang leaned back and smiled, "As if, the night just started!" Blake held the remote in her pocket tightly, debating on telling her teammate about the device. "Yang, I have something to show you!" Blake yelled over the music. "Can it wait until this song is over? It's my jam!" Yang yelled in reply as she stood up and got back out to the dance floor.

Blake just sat back and took the remote out, her new personality was telling her to use the remote more. "Gosh, did I swap personalities with Ruby? I need to fix this" She thought to herself looking around the club. She knew she could just press undo but there was no fun in that. A pair of girls on the upper floor caught her eye. One wearing a white dress, like something she'd imagine Weiss owning, and the other a black and red dress.

https://i.redd.it/7sv84rjtxch21.jpg

"I've only done body swap once, lets try it again" Blake thought as she smiled and pointed at the one in red. In a flash she saw her body overseeing the club wearing the girls red dress. Blake looked down at herself and admired her work. "Not bad" she thought patting her chest and running and hand along her torso. Lastly she checked her hair, it was shorter than what Blake normally had and felt much lighter in volume than her's.

Next thing she knew Yang was at the table and telling her they had to leave. Blake stood up and stumbled before her body adjusted and swiftly exited the club. "What happened Yang? Why did we leave?" Blake asked as she crossed her arms, a little shocked by her new bratty sounding voice. Yang put her hands behind her head and smiled, "I may have a problem with the owner and I'd rather not ruin our night because of a fight" Blake couldn't help but blush at her concern for the night. That feeling quickly faded as she reached for her pocket to find the remote missing. Blake's face turned pain as she started to panic.

What was she going to do?
152322211223.title: Undo the swap

choices: "Get revenge on those two bitches."

1523222112232.content:
Oh, heeeellll no.

Blake’s new personality would not let her leave that amazing remote behind.

“I forgot something important,” Blake said to Yang. “We need to go back and get it.”

“You got it.” Yang replied without a second thought.

They snuck back in and Blake immediately went to the table. The remote wasn’t there. For a moment, she panicked. If someone else found it, there was no way she would get it back. Luckily, a quick scan of the crowd and she saw a guy holding it. He was one of the club’s bouncer goons and Blake ran over to him.

“That’s mine.” She told him. The guy stopped and looked at her.

“Why would you bring a remote to a club?” He asked.

“None of your business.” Blake snapped, before releasing her new personality took charge.

“Then no.” He replied.

“She told you to give!” Yang cried, and punched the guy, sending him flying. He dropped the remote and Blake picked it up.

“You again!”

Blake and Yang looked up to see the two girls in the red and white dresses rushing toward them. Seeing herself wearing the red dress and wielding claws was kind of disconcerting to Blake. She quickly jumped back to avoid the attack and did a summersault kick to send the girl reeling back. Yang parried the kick from the girl in white and tossed her over a table.

“Bail!” Yang yelled and Blake didn’t need telling twice.

They dashed out of the club and Blake found herself laughing. This was the most fun she had that she could remember. Her new personality loved causing trouble. The best part was it didn’t get rid of Blake completely. She still had her memories. It was just her feelings and desires changed a bit. Logical thinking was still an option and she knew she could suppress the desires if needed.

“Spill it Blakey,” Yang said, pointing to the remote. “What the heck is that for?”

“It will be easier if I show you,” Blake said. “Here touch it.” Yang looked confused, but did as she was asked. Blake hit the Undo Button, not the reset. She wanted to keep the personality for now. It made things more fun with Yang around. There was a flash of light and Blake had her own body back.

“W-wha…how… but….explain!” Yang finally said.

It took some time to explain the remote and it’s functions. As Blake told her what it was capable of, Yang’s smile kept growing bigger.

“I take it you have a plan?” Blake asked excitedly.

“Oh, yeah!” Yang confirmed. “Let’s…”

15232221122321.content:
Blake smiled at spun the remote in her hand. "How are we going to do this?" she said tapping the remote against her chin, she knew it had to be something big. Both girls stood outside the club thinking of how they would get back at them. "I mean body swap is the obvious choice but I'm not sure I'd want to give my body to them" Yang said poking down at her body. Blake wasn't too concerned about it since she had already given her body to one of the girls already.

"We could go with a life swap? That way we keep our bodies and get to party all night" Blake said as she placed a hand on her hip. Her new personality taking over and letting her enjoy herself more and Yang wasn't complaining. "Alright Blake, how are we getting in? Same as before?" Yang replied with a grin and motioned towards the door. "You know it" Blake nodded and gripped the remote tight.

Both girls walked into the club as the bouncers and thugs cleaned up the mess from their little scuffle. "Hey Boys!" Blake shouted. Every thug that was preoccupied with cleaning dropped what they were doing and rushed Blake. Yang swooped in and laid out the incoming assault. While Yang dealt with them, Blake scanned the club for the twins. She ran up to the second floor that oversaw the club, scanning the room for them.

"You're so dead! A voice shouted from behind Blake. Both girls ambushed her from behind and forced Blake back to the first floor. Yang had easily handled the thugs and rushed to Blake's side. "I'm guessing you found the brats?" Yang said getting into a fighting stance. "Oh yeah, get ready" Blake replied grabbing Yang's hand and placing it on the remote. The Malachite twins stood on the other side of the dance floor.

"You girls like ruined our club and night" The one in red said. "It's time we teach you a lesson" The other said. Blake and Yang smiled to each other. "Which one do you want Yang?" Blake asked as her thumb hovered over the button. "I'll take red, white was never my color" Yang replied pressing Blake's thumb into the button. A flash went off and they found themselves on the other side of the floor wearing the twins clothes. Blake and Yang looked at each other and turned towards with twins. "Ready?" Yang said with a smirk, wielding her new claws. Miltia, the one Yang had swapped with, rushed in and was swiftly greeted by Yang and her fist. Blake put the remote down on a near by table and motioned to a thug, "Keep this safe and away from those girls" She commanded before joining the fight.

Blake and Yang easily handled the "troublemakers" and stood over them in victory. "Oh Boys will you throw these girls out" Yang commanded putting a hand on her hip, looking at her new attire. Blake had walked back to the table and grabbed the remote. Both girls decided to go up to the second floor and oversee the club. The bouncers threw the Malachite twins out the front door and the club slowly resumed business as usual.

"That was fun" Blake said with a smile clenching the remote in her hand and looking to Yang

"Yeah..what else can your magic remote do?" Yang asked with a devilish grin

"We're just getting started....." Blake replied

152322211223212.content:
“Where did you find this thing anyways?” Yang asked.

“Just lying around,” Blake admitted. “Been testing it a bit before showing it to you.”

“And I love you for showing me this,” Yang said and Blake grinned back as Yang put her arm over Blake’s shoulders. “So, what else can it do besides Body, Clothes, and Life?”

“Personality and Personal Information,” Blake replied. “Pretty much, if you can picture two things between you and someone else, you can swap it.”

“I really want to question how this is possible, but I figured you have no idea.” Yang commented.

“Not a clue.”

“Well, let’s have fun with in until we do,” Yang suggested. She stretched and her chest jiggled in the red dress of hers. “What should we do first?”

“I take it we are staying as the twins?” Blake asked.

“I don’t see why not? We aren’t getting thrown out.”

Blake tapped her cheek.

“Good point.” She laughed. “We can swap back later. Let’s party some more.”

“God, I love partying with you.” Yang said. Blake realized that because the personality swap happened before Yang knew and touched the remote, she assumed Blake had always been like this. “What should we do first? Drink? Dance? Flirt?”

‘All of the above?” Blake suggested and Yang high fived her.

“Though, we are living the lives of these two bitches,” Yang said. “We should take that into account.”

“How much do you hate these two?” Blake asked.

“They cut my hair once, Blake.” Yang replied.

“Oh.” Well, that made sense. “If you don’t just want to party as them, we could drink a ton and flirt with ugly guys. Once we swap back, they have to deal with the hangover and the guys trying to contact them.”

“You are devious, you know that Kitty Kat?” Yang laughed. “Why not just get them into a mess of trouble while we’re at it?”

"Let's enjoy the night, I mean we work here or something, right?" Blake said running a hand along Yang's shoulder before getting a drink.

"True and it looks like the party is getting started again" Yang replied with a smirk. She walked over to grab a drink and downed it. "Might as well enjoy ourselves"

Blake and Yang smiled to each other and couldn't help but laugh. After composing themselves they headed down to the dance floor and proceeded to dance the night away. Both occasionally stopping to get drinks and with the patrons. Blake kept a tight hold of the remote as she danced but as the night went on and the more drinks she got it became harder.

"I need to stash is thing away before I lose it again" She thought as she staggered off the dance floor. Her overzealous personality was causing her a bit of a problem for the first time since she acquired it. She knew she could put it on the second floor but she'd have to make it there. Quickly looking around and she could see Yang at the bar getting more drinks for them.

Yang cheerfully sat at the bar and drank both drinks before getting back out to dance. She was handling her booze better than Blake but she was still struggling. She stayed out on the dance floor as Blake staggered up the stairs. "Aww, poor Blake must be struggling" She slurred and kept going. Her feet were killing her because of her heels but she figured she could deal with it for the rest of the night.

Blake finally made it up to the second floor and slumped over in a nearby chair. "This remote is incredible" she said as she held it up. She was resisting every urge to use it again but she knew Yang would want to be a part of it. She drank out of a glass that had been sitting on the table next to her and stood up. "One swap won't hurt and she won't even notice" She said with a smirk and pointed at the crowd, she was eyeing up a girl in a short black dress and clicked the wardrobe swap. "Much better" Blake thought as she hid the remote under the chair. She headed back to the dance floor and was greeted by Yang with a drink.

"What were you doing up there?" Yang asked as she get closer to Blake

"Stashed the remote up there. Didn't want to lose it" Blake replied downing her drink

"Good idea. Wouldn't want that" Yang said as she started to grind against Blake.

Blake couldn't help but enjoy the sensation and pleasure she was getting from Yang. Both girls continued to dance and drink with each other. Eventually the club started to clear out just leaving the girls to themselves. Both girls stumbled up the stairs and passed out.

15232221122321231.content:
“…My head…” Blake groaned, as sunlight shown through the window.

She felt terrible. Her head was pounding, she was nauseous, and Yang was snoring a few feet away from her. It took all her strength to slowly push herself up and stagger to the bathroom. The reflection in the mirror looked terrible. Her black hair was a mess, though it was shorter than her normal hair. The Life Swap function swapped hair along with lives for some reason. The makeup she was wear was messed up and her black dressed was stained with some drink.

“When did I swap clothes?” Blake muttered. Last night was kind of a blur.

“Mmm… Blake?” Yang sat up. “Crap, my head is killing me.”

“Join the club.” Blake muttered. “We forgot to enact your plan. We got wasted.”

“Good night then.” Yang tried to joke. “Though, drinking too much is liable to tequila-you.”

Blake groaned and threw a pillow at her.

“Let’s just get the remote and swap back,” Blake muttered. “Get rid of this hangover.”

“Yeah, I agree with you.” Yang held a hand up to her mouth. “One sec…. hmph.”

Blake waited as Yang ran to the bathroom and released the contents of her stomach. The two of them then went up to the second floor and looked for the chair Blake hid the remote in. Luckily, no one else had found it and Blake was about to take it back, when Yang grinned.

“Wait!” She said.

“What?” Blake asked.

“Strip and toss your clothes over the edge.” Yang said.

“What?!” Blake was shocked. “Why?”

“When we swap back, the remote goes with us, right?” Yang said. “So those bitches will be stuck here nude.”

“Oh.” Blake grinned deviously as her new personality took over. “Good idea.”

The second they were naked, Blake hit the Undo Button three times. One for the outfit and the other two for their lives. Part of her didn’t want to get rid of her new outgoing personality. The world blurred and they found themselves in their dorm room, on their respective beds, as Weiss and Ruby were heading out.

‘…lucky it’s Sunday and we don’t have class,” Weiss was telling them. “Why we have to have 2 party girls on our team is beyond me. Thank god Ruby isn’t like you two.”

“Drinking nasty alcohol and in crowds, yuck.’ Ruby said, as they left.

“I don’t feel hungover at all.” Yang said. “Looks like the twins in our lives came back after we kicked them out.”

“Now they have to deal with being naked.” Blake replied and they laughed. “What now, Yang? We using the remote some more?”

“Of course.”

"Great. Who to swap with next?" Yang said as she hopped out of bed and crouched next to Blake.

"Not sure, But there are plenty of students to choose from" Blake replied a sitting up in bed and stretching. "It's so nice not having the hangover." She added picking up the remote.

"Yeah. How about we go get some breakfast and think about it on the way?" Yang said standing up and walking towards the bathroom.
